                    url_to_asset(source, { type: :stylesheet }.merge!(options))
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    362. 
            1
            

            

                  alias_method :url_to_stylesheet, :stylesheet_url # aliased to avoid conflicts with a stylesheet_url named route
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

            
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

                  # Computes the path to an image asset.
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                  # Full paths from the document root will be passed through.
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

                  # Used internally by +image_tag+ to build the image path:
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                  #   image_path("edit")                                         # => "/assets/edit"
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                  #   image_path("edit.png")                                     # => "/assets/edit.png"
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

                  #   image_path("icons/edit.png")                               # => "/assets/icons/edit.png"
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

                  #   image_path("/icons/edit.png")                              # => "/icons/edit.png"
          
      372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    372. 
            
            

            

                  #   image_path("http://www.example.com/img/edit.png")          # => "http://www.example.com/img/edit.png"
          
      373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    373. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

                  # If you have images as application resources this method may conflict with their named routes.
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

                  # The alias +path_to_image+ is provided to avoid that. Rails uses the alias internally, and
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                  # plugin authors are encouraged to do so.
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            1
            

            

                  def image_path(source, options = {})
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                    path_to_asset(source, { type: :image }.merge!(options))
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            1
            

            

                  alias_method :path_to_image, :image_path # aliased to avoid conflicts with an image_path named route
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

            
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

                  # Computes the full URL to an image asset.
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

                  # This will use +image_path+ internally, so most of their behaviors will be the same.
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                  # Since +image_url+ is based on +asset_url+ method you can set :host options. If :host
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                  # options is set, it overwrites global +config.action_controller.asset_host+ setting.
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                  #   image_url "edit.png", host: "http://stage.example.com" # => http://stage.example.com/assets/edit.png
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            1

      390.

                  end
          
      392.

            1
            

            

                  alias_method :url_to_image, :image_url # aliased to avoid conflicts with an image_url named route
          
      393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    393. 
            
            

            

            
          
      394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    394. 
            
            

            

                  # Computes the path to a video asset in the public videos directory.
          
      395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    395. 
            
            

            

                  # Full paths from the document root will be passed through.
          
      396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    396. 
            
            

            

                  # Used internally by +video_tag+ to build the video path.
          
      397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    397. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

                  #   video_path("hd")                                            # => /videos/hd
          
      399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    399. 
            
            

            

                  #   video_path("hd.avi")                                        # => /videos/hd.avi
          
      400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    400. 
            
            

            

                  #   video_path("trailers/hd.avi")                               # => /videos/trailers/hd.avi
          
      401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    401. 
            
            

            

                  #   video_path("/trailers/hd.avi")                              # => /trailers/hd.avi
          
      402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    402. 
            
            

            

                  #   video_path("http://www.example.com/vid/hd.avi")             # => http://www.example.com/vid/hd.avi
          
      403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    403. 
            1
            

            

                  def video_path(source, options = {})

      405.

      406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    406. 
            1
            

            

                  alias_method :path_to_video, :video_path # aliased to avoid conflicts with a video_path named route

                  # Computes the full URL to a video asset in the public videos directory.
          
      409.

      410.

      411.

                  # options is set, it overwrites global +config.action_controller.asset_host+ setting.
          
      412.

                  #

                  # Computes the path to an audio asset in the public audios directory.
          
      421.

                  # Full paths from the document root will be passed through.
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

                  # Used internally by +audio_tag+ to build the audio path.
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    424. 
            
            

            

                  #   audio_path("horse")                                            # => /audios/horse
          
      425.

                  #   audio_path("horse.wav")                                        # => /audios/horse.wav
          
      426.

      427.

                  #   audio_path("/sounds/horse.wav")                                # => /sounds/horse.wav
          
      428.

                  #   audio_path("http://www.example.com/sounds/horse.wav")          # => http://www.example.com/sounds/horse.wav
          
      429. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    429. 
            1
            

            

                  def audio_path(source, options = {})
          
      430. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    430. 
            
            

            

                    path_to_asset(source, { type: :audio }.merge!(options))
          
      431. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    431. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      432. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    432. 
            1
            

            

                  alias_method :path_to_audio, :audio_path # aliased to avoid conflicts with an audio_path named route
          
      433. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    433. 
            
            

            

            
          
      434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    434. 
            
            

            

                  # Computes the full URL to an audio asset in the public audios directory.
          
      435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    435. 
            
            

            

                  # This will use +audio_path+ internally, so most of their behaviors will be the same.
          
      436. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    436. 
            
            

            

                  # Since +audio_url+ is based on +asset_url+ method you can set :host options. If :host
          
      437. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    437. 
            
            

            

                  # options is set, it overwrites global +config.action_controller.asset_host+ setting.
          
      438. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    438. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      439. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    439. 
            
            

            

                  #   audio_url "horse.wav", host: "http://stage.example.com" # => http://stage.example.com/audios/horse.wav
          
      440. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    440. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      441. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    441. 
            1
            

            

                  def audio_url(source, options = {})

                  end
          
      444.

                  # The options for atom_feed are:
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:language</tt>: Defaults to "en-US".
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:root_url</tt>: The HTML alternative that this feed is doubling for. Defaults to / on the current host.
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:url</tt>: The URL for this feed. Defaults to the current URL.
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:id</tt>: The id for this feed. Defaults to "tag:localhost,2005:/posts", in this case.
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:schema_date</tt>: The date at which the tag scheme for the feed was first used. A good default is the year you
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  #   created the feed. See http://feedvalidator.org/docs/error/InvalidTAG.html for more information. If not specified,
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  #   2005 is used (as an "I don't care" value).
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:instruct</tt>: Hash of XML processing instructions in the form {target => {attribute => value, }} or {target => [{attribute => value, }, ]}
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  # Other namespaces can be added to the root element:
          
      64.

                  # The Atom spec defines five elements (content rights title subtitle
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  # summary) which may directly contain xhtml content if type: 'xhtml'
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  # is specified as an attribute. If so, this helper will take care of
          
      88.

                  # the enclosing div and xhtml namespace declaration. Example usage:

                  #
          
      97.

                  # <tt>atom_feed</tt> yields an +AtomFeedBuilder+ instance. Nested elements yield
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  # an +AtomBuilder+ instance.
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            1
            

            

                  def atom_feed(options = {}, &block)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                    if options[:schema_date]
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                      options[:schema_date] = options[:schema_date].strftime("%Y-%m-%d") if options[:schema_date].respond_to?(:strftime)
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                      options[:schema_date] = "2005" # The Atom spec copyright date
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

            
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                    xml = options.delete(:xml) || eval("xml", block.binding)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                    xml.instruct!
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                    if options[:instruct]
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                      options[:instruct].each do |target, attrs|
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                        if attrs.respond_to?(:keys)
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                          xml.instruct!(target, attrs)
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                        elsif attrs.respond_to?(:each)
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                          attrs.each { |attr_group| xml.instruct!(target, attr_group) }
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

            
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                    feed_opts = { "xml:lang" => options[:language] || "en-US", "xmlns" => "http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" }
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                    feed_opts.merge!(options).select! { |k, _| k.start_with?("xml") }
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

            
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                    xml.feed(feed_opts) do
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                      xml.id(options[:id] || "tag:#{request.host},#{options[:schema_date]}:#{request.fullpath.split(".")[0]}")
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                      xml.link(rel: "alternate", type: "text/html", href: options[:root_url] || (request.protocol + request.host_with_port))
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                      xml.link(rel: "self", type: "application/atom+xml", href: options[:url] || request.url)
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

            
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                      yield AtomFeedBuilder.new(xml, self, options)
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            1
            

            

                  class AtomBuilder #:nodoc:
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            1
            

            

                    XHTML_TAG_NAMES = %w(content rights title subtitle summary).to_set
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

            
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            1
            

            

                    def initialize(xml)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                      @xml = xml
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

            
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            1
            

            

                    private
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                      # Delegate to xml builder, first wrapping the element in an xhtml
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                      # namespaced div element if the method and arguments indicate
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                      # that an xhtml_block? is desired.
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            1
            

            

                      def method_missing(method, *arguments, &block)
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                        if xhtml_block?(method, arguments)
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                          @xml.__send__(method, *arguments) do
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                            @xml.div(xmlns: "http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml") do |xhtml|
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                              block.call(xhtml)
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                            end
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                          end
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                          @xml.__send__(method, *arguments, &block)
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

            
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                      # True if the method name matches one of the five elements defined
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                      # in the Atom spec as potentially containing XHTML content and
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                      # if type: 'xhtml' is, in fact, specified.
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            1
            

            

                      def xhtml_block?(method, arguments)
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                        if XHTML_TAG_NAMES.include?(method.to_s)
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                          last = arguments.last
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                          last.is_a?(Hash) && last[:type].to_s == "xhtml"
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            1
            

            

                  class AtomFeedBuilder < AtomBuilder #:nodoc:
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            1
            

            

                    def initialize(xml, view, feed_options = {})
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                      @xml, @view, @feed_options = xml, view, feed_options
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                    # Accepts a Date or Time object and inserts it in the proper format. If +nil+ is passed, current time in UTC is used.
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            1
            

            

                    def updated(date_or_time = nil)
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                      @xml.updated((date_or_time || Time.now.utc).xmlschema)
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                    # Creates an entry tag for a specific record and prefills the id using class and id.
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                    # Options:
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                    # * <tt>:published</tt>: Time first published. Defaults to the created_at attribute on the record if one such exists.
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                    # * <tt>:updated</tt>: Time of update. Defaults to the updated_at attribute on the record if one such exists.
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                    # * <tt>:url</tt>: The URL for this entry or +false+ or +nil+ for not having a link tag. Defaults to the +polymorphic_url+ for the record.
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                    # * <tt>:id</tt>: The ID for this entry. Defaults to "tag:#{@view.request.host},#{@feed_options[:schema_date]}:#{record.class}/#{record.id}"
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                    # * <tt>:type</tt>: The TYPE for this entry. Defaults to "text/html".
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            1
            

            

                    def entry(record, options = {})
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                      @xml.entry do
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                        @xml.id(options[:id] || "tag:#{@view.request.host},#{@feed_options[:schema_date]}:#{record.class}/#{record.id}")
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

            
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                        if options[:published] || (record.respond_to?(:created_at) && record.created_at)
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                          @xml.published((options[:published] || record.created_at).xmlschema)
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

            
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                        if options[:updated] || (record.respond_to?(:updated_at) && record.updated_at)
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                          @xml.updated((options[:updated] || record.updated_at).xmlschema)
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

            
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                        type = options.fetch(:type, "text/html")
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

            
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                        url = options.fetch(:url) { @view.polymorphic_url(record) }
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                        @xml.link(rel: "alternate", type: type, href: url) if url
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

            
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                        yield AtomBuilder.new(@xml)
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      207.

    lib/action_view/helpers/cache_helper.rb

    28.26% lines covered

    46 relevant lines. 13 lines covered and 33 lines missed.

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            1
            

            

            module ActionView
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

              # = Action View Cache Helper
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            1
            

            

              module Helpers #:nodoc:
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            1
            

            

                module CacheHelper
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                  # This helper exposes a method for caching fragments of a view
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                  # rather than an entire action or page. This technique is useful
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                  # caching pieces like menus, lists of new topics, static HTML
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                  # fragments, and so on. This method takes a block that contains
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                  # the content you wish to cache.
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  # The best way to use this is by doing recyclable key-based cache expiration
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  # on top of a cache store like Memcached or Redis that'll automatically
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                  # kick out old entries.
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  # When using this method, you list the cache dependency as the name of the cache, like so:
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% cache project do %>
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  #     <b>All the topics on this project</b>
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= render project.topics %>
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                  # This approach will assume that when a new topic is added, you'll touch
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  # the project. The cache key generated from this call will be something like:
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  #   views/template/action:7a1156131a6928cb0026877f8b749ac9/projects/123
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  #         ^template path  ^template tree digest            ^class   ^id
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  # This cache key is stable, but it's combined with a cache version derived from the project
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  # record. When the project updated_at is touched, the #cache_version changes, even
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  # if the key stays stable. This means that unlike a traditional key-based cache expiration
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  # approach, you won't be generating cache trash, unused keys, simply because the dependent
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                  # record is updated.
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  # If your template cache depends on multiple sources (try to avoid this to keep things simple),
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                  # you can name all these dependencies as part of an array:
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% cache [ project, current_user ] do %>
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                  #     <b>All the topics on this project</b>
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= render project.topics %>
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  # This will include both records as part of the cache key and updating either of them will
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  # expire the cache.
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== \Template digest
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  # The template digest that's added to the cache key is computed by taking an MD5 of the
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  # contents of the entire template file. This ensures that your caches will automatically
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  # expire when you change the template file.
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  # Note that the MD5 is taken of the entire template file, not just what's within the
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  # cache do/end call. So it's possible that changing something outside of that call will
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  # still expire the cache.
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  # Additionally, the digestor will automatically look through your template file for
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  # explicit and implicit dependencies, and include those as part of the digest.
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  # The digestor can be bypassed by passing skip_digest: true as an option to the cache call:
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% cache project, skip_digest: true do %>
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  #     <b>All the topics on this project</b>
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= render project.topics %>
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Implicit dependencies
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  # Most template dependencies can be derived from calls to render in the template itself.
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  # Here are some examples of render calls that Cache Digests knows how to decode:
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                  #   render partial: "comments/comment", collection: commentable.comments
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  #   render "comments/comments"
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  #   render 'comments/comments'
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  #   render('comments/comments')
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #   render "header" translates to render("comments/header")
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  #   render(@topic)         translates to render("topics/topic")
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  #   render(topics)         translates to render("topics/topic")
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  #   render(message.topics) translates to render("topics/topic")
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  # It's not possible to derive all render calls like that, though.
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  # Here are a few examples of things that can't be derived:
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  #   render group_of_attachments
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  #   render @project.documents.where(published: true).order('created_at')
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  # You will have to rewrite those to the explicit form:
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  #   render partial: 'attachments/attachment', collection: group_of_attachments
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  #   render partial: 'documents/document', collection: @project.documents.where(published: true).order('created_at')
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  # === Explicit dependencies
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  # Sometimes you'll have template dependencies that can't be derived at all. This is typically
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  # the case when you have template rendering that happens in helpers. Here's an example:
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= render_sortable_todolists @project.todolists %>
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  # You'll need to use a special comment format to call those out:
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%# Template Dependency: todolists/todolist %>
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= render_sortable_todolists @project.todolists %>
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                  # In some cases, like a single table inheritance setup, you might have
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  # a bunch of explicit dependencies. Instead of writing every template out,
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  # you can use a wildcard to match any template in a directory:
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%# Template Dependency: events/* %>
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= render_categorizable_events @person.events %>
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  # This marks every template in the directory as a dependency. To find those
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  # templates, the wildcard path must be absolutely defined from <tt>app/views</tt> or paths
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  # otherwise added with +prepend_view_path+ or +append_view_path+.
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  # This way the wildcard for <tt>app/views/recordings/events</tt> would be <tt>recordings/events/*</tt> etc.
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  # The pattern used to match explicit dependencies is <tt>/# Template Dependency: (\S+)/</tt>,
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  # so it's important that you type it out just so.
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  # You can only declare one template dependency per line.
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  # === External dependencies
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  # If you use a helper method, for example, inside a cached block and
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  # you then update that helper, you'll have to bump the cache as well.
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  # It doesn't really matter how you do it, but the MD5 of the template file
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  # must change. One recommendation is to simply be explicit in a comment, like:
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%# Helper Dependency Updated: May 6, 2012 at 6pm %>
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= some_helper_method(person) %>
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  # Now all you have to do is change that timestamp when the helper method changes.
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                  # === Collection Caching
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                  # When rendering a collection of objects that each use the same partial, a <tt>:cached</tt>
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  # option can be passed.
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  # For collections rendered such:
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= render partial: 'projects/project', collection: @projects, cached: true %>
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  # The <tt>cached: true</tt> will make Action View's rendering read several templates
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  # from cache at once instead of one call per template.
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  # Templates in the collection not already cached are written to cache.
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  # Works great alongside individual template fragment caching.
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  # For instance if the template the collection renders is cached like:
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  #   # projects/_project.html.erb
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% cache project do %>
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%# ... %>
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  # Any collection renders will find those cached templates when attempting
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  # to read multiple templates at once.
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  # If your collection cache depends on multiple sources (try to avoid this to keep things simple),
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  # you can name all these dependencies as part of a block that returns an array:
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= render partial: 'projects/project', collection: @projects, cached: -> project { [ project, current_user ] } %>
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  # This will include both records as part of the cache key and updating either of them will
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  # expire the cache.
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            1
            

            

                  def cache(name = {}, options = {}, &block)
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                    if controller.respond_to?(:perform_caching) && controller.perform_caching
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                      name_options = options.slice(:skip_digest)
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                      safe_concat(fragment_for(cache_fragment_name(name, **name_options), options, &block))
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                      yield
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                    nil
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

            
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  # Cache fragments of a view if +condition+ is true
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178.

      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% cache_if admin?, project do %>
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  #     <b>All the topics on this project</b>
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= render project.topics %>
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            1
            

            

                  def cache_if(condition, name = {}, options = {}, &block)
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                    if condition
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                      cache(name, options, &block)
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                      yield
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

            
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                    nil

      192.
