                # = Action View Date Helpers
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                # The Date Helper primarily creates select/option tags for different kinds of dates and times or date and time
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                # elements. All of the select-type methods share a number of common options that are as follows:
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:prefix</tt> - overwrites the default prefix of "date" used for the select names. So specifying "birthday"
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                #   would give \birthday[month] instead of \date[month] if passed to the <tt>select_month</tt> method.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:include_blank</tt> - set to true if it should be possible to set an empty date.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:discard_type</tt> - set to true if you want to discard the type part of the select name. If set to true,
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                #   the <tt>select_month</tt> method would use simply "date" (which can be overwritten using <tt>:prefix</tt>) instead
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                #   of \date[month].
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            1
            

            

                module DateHelper
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            1
            

            

                  MINUTES_IN_YEAR = 525600
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            1
            

            

                  MINUTES_IN_QUARTER_YEAR = 131400
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            1
            

            

                  MINUTES_IN_THREE_QUARTERS_YEAR = 394200
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  # Reports the approximate distance in time between two Time, Date or DateTime objects or integers as seconds.
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  # Pass <tt>include_seconds: true</tt> if you want more detailed approximations when distance < 1 min, 29 secs.
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  # Distances are reported based on the following table:
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  #   0 <-> 29 secs                                                             # => less than a minute
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                  #   30 secs <-> 1 min, 29 secs                                                # => 1 minute
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                  #   1 min, 30 secs <-> 44 mins, 29 secs                                       # => [2..44] minutes
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  #   44 mins, 30 secs <-> 89 mins, 29 secs                                     # => about 1 hour
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                  #   89 mins, 30 secs <-> 23 hrs, 59 mins, 29 secs                             # => about [2..24] hours
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                  #   23 hrs, 59 mins, 30 secs <-> 41 hrs, 59 mins, 29 secs                     # => 1 day
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  #   41 hrs, 59 mins, 30 secs  <-> 29 days, 23 hrs, 59 mins, 29 secs           # => [2..29] days
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                  #   29 days, 23 hrs, 59 mins, 30 secs <-> 44 days, 23 hrs, 59 mins, 29 secs   # => about 1 month
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                  #   44 days, 23 hrs, 59 mins, 30 secs <-> 59 days, 23 hrs, 59 mins, 29 secs   # => about 2 months
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                  #   59 days, 23 hrs, 59 mins, 30 secs <-> 1 yr minus 1 sec                    # => [2..12] months
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  #   1 yr <-> 1 yr, 3 months                                                   # => about 1 year
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  #   1 yr, 3 months <-> 1 yr, 9 months                                         # => over 1 year
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  #   1 yr, 9 months <-> 2 yr minus 1 sec                                       # => almost 2 years
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  #   2 yrs <-> max time or date                                                # => (same rules as 1 yr)
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  # With <tt>include_seconds: true</tt> and the difference < 1 minute 29 seconds:
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  #   0-4   secs      # => less than 5 seconds
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  #   5-9   secs      # => less than 10 seconds
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  #   10-19 secs      # => less than 20 seconds
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  #   20-39 secs      # => half a minute
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  #   40-59 secs      # => less than a minute
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  #   60-89 secs      # => 1 minute
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  #   from_time = Time.now
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 50.minutes)                                # => about 1 hour
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, 50.minutes.from_now)                                   # => about 1 hour
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 15.seconds)                                # => less than a minute
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 15.seconds, include_seconds: true)         # => less than 20 seconds
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, 3.years.from_now)                                      # => about 3 years
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 60.hours)                                  # => 3 days
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 45.seconds, include_seconds: true)         # => less than a minute
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time - 45.seconds, include_seconds: true)         # => less than a minute
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, 76.seconds.from_now)                                   # => 1 minute
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 1.year + 3.days)                           # => about 1 year
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 3.years + 6.months)                        # => over 3 years
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 4.years + 9.days + 30.minutes + 5.seconds) # => about 4 years
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  #   to_time = Time.now + 6.years + 19.days
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, to_time, include_seconds: true)                        # => about 6 years
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(to_time, from_time, include_seconds: true)                        # => about 6 years
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(Time.now, Time.now)                                               # => less than a minute
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  # With the <tt>scope</tt> option, you can define a custom scope for Rails
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  # to look up the translation.
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  # For example you can define the following in your locale (e.g. en.yml).
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  #   datetime:
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  #     distance_in_words:
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #       short:
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  #         about_x_hours:
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  #           one: 'an hour'
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  #           other: '%{count} hours'
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  # See https://github.com/svenfuchs/rails-i18n/blob/master/rails/locale/en.yml
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  # for more examples.
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  # Which will then result in the following:
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  #   from_time = Time.now
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 50.minutes, scope: 'datetime.distance_in_words.short') # => "an hour"
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  #   distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, from_time + 3.hours, scope: 'datetime.distance_in_words.short')    # => "3 hours"
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            1
            

            

                  def distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, to_time = 0, options = {})
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                    options = {
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                      scope: :'datetime.distance_in_words'
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                    }.merge!(options)
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

            
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                    from_time = normalize_distance_of_time_argument_to_time(from_time)
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                    to_time = normalize_distance_of_time_argument_to_time(to_time)
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                    from_time, to_time = to_time, from_time if from_time > to_time
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                    distance_in_minutes = ((to_time - from_time) / 60.0).round
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                    distance_in_seconds = (to_time - from_time).round
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

            
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                    I18n.with_options locale: options[:locale], scope: options[:scope] do |locale|
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                      case distance_in_minutes
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                      when 0..1
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                        return distance_in_minutes == 0 ?
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                               locale.t(:less_than_x_minutes, count: 1) :
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                               locale.t(:x_minutes, count: distance_in_minutes) unless options[:include_seconds]
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

            
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                        case distance_in_seconds
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                        when 0..4   then locale.t :less_than_x_seconds, count: 5
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                        when 5..9   then locale.t :less_than_x_seconds, count: 10
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                        when 10..19 then locale.t :less_than_x_seconds, count: 20
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                        when 20..39 then locale.t :half_a_minute
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                        when 40..59 then locale.t :less_than_x_minutes, count: 1
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                        else             locale.t :x_minutes,           count: 1
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

            
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                      when 2...45           then locale.t :x_minutes,      count: distance_in_minutes
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                      when 45...90          then locale.t :about_x_hours,  count: 1
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                        # 90 mins up to 24 hours
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                      when 90...1440        then locale.t :about_x_hours,  count: (distance_in_minutes.to_f / 60.0).round
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                        # 24 hours up to 42 hours
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                      when 1440...2520      then locale.t :x_days,         count: 1
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                        # 42 hours up to 30 days
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                      when 2520...43200     then locale.t :x_days,         count: (distance_in_minutes.to_f / 1440.0).round
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                        # 30 days up to 60 days
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                      when 43200...86400    then locale.t :about_x_months, count: (distance_in_minutes.to_f / 43200.0).round
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                        # 60 days up to 365 days
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                      when 86400...525600   then locale.t :x_months,       count: (distance_in_minutes.to_f / 43200.0).round
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                        from_year = from_time.year
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                        from_year += 1 if from_time.month >= 3
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                        to_year = to_time.year
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                        to_year -= 1 if to_time.month < 3
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                        leap_years = (from_year > to_year) ? 0 : (from_year..to_year).count { |x| Date.leap?(x) }
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                        minute_offset_for_leap_year = leap_years * 1440
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                        # Discount the leap year days when calculating year distance.
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                        # e.g. if there are 20 leap year days between 2 dates having the same day
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                        # and month then the based on 365 days calculation
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                        # the distance in years will come out to over 80 years when in written
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                        # English it would read better as about 80 years.
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                        minutes_with_offset = distance_in_minutes - minute_offset_for_leap_year
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                        remainder                   = (minutes_with_offset % MINUTES_IN_YEAR)
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                        distance_in_years           = (minutes_with_offset.div MINUTES_IN_YEAR)
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                        if remainder < MINUTES_IN_QUARTER_YEAR
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                          locale.t(:about_x_years,  count: distance_in_years)
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                        elsif remainder < MINUTES_IN_THREE_QUARTERS_YEAR
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                          locale.t(:over_x_years,   count: distance_in_years)
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                          locale.t(:almost_x_years, count: distance_in_years + 1)
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

            
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  # Like <tt>distance_of_time_in_words</tt>, but where <tt>to_time</tt> is fixed to <tt>Time.now</tt>.
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(3.minutes.from_now)                 # => 3 minutes
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(3.minutes.ago)                      # => 3 minutes
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(Time.now - 15.hours)                # => about 15 hours
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(Time.now)                           # => less than a minute
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(Time.now, include_seconds: true) # => less than 5 seconds
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  #   from_time = Time.now - 3.days - 14.minutes - 25.seconds
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(from_time)      # => 3 days
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  #   from_time = (3.days + 14.minutes + 25.seconds).ago
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_ago_in_words(from_time)      # => 3 days
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  # Note that you cannot pass a <tt>Numeric</tt> value to <tt>time_ago_in_words</tt>.
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            1
            

            

                  def time_ago_in_words(from_time, options = {})
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                    distance_of_time_in_words(from_time, Time.now, options)
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

            
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            1
            

            

                  alias_method :distance_of_time_in_words_to_now, :time_ago_in_words
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

            
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a set of select tags (one for year, month, and day) pre-selected for accessing a specified date-based
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  # attribute (identified by +method+) on an object assigned to the template (identified by +object+).
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:use_month_numbers</tt> - Set to true if you want to use month numbers rather than month names (e.g.
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  #   "2" instead of "February").
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:use_two_digit_numbers</tt> - Set to true if you want to display two digit month and day numbers (e.g.
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                  #   "02" instead of "February" and "08" instead of "8").
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:use_short_month</tt>   - Set to true if you want to use abbreviated month names instead of full
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  #   month names (e.g. "Feb" instead of "February").
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:add_month_numbers</tt>  - Set to true if you want to use both month numbers and month names (e.g.
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                  #   "2 - February" instead of "February").
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:use_month_names</tt>   - Set to an array with 12 month names if you want to customize month names.
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                  #   Note: You can also use Rails' i18n functionality for this.
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:month_format_string</tt> - Set to a format string. The string gets passed keys +:number+ (integer)
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                  #   and +:name+ (string). A format string would be something like "%{name} (%<number>02d)" for example.
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                  #   See <tt>Kernel.sprintf</tt> for documentation on format sequences.
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:date_separator</tt>    - Specifies a string to separate the date fields. Default is "" (i.e. nothing).
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:time_separator</tt>    - Specifies a string to separate the time fields. Default is " : ".
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:datetime_separator</tt>- Specifies a string to separate the date and time fields. Default is " &mdash; ".
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:start_year</tt>        - Set the start year for the year select. Default is <tt>Date.today.year - 5</tt> if
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                  #   you are creating new record. While editing existing record, <tt>:start_year</tt> defaults to
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                  #   the current selected year minus 5.
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:end_year</tt>          - Set the end year for the year select. Default is <tt>Date.today.year + 5</tt> if
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                  #   you are creating new record. While editing existing record, <tt>:end_year</tt> defaults to
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                  #   the current selected year plus 5.
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:year_format</tt>       - Set format of years for year select. Lambda should be passed.
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:discard_day</tt>       - Set to true if you don't want to show a day select. This includes the day
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                  #   as a hidden field instead of showing a select field. Also note that this implicitly sets the day to be the
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                  #   first of the given month in order to not create invalid dates like 31 February.
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:discard_month</tt>     - Set to true if you don't want to show a month select. This includes the month
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                  #   as a hidden field instead of showing a select field. Also note that this implicitly sets :discard_day to true.
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:discard_year</tt>      - Set to true if you don't want to show a year select. This includes the year
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                  #   as a hidden field instead of showing a select field.
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:order</tt>             - Set to an array containing <tt>:day</tt>, <tt>:month</tt> and <tt>:year</tt> to
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                  #   customize the order in which the select fields are shown. If you leave out any of the symbols, the respective
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                  #   select will not be shown (like when you set <tt>discard_xxx: true</tt>. Defaults to the order defined in
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                  #   the respective locale (e.g. [:year, :month, :day] in the en locale that ships with Rails).
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:include_blank</tt>     - Include a blank option in every select field so it's possible to set empty
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                  #   dates.
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:default</tt>           - Set a default date if the affected date isn't set or is +nil+.
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:selected</tt>          - Set a date that overrides the actual value.
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:disabled</tt>          - Set to true if you want show the select fields as disabled.
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:prompt</tt>            - Set to true (for a generic prompt), a prompt string or a hash of prompt strings
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                  #   for <tt>:year</tt>, <tt>:month</tt>, <tt>:day</tt>, <tt>:hour</tt>, <tt>:minute</tt> and <tt>:second</tt>.
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                  #   Setting this option prepends a select option with a generic prompt  (Day, Month, Year, Hour, Minute, Seconds)
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                  #   or the given prompt string.
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:with_css_classes</tt>  - Set to true or a hash of strings. Use true if you want to assign generic styles for
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                  #   select tags. This automatically set classes 'year', 'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute' and 'second'. A hash of
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                  #   strings for <tt>:year</tt>, <tt>:month</tt>, <tt>:day</tt>, <tt>:hour</tt>, <tt>:minute</tt>, <tt>:second</tt>
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                  #   will extend the select type with the given value. Use +html_options+ to modify every select tag in the set.
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:use_hidden</tt>         - Set to true if you only want to generate hidden input tags.
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                  # If anything is passed in the +html_options+ hash it will be applied to every select tag in the set.
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                  # NOTE: Discarded selects will default to 1. So if no month select is available, January will be assumed.
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute.
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on")
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute,
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with the year in the year drop down box starting at 1995.
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on", start_year: 1995)
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute,
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with the year in the year drop down box starting at 1995, numbers used for months instead of words,
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                  #   # and without a day select box.
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on", start_year: 1995, use_month_numbers: true,
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  #                                     discard_day: true, include_blank: true)
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute,
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with two digit numbers used for months and days.
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on", use_two_digit_numbers: true)
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with the fields ordered as day, month, year rather than month, day, year.
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on", order: [:day, :month, :year])
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the user variable, in the birthday attribute
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                  #   # lacking a year field.
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("user", "birthday", order: [:month, :day])
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                  #   # which is initially set to the date 3 days from the current date
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on", default: 3.days.from_now)
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the article variable, in the written_on attribute
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                  #   # which is set in the form with today's date, regardless of the value in the Active Record object.
          
      270.

                  #   date_select("article", "written_on", selected: Date.today)
          
      271.

                  #
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that when POSTed is stored in the credit_card variable, in the bill_due attribute
          
      273.

                  #   # that will have a default day of 20.
          
      274.

                  #   # Generates a date select with custom prompts.

                  # The selects are prepared for multi-parameter assignment to an Active Record object.

    283. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

                  # Note: If the day is not included as an option but the month is, the day will be set to the 1st to ensure that
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

                  # all month choices are valid.
          
      286.

                  def date_select(object_name, method, options = {}, html_options = {})

    287. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::DateSelect.new(object_name, method, self, options, html_options).render
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

            
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a set of select tags (one for hour, minute and optionally second) pre-selected for accessing a
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                  # specified time-based attribute (identified by +method+) on an object assigned to the template (identified by
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                  # +object+). You can include the seconds with <tt>:include_seconds</tt>. You can get hours in the AM/PM format
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

                  # with <tt>:ampm</tt> option.
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

                  # This method will also generate 3 input hidden tags, for the actual year, month and day unless the option
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>:ignore_date</tt> is set to +true+. If you set the <tt>:ignore_date</tt> to +true+, you must have a
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                  # +date_select+ on the same method within the form otherwise an exception will be raised.
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

                  # If anything is passed in the html_options hash it will be applied to every select tag in the set.
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      301.

      305.

                  #   # the sunrise attribute.
          
      306.

                  #   time_select("article", "start_time", include_seconds: true)

      322.

                  # all month choices are valid.
          
      323.

                  # Returns a set of select tags (one for year, month, day, hour, and minute) pre-selected for accessing a

                  # specified datetime-based attribute (identified by +method+) on an object assigned to the template (identified

                  def datetime_select(object_name, method, options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    359. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::DatetimeSelect.new(object_name, method, self, options, html_options).render
          
      360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    360. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

            
          
      362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    362. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a set of HTML select-tags (one for year, month, day, hour, minute, and second) pre-selected with the
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

                  # +datetime+. It's also possible to explicitly set the order of the tags using the <tt>:order</tt> option with
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

                  # an array of symbols <tt>:year</tt>, <tt>:month</tt> and <tt>:day</tt> in the desired order. If you do not
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                  # supply a Symbol, it will be appended onto the <tt>:order</tt> passed in. You can also add
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>:date_separator</tt>, <tt>:datetime_separator</tt> and <tt>:time_separator</tt> keys to the +options+ to
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                  # control visual display of the elements.
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                  # If anything is passed in the html_options hash it will be applied to every select tag in the set.
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

                  #   my_date_time = Time.now + 4.days
          
      372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    372. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    373. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that defaults to the datetime in my_date_time (four days after today).
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time)
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that defaults to today (no specified datetime)
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_datetime()
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that defaults to the datetime in my_date_time (four days after today)
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with the fields ordered year, month, day rather than month, day, year.
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time, order: [:year, :month, :day])
          
      382.

                  #
          
      383.

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that defaults to the datetime in my_date_time (four days after today)
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with a '/' between each date field.
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time, date_separator: '/')
          
      386.

                  #
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that defaults to the datetime in my_date_time (four days after today)
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with a date fields separated by '/', time fields separated by '' and the date and time fields
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                  #   # separated by a comma (',').
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time, date_separator: '/', time_separator: '', datetime_separator: ',')
          
      391.

                  #
          
      392.

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that discards the type of the field and defaults to the datetime in
          
      393.

                  #   # my_date_time (four days after today)
          
      394.

                  #   # Generate a datetime field with hours in the AM/PM format

                  #   # Generates a datetime select that defaults to the datetime in my_date_time (four days after today)
          
      400.

                  #   # prefixed with 'payday' rather than 'date'
          
      401.

                  #   # Generates a datetime select with a custom prompt. Use <tt>prompt: true</tt> for generic prompts.
          
      404.

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time, prompt: { day: 'Choose day', month: 'Choose month', year: 'Choose year' })
          
      405.

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time, prompt: { hour: true }) # generic prompt for hours

    406. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_datetime(my_date_time, prompt: true) # generic prompts for all
          
      407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    407. 
            1
            

            

                  def select_datetime(datetime = Time.current, options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            
            

            

                    DateTimeSelector.new(datetime, options, html_options).select_datetime
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            
            

            

            
          
      411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    411. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a set of HTML select-tags (one for year, month, and day) pre-selected with the +date+.
          
      412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    412. 
            
            

            

                  # It's possible to explicitly set the order of the tags using the <tt>:order</tt> option with an array of
          
      413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    413. 
            
            

            

                  # symbols <tt>:year</tt>, <tt>:month</tt> and <tt>:day</tt> in the desired order.
          
      414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    414. 
            
            

            

                  # If the array passed to the <tt>:order</tt> option does not contain all the three symbols, all tags will be hidden.
          
      415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    415. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    416. 
            
            

            

                  # If anything is passed in the html_options hash it will be applied to every select tag in the set.
          
      417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    417. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    418. 
            
            

            

                  #   my_date = Time.now + 6.days
          
      419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    419. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    420. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that defaults to the date in my_date (six days after today).
          
      421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    421. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_date(my_date)
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that defaults to today (no specified date).
          
      424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    424. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_date()
          
      425. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    425. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      426. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    426. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that defaults to the date in my_date (six days after today)
          
      427. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    427. 
            
            

            

                  #   # with the fields ordered year, month, day rather than month, day, year.
          
      428. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    428. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_date(my_date, order: [:year, :month, :day])
          
      429. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    429. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      430. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    430. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that discards the type of the field and defaults to the date in
          
      431. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    431. 
            
            

            

                  #   # my_date (six days after today).
          
      432. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    432. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_date(my_date, discard_type: true)
          
      433. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    433. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    434. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Generates a date select that defaults to the date in my_date,
          
      435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    435. 
            
            

            

                  #   # which has fields separated by '/'.
          
      436. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    436. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_date(my_date, date_separator: '/')
          
      437. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    437. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      438.

                  #   # Generates a date select that defaults to the datetime in my_date (six days after today)

      446. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    446. 
            1
            

            

                  def select_date(date = Date.current, options = {}, html_options = {})

                    DateTimeSelector.new(date, options, html_options).select_date

                  end

                  # Returns a set of HTML select-tags (one for hour and minute).
          
      451. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    451. 
            
            

            

                  # You can set <tt>:time_separator</tt> key to format the output, and
          
      452. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    452. 
            
            

            

                  # the <tt>:include_seconds</tt> option to include an input for seconds.
          
      453. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    453. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      454. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    454. 
            
            

            

                  # If anything is passed in the html_options hash it will be applied to every select tag in the set.
          
      455. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    455.

                  # selected. The <tt>datetime</tt> can be either a +Time+ or +DateTime+ object or an integer.

                  # Returns a select tag with options for each of the days 1 through 31 with the current day selected.

                  # Override the field name using the <tt>:field_name</tt> option, 'day' by default.

                  def select_day(date, options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      590.

                    DateTimeSelector.new(date, options, html_options).select_day
          
      591.
