                    #
          
      918. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    918. 
            
            

            

                    # If the <tt>:month_format_string</tt> option is passed:
          
      919. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    919. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      920. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    920. 
            
            

            

                    #   month_name(1) # => "January (01)"
          
      921. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    921. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      922. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    922. 
            
            

            

                    # depending on the format string.
          
      923. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    923. 
            1
            

            

                    def month_name(number)
          
      924. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    924. 
            
            

            

                      if @options[:use_month_numbers]
          
      925. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    925. 
            
            

            

                        number
          
      926. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    926. 
            
            

            

                      elsif @options[:use_two_digit_numbers]
          
      927. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    927. 
            
            

            

                        "%02d" % number
          
      928. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    928. 
            
            

            

                      elsif @options[:add_month_numbers]
          
      929. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    929. 
            
            

            

                        "#{number} - #{month_names[number]}"
          
      930. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    930. 
            
            

            

                      elsif format_string = @options[:month_format_string]
          
      931. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    931. 
            
            

            

                        format_string % { number: number, name: month_names[number] }
          
      932. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    932. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      933. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    933. 
            
            

            

                        month_names[number]
          
      934. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    934. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      935. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    935. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      936. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    936. 
            
            

            

            
          
      937. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    937. 
            
            

            

                    # Looks up year names by number.
          
      938. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    938. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      939. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    939. 
            
            

            

                    #   year_name(1998) # => 1998
          
      940. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    940. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      941. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    941. 
            
            

            

                    # If the <tt>:year_format</tt> option is passed:
          
      942. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    942. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      943. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    943. 
            
            

            

                    #   year_name(1998) # => "Heisei 10"
          
      944. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    944. 
            1
            

            

                    def year_name(number)
          
      945. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    945. 
            
            

            

                      if year_format_lambda = @options[:year_format]
          
      946. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    946. 
            
            

            

                        year_format_lambda.call(number)
          
      947. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    947. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      948. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    948. 
            
            

            

                        number
          
      949. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    949. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      950. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    950. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      951. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    951. 
            
            

            

            
          
      952. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    952. 
            1
            

            

                    def date_order
          
      953. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    953. 
            
            

            

                      @date_order ||= @options[:order] || translated_date_order
          
      954. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    954. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      955. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    955. 
            
            

            

            
          
      956. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    956. 
            1
            

            

                    def translated_date_order
          
      957. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    957. 
            
            

            

                      date_order = I18n.translate(:'date.order', locale: @options[:locale], default: [])
          
      958. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    958. 
            
            

            

                      date_order = date_order.map(&:to_sym)
          
      959. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    959. 
            
            

            

            
          
      960. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    960. 
            
            

            

                      forbidden_elements = date_order - [:year, :month, :day]
          
      961. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    961. 
            
            

            

                      if forbidden_elements.any?
          
      962. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    962. 
            
            

            

                        raise StandardError,
          
      963. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    963. 
            
            

            

                          "#{@options[:locale]}.date.order only accepts :year, :month and :day"
          
      964. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    964. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      965. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    965. 
            
            

            

            
          
      966. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    966. 
            
            

            

                      date_order
          
      967. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    967. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      968. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    968. 
            
            

            

            
          
      969. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    969. 
            
            

            

                    # Build full select tag from date type and options.
          
      970. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    970. 
            1
            

            

                    def build_options_and_select(type, selected, options = {})
          
      971. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    971. 
            
            

            

                      build_select(type, build_options(selected, options))
          
      972. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    972. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      973. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    973. 
            
            

            

            
          
      974. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    974. 
            
            

            

                    # Build select option HTML from date value and options.
          
      975. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    975. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_options(15, start: 1, end: 31)
          
      976. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    976. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<option value="1">1</option>
          
      977. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    977. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="2">2</option>
          
      978. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    978. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="3">3</option>..."
          
      979. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    979. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      980. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    980. 
            
            

            

                    # If <tt>use_two_digit_numbers: true</tt> option is passed
          
      981. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    981. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_options(15, start: 1, end: 31, use_two_digit_numbers: true)
          
      982. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    982. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<option value="1">01</option>
          
      983. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    983. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="2">02</option>
          
      984. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    984. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="3">03</option>..."
          
      985. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    985. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      986. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    986. 
            
            

            

                    # If <tt>:step</tt> options is passed
          
      987. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    987. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_options(15, start: 1, end: 31, step: 2)
          
      988. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    988. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<option value="1">1</option>
          
      989. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    989. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="3">3</option>
          
      990. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    990. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="5">5</option>..."
          
      991. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    991. 
            1
            

            

                    def build_options(selected, options = {})
          
      992. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    992. 
            
            

            

                      options = {
          
      993. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    993. 
            
            

            

                        leading_zeros: true, ampm: false, use_two_digit_numbers: false
          
      994. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    994. 
            
            

            

                      }.merge!(options)
          
      995. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    995. 
            
            

            

            
          
      996. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    996. 
            
            

            

                      start         = options.delete(:start) || 0
          
      997. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    997. 
            
            

            

                      stop          = options.delete(:end) || 59
          
      998. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    998. 
            
            

            

                      step          = options.delete(:step) || 1
          
      999. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    999. 
            
            

            

                      leading_zeros = options.delete(:leading_zeros)
          
      1000. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1000. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1001. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1001. 
            
            

            

                      select_options = []
          
      1002. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1002. 
            
            

            

                      start.step(stop, step) do |i|
          
      1003. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1003. 
            
            

            

                        value = leading_zeros ? sprintf("%02d", i) : i
          
      1004. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1004. 
            
            

            

                        tag_options = { value: value }
          
      1005. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1005. 
            
            

            

                        tag_options[:selected] = "selected" if selected == i
          
      1006. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1006. 
            
            

            

                        text = options[:use_two_digit_numbers] ? sprintf("%02d", i) : value
          
      1007. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1007. 
            
            

            

                        text = options[:ampm] ? AMPM_TRANSLATION[i] : text
          
      1008. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1008. 
            
            

            

                        select_options << content_tag("option", text, tag_options)
          
      1009. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1009. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      1010. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1010. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1011. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1011. 
            
            

            

                      (select_options.join("\n") + "\n").html_safe
          
      1012. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1012. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1013. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1013. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1014. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1014. 
            
            

            

                    # Build select option HTML for year.
          
      1015. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1015. 
            
            

            

                    # If <tt>year_format</tt> option is not passed
          
      1016. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1016. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_year_options(1998, start: 1998, end: 2000)
          
      1017. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1017. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<option value="1998" selected="selected">1998</option>
          
      1018. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1018. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="1999">1999</option>
          
      1019. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1019. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="2000">2000</option>"
          
      1020. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1020. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      1021. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1021. 
            
            

            

                    # If <tt>year_format</tt> option is passed
          
      1022. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1022. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_year_options(1998, start: 1998, end: 2000, year_format: ->year { "Heisei #{ year - 1988 }" })
          
      1023. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1023. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<option value="1998" selected="selected">Heisei 10</option>
          
      1024. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1024. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="1999">Heisei 11</option>
          
      1025. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1025. 
            
            

            

                    #      <option value="2000">Heisei 12</option>"
          
      1026. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1026. 
            1
            

            

                    def build_year_options(selected, options = {})
          
      1027. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1027. 
            
            

            

                      start = options.delete(:start)
          
      1028. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1028. 
            
            

            

                      stop = options.delete(:end)
          
      1029. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1029. 
            
            

            

                      step = options.delete(:step)
          
      1030. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1030. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1031. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1031. 
            
            

            

                      select_options = []
          
      1032. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1032. 
            
            

            

                      start.step(stop, step) do |value|
          
      1033. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1033. 
            
            

            

                        tag_options = { value: value }
          
      1034. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1034. 
            
            

            

                        tag_options[:selected] = "selected" if selected == value
          
      1035. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1035. 
            
            

            

                        text = year_name(value)
          
      1036. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1036. 
            
            

            

                        select_options << content_tag("option", text, tag_options)
          
      1037. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1037. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      1038. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1038. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1039. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1039. 
            
            

            

                      (select_options.join("\n") + "\n").html_safe
          
      1040. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1040. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1041. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1041. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1042. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1042. 
            
            

            

                    # Builds select tag from date type and HTML select options.
          
      1043. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1043. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_select(:month, "<option value="1">January</option>...")
          
      1044. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1044. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<select id="post_written_on_2i" name="post[written_on(2i)]">
          
      1045. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1045. 
            
            

            

                    #        <option value="1">January</option>...
          
      1046. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1046. 
            
            

            

                    #      </select>"
          
      1047. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1047. 
            1
            

            

                    def build_select(type, select_options_as_html)
          
      1048. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1048. 
            
            

            

                      select_options = {
          
      1049. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1049. 
            
            

            

                        id: input_id_from_type(type),
          
      1050. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1050. 
            
            

            

                        name: input_name_from_type(type)
          
      1051. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1051. 
            
            

            

                      }.merge!(@html_options)
          
      1052. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1052. 
            
            

            

                      select_options[:disabled] = "disabled" if @options[:disabled]
          
      1053. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1053. 
            
            

            

                      select_options[:class] = css_class_attribute(type, select_options[:class], @options[:with_css_classes]) if @options[:with_css_classes]
          
      1054. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1054. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1055. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1055. 
            
            

            

                      select_html = +"\n"
          
      1056. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1056. 
            
            

            

                      select_html << content_tag("option", "", value: "", label: " ") + "\n" if @options[:include_blank]
          
      1057. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1057. 
            
            

            

                      select_html << prompt_option_tag(type, @options[:prompt]) + "\n" if @options[:prompt]
          
      1058. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1058. 
            
            

            

                      select_html << select_options_as_html
          
      1059. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1059. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1060. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1060. 
            
            

            

                      (content_tag("select", select_html.html_safe, select_options) + "\n").html_safe
          
      1061. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1061. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1062. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1062. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1063. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1063. 
            
            

            

                    # Builds the css class value for the select element
          
      1064. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1064. 
            
            

            

                    #  css_class_attribute(:year, 'date optional', { year: 'my-year' })
          
      1065. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1065. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "date optional my-year"
          
      1066. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1066. 
            1
            

            

                    def css_class_attribute(type, html_options_class, options) # :nodoc:
          
      1067. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1067. 
            
            

            

                      css_class = \
          
      1068. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1068. 
            
            

            

                        case options
          
      1069. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1069. 
            
            

            

                        when Hash
          
      1070. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1070. 
            
            

            

                          options[type.to_sym]
          
      1071. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1071. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      1072. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1072. 
            
            

            

                          type
          
      1073. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1073. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      1074. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1074. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1075. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1075. 
            
            

            

                      [html_options_class, css_class].compact.join(" ")
          
      1076. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1076. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1077. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1077. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1078. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1078. 
            
            

            

                    # Builds a prompt option tag with supplied options or from default options.
          
      1079. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1079. 
            
            

            

                    #  prompt_option_tag(:month, prompt: 'Select month')
          
      1080. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1080. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<option value="">Select month</option>"
          
      1081. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1081. 
            1
            

            

                    def prompt_option_tag(type, options)
          
      1082. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1082. 
            
            

            

                      prompt = \
          
      1083. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1083. 
            
            

            

                        case options
          
      1084. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1084. 
            
            

            

                        when Hash
          
      1085. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1085. 
            
            

            

                          default_options = { year: false, month: false, day: false, hour: false, minute: false, second: false }
          
      1086. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1086. 
            
            

            

                          default_options.merge!(options)[type.to_sym]
          
      1087. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1087. 
            
            

            

                        when String
          
      1088. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1088. 
            
            

            

                          options
          
      1089. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1089. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      1090. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1090. 
            
            

            

                          I18n.translate(:"datetime.prompts.#{type}", locale: @options[:locale])
          
      1091. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1091. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      1092. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1092. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1093. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1093. 
            
            

            

                      prompt ? content_tag("option", prompt, value: "") : ""
          
      1094. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1094. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1095. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1095. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1096. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1096. 
            
            

            

                    # Builds hidden input tag for date part and value.
          
      1097. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1097. 
            
            

            

                    #  build_hidden(:year, 2008)
          
      1098. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1098. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "<input id="post_written_on_1i" name="post[written_on(1i)]" type="hidden" value="2008" />"
          
      1099. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1099. 
            1
            

            

                    def build_hidden(type, value)
          
      1100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1100. 
            
            

            

                      select_options = {
          
      1101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1101. 
            
            

            

                        type: "hidden",
          
      1102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1102. 
            
            

            

                        id: input_id_from_type(type),
          
      1103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1103. 
            
            

            

                        name: input_name_from_type(type),
          
      1104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1104. 
            
            

            

                        value: value
          
      1105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1105. 
            
            

            

                      }.merge!(@html_options.slice(:disabled))
          
      1106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1106. 
            
            

            

                      select_options[:disabled] = "disabled" if @options[:disabled]
          
      1107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1107. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1108. 
            
            

            

                      tag(:input, select_options) + "\n".html_safe
          
      1109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1109. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1110. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1111. 
            
            

            

                    # Returns the name attribute for the input tag.
          
      1112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1112. 
            
            

            

                    #  => post[written_on(1i)]
          
      1113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1113. 
            1
            

            

                    def input_name_from_type(type)
          
      1114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1114. 
            
            

            

                      prefix = @options[:prefix] || ActionView::Helpers::DateTimeSelector::DEFAULT_PREFIX
          
      1115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1115. 
            
            

            

                      prefix += "[#{@options[:index]}]" if @options.has_key?(:index)
          
      1116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1116. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1117. 
            
            

            

                      field_name = @options[:field_name] || type.to_s
          
      1118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1118. 
            
            

            

                      if @options[:include_position]
          
      1119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1119. 
            
            

            

                        field_name += "(#{ActionView::Helpers::DateTimeSelector::POSITION[type]}i)"
          
      1120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1120. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      1121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1121. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1122. 
            
            

            

                      @options[:discard_type] ? prefix : "#{prefix}[#{field_name}]"
          
      1123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1123. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1124. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1125. 
            
            

            

                    # Returns the id attribute for the input tag.
          
      1126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1126. 
            
            

            

                    #  => "post_written_on_1i"
          
      1127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1127. 
            1
            

            

                    def input_id_from_type(type)
          
      1128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1128. 
            
            

            

                      id = input_name_from_type(type).gsub(/([\[\(])|(\]\[)/, "_").gsub(/[\]\)]/, "")
          
      1129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1129. 
            
            

            

                      id = @options[:namespace] + "_" + id if @options[:namespace]
          
      1130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1130. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1131. 
            
            

            

                      id
          
      1132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1132. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1133. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1134. 
            
            

            

                    # Given an ordering of datetime components, create the selection HTML
          
      1135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1135. 
            
            

            

                    # and join them with their appropriate separators.
          
      1136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1136. 
            1
            

            

                    def build_selects_from_types(order)
          
      1137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1137. 
            
            

            

                      select = +""
          
      1138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1138. 
            
            

            

                      first_visible = order.find { |type| !@options[:"discard_#{type}"] }
          
      1139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1139. 
            
            

            

                      order.reverse_each do |type|
          
      1140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1140. 
            
            

            

                        separator = separator(type) unless type == first_visible # don't add before first visible field
          
      1141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1141. 
            
            

            

                        select.insert(0, separator.to_s + send("select_#{type}").to_s)
          
      1142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1142. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      1143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1143. 
            
            

            

                      select.html_safe
          
      1144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1144. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1145. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1146. 
            
            

            

                    # Returns the separator for a given datetime component.
          
      1147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1147. 
            1
            

            

                    def separator(type)
          
      1148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1148. 
            
            

            

                      return "" if @options[:use_hidden]
          
      1149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1149. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1150. 
            
            

            

                      case type
          
      1151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1151. 
            
            

            

                      when :year, :month, :day
          
      1152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1152. 
            
            

            

                        @options[:"discard_#{type}"] ? "" : @options[:date_separator]
          
      1153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1153. 
            
            

            

                      when :hour
          
      1154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1154. 
            
            

            

                        (@options[:discard_year] && @options[:discard_day]) ? "" : @options[:datetime_separator]
          
      1155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1155. 
            
            

            

                      when :minute, :second
          
      1156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1156. 
            
            

            

                        @options[:"discard_#{type}"] ? "" : @options[:time_separator]
          
      1157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1157. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      1158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1158. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      1159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1159. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      1160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1160. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1161. 
            1
            

            

                class FormBuilder
          
      1162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1162. 
            
            

            

                  # Wraps ActionView::Helpers::DateHelper#date_select for form builders:
          
      1163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1163. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1164. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @person do |f| %>
          
      1165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1165. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.date_select :birth_date %>
          
      1166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1166. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.submit %>
          
      1167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1167. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      1168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1168. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1169. 
            
            

            

                  # Please refer to the documentation of the base helper for details.

                  # Returns a YAML representation of +object+ wrapped with <pre> and </pre>.
          
      12.

                  # If the object cannot be converted to YAML using +to_yaml+, +inspect+ will be called instead.
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  # Useful for inspecting an object at the time of rendering.
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      15.

                  #   @user = User.new({ username: 'testing', password: 'xyz', age: 42})

                  #   debug(@user)
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  #   # =>
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                  #   <pre class='debug_dump'>--- !ruby/object:User
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19.

                  #   </pre>
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            1
            

            

                  def debug(object)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                    Marshal.dump(object)
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                    object = ERB::Util.html_escape(object.to_yaml)
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                    content_tag(:pre, object, class: "debug_dump")
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  rescue # errors from Marshal or YAML
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                    # Object couldn't be dumped, perhaps because of singleton methods -- this is the fallback
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                    content_tag(:code, object.inspect, class: "debug_dump")
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      37.

              # = Action View Form Helpers
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            1
            

            

              module Helpers #:nodoc:
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                # Form helpers are designed to make working with resources much easier
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                # compared to using vanilla HTML.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                # Typically, a form designed to create or update a resource reflects the
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                # identity of the resource in several ways: (i) the URL that the form is
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                # sent to (the form element's +action+ attribute) should result in a request
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                # being routed to the appropriate controller action (with the appropriate <tt>:id</tt>
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                # parameter in the case of an existing resource), (ii) input fields should
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                # be named in such a way that in the controller their values appear in the
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                # appropriate places within the +params+ hash, and (iii) for an existing record,
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                # when the form is initially displayed, input fields corresponding to attributes
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                # of the resource should show the current values of those attributes.
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                # In Rails, this is usually achieved by creating the form using +form_for+ and
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                # a number of related helper methods. +form_for+ generates an appropriate <tt>form</tt>
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                # tag and yields a form builder object that knows the model the form is about.
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                # Input fields are created by calling methods defined on the form builder, which
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                # means they are able to generate the appropriate names and default values
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                # corresponding to the model attributes, as well as convenient IDs, etc.
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                # Conventions in the generated field names allow controllers to receive form data
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                # nicely structured in +params+ with no effort on your side.
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                # For example, to create a new person you typically set up a new instance of
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                # +Person+ in the <tt>PeopleController#new</tt> action, <tt>@person</tt>, and
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                # in the view template pass that object to +form_for+:
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= form_for @person do |f| %>
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                #     <%= f.label :first_name %>:
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                #     <%= f.text_field :first_name %><br />
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                #     <%= f.label :last_name %>:
          
      50.

                #     <%= f.text_field :last_name %><br />
          
      51.

                #

                # The HTML generated for this would be (modulus formatting):

                #     <input name="authenticity_token" type="hidden" value="NrOp5bsjoLRuK8IW5+dQEYjKGUJDe7TQoZVvq95Wteg=" />
          
      59.

      64.

                #
          
      65.

                #   </form>
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                # As you see, the HTML reflects knowledge about the resource in several spots,
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                # like the path the form should be submitted to, or the names of the input fields.
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                # In particular, thanks to the conventions followed in the generated field names, the
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                # controller gets a nested hash <tt>params[:person]</tt> with the person attributes
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                # set in the form. That hash is ready to be passed to <tt>Person.new</tt>:
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                #   @person = Person.new(params[:person])

                #   if @person.save

                #   else

                #     # error handling

      81.

                #
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                # Interestingly, the exact same view code in the previous example can be used to edit
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                # a person. If <tt>@person</tt> is an existing record with name "John Smith" and ID 256,

                # Note that the endpoint, default values, and submit button label are tailored for <tt>@person</tt>.
          
      99.

                # That works that way because the involved helpers know whether the resource is a new record or not,
          
      100.

      104.

                module FormHelper

            1
            

            

                  include UrlHelper
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            1
            

            

                  include ModelNaming
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            1
            

            

                  include RecordIdentifier
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

            
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            1
            

            

                  attr_internal :default_form_builder
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

            
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  # Creates a form that allows the user to create or update the attributes
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  # of a specific model object.
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  # The method can be used in several slightly different ways, depending on
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  # how much you wish to rely on Rails to infer automatically from the model
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  # how the form should be constructed. For a generic model object, a form
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  # can be created by passing +form_for+ a string or symbol representing
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                  # the object we are concerned with:
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for :person do |f| %>
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  #     First name: <%= f.text_field :first_name %><br />
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  #     Last name : <%= f.text_field :last_name %><br />
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                  #     Biography : <%= f.text_area :biography %><br />
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                  #     Admin?    : <%= f.check_box :admin %><br />
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.submit %>
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  # The variable +f+ yielded to the block is a FormBuilder object that
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                  # incorporates the knowledge about the model object represented by
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>:person</tt> passed to +form_for+. Methods defined on the FormBuilder
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  # are used to generate fields bound to this model. Thus, for example,
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= f.text_field :first_name %>
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  # will get expanded to
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= text_field :person, :first_name %>
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  # which results in an HTML <tt><input></tt> tag whose +name+ attribute is
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>person[first_name]</tt>. This means that when the form is submitted,
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  # the value entered by the user will be available in the controller as
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>params[:person][:first_name]</tt>.
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  # For fields generated in this way using the FormBuilder,
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  # if <tt>:person</tt> also happens to be the name of an instance variable
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>@person</tt>, the default value of the field shown when the form is
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  # initially displayed (e.g. in the situation where you are editing an
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  # existing record) will be the value of the corresponding attribute of
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>@person</tt>.
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  # The rightmost argument to +form_for+ is an
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  # optional hash of options -
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:url</tt> - The URL the form is to be submitted to. This may be
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  #   represented in the same way as values passed to +url_for+ or +link_to+.
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  #   So for example you may use a named route directly. When the model is
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  #   represented by a string or symbol, as in the example above, if the
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>:url</tt> option is not specified, by default the form will be
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  #   sent back to the current URL (We will describe below an alternative
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  #   resource-oriented usage of +form_for+ in which the URL does not need
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  #   to be specified explicitly).
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:namespace</tt> - A namespace for your form to ensure uniqueness of
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  #   id attributes on form elements. The namespace attribute will be prefixed
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  #   with underscore on the generated HTML id.
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:method</tt> - The method to use when submitting the form, usually
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  #   either "get" or "post". If "patch", "put", "delete", or another verb
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  #   is used, a hidden input with name <tt>_method</tt> is added to
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  #   simulate the verb over post.
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:authenticity_token</tt> - Authenticity token to use in the form.
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  #   Use only if you need to pass custom authenticity token string, or to
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  #   not add authenticity_token field at all (by passing <tt>false</tt>).
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  #   Remote forms may omit the embedded authenticity token by setting
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>config.action_view.embed_authenticity_token_in_remote_forms = false</tt>.
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  #   This is helpful when you're fragment-caching the form. Remote forms
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  #   get the authenticity token from the <tt>meta</tt> tag, so embedding is
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  #   unnecessary unless you support browsers without JavaScript.
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:remote</tt> - If set to true, will allow the Unobtrusive
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                  #   JavaScript drivers to control the submit behavior. By default this
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  #   behavior is an ajax submit.
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:enforce_utf8</tt> - If set to false, a hidden input with name
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                  #   utf8 is not output.
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:html</tt> - Optional HTML attributes for the form tag.
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                  # Also note that +form_for+ doesn't create an exclusive scope. It's still
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                  # possible to use both the stand-alone FormHelper methods and methods
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                  # from FormTagHelper. For example:
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for :person do |f| %>
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                  #     First name: <%= f.text_field :first_name %>
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                  #     Last name : <%= f.text_field :last_name %>
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                  #     Biography : <%= text_area :person, :biography %>
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                  #     Admin?    : <%= check_box_tag "person[admin]", "1", @person.company.admin? %>
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.submit %>
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                  # This also works for the methods in FormOptionsHelper and DateHelper that
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                  # are designed to work with an object as base, like
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                  # FormOptionsHelper#collection_select and DateHelper#datetime_select.
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                  # === #form_for with a model object
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                  # In the examples above, the object to be created or edited was
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                  # represented by a symbol passed to +form_for+, and we noted that
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                  # a string can also be used equivalently. It is also possible, however,
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                  # to pass a model object itself to +form_for+. For example, if <tt>@post</tt>
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                  # is an existing record you wish to edit, you can create the form using
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @post do |f| %>
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                  # This behaves in almost the same way as outlined previously, with a
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  # couple of small exceptions. First, the prefix used to name the input
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                  # elements within the form (hence the key that denotes them in the +params+
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                  # hash) is actually derived from the object's _class_, e.g. <tt>params[:post]</tt>
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                  # if the object's class is +Post+. However, this can be overwritten using
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                  # the <tt>:as</tt> option, e.g. -
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(@person, as: :client) do |f| %>
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234.
