                  # would result in <tt>params[:client]</tt>.
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                  # Secondly, the field values shown when the form is initially displayed
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                  # are taken from the attributes of the object passed to +form_for+,
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                  # regardless of whether the object is an instance
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                  # variable. So, for example, if we had a _local_ variable +post+
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  # representing an existing record,
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for post do |f| %>
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                  # would produce a form with fields whose initial state reflect the current
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  # values of the attributes of +post+.
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  # === Resource-oriented style
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                  # In the examples just shown, although not indicated explicitly, we still
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  # need to use the <tt>:url</tt> option in order to specify where the
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                  # form is going to be sent. However, further simplification is possible
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                  # if the record passed to +form_for+ is a _resource_, i.e. it corresponds
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  # to a set of RESTful routes, e.g. defined using the +resources+ method
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  # in <tt>config/routes.rb</tt>. In this case Rails will simply infer the
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  # appropriate URL from the record itself. For example,
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @post do |f| %>
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                  # is then equivalent to something like:
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @post, as: :post, url: post_path(@post), method: :patch, html: { class: "edit_post", id: "edit_post_45" } do |f| %>
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                  # And for a new record
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(Post.new) do |f| %>
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

                  # is equivalent to something like:
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @post, as: :post, url: posts_path, html: { class: "new_post", id: "new_post" } do |f| %>
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

                  # However you can still overwrite individual conventions, such as:
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(@post, url: super_posts_path) do |f| %>
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                  # You can also set the answer format, like this:
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(@post, format: :json) do |f| %>
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

                  # For namespaced routes, like +admin_post_url+:
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for([:admin, @post]) do |f| %>
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

                  #    ...
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

                  # If your resource has associations defined, for example, you want to add comments
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

                  # to the document given that the routes are set correctly:
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for([@document, @comment]) do |f| %>
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

                  #    ...
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                  # Where <tt>@document = Document.find(params[:id])</tt> and
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>@comment = Comment.new</tt>.
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                  # === Setting the method
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                  # You can force the form to use the full array of HTTP verbs by setting
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

                  #    method: (:get|:post|:patch|:put|:delete)
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

                  # in the options hash. If the verb is not GET or POST, which are natively
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

                  # supported by HTML forms, the form will be set to POST and a hidden input
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                  # called _method will carry the intended verb for the server to interpret.
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

                  # === Unobtrusive JavaScript
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                  # Specifying:
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

                  #    remote: true
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

                  # in the options hash creates a form that will allow the unobtrusive JavaScript drivers to modify its
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

                  # behavior. The expected default behavior is an XMLHttpRequest in the background instead of the regular
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

                  # POST arrangement, but ultimately the behavior is the choice of the JavaScript driver implementor.
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

                  # Even though it's using JavaScript to serialize the form elements, the form submission will work just like
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

                  # a regular submission as viewed by the receiving side (all elements available in <tt>params</tt>).
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

                  # Example:
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(@post, remote: true) do |f| %>
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

                  # The HTML generated for this would be:
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action='http://www.example.com' method='post' data-remote='true'>
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input name='_method' type='hidden' value='patch' />
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    344. 
            
            

            

                  # === Setting HTML options
          
      345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    345. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    346. 
            
            

            

                  # You can set data attributes directly by passing in a data hash, but all other HTML options must be wrapped in
          
      347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    347. 
            
            

            

                  # the HTML key. Example:
          
      348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    348. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    349. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(@post, data: { behavior: "autosave" }, html: { name: "go" }) do |f| %>
          
      350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    350. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    352. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    353. 
            
            

            

                  # The HTML generated for this would be:
          
      354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    354. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    355. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action='http://www.example.com' method='post' data-behavior='autosave' name='go'>
          
      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input name='_method' type='hidden' value='patch' />
          
      357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    357. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      358. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    358. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    359. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    360. 
            
            

            

                  # === Removing hidden model id's
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    362. 
            
            

            

                  # The form_for method automatically includes the model id as a hidden field in the form.
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

                  # This is used to maintain the correlation between the form data and its associated model.
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

                  # Some ORM systems do not use IDs on nested models so in this case you want to be able
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                  # to disable the hidden id.
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                  # In the following example the Post model has many Comments stored within it in a NoSQL database,
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                  # thus there is no primary key for comments.
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

                  # Example:
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    372. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for(@post) do |f| %>
          
      373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    373. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.fields_for(:comments, include_id: false) do |cf| %>
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

                  #       ...
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

                  #     <% end %>
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                  # === Customized form builders
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                  # You can also build forms using a customized FormBuilder class. Subclass
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                  # FormBuilder and override or define some more helpers, then use your
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

                  # custom builder. For example, let's say you made a helper to
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

                  # automatically add labels to form inputs.
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @person, url: { action: "create" }, builder: LabellingFormBuilder do |f| %>
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.text_field :first_name %>
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.text_field :last_name %>
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.text_area :biography %>
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.check_box :admin %>
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= f.submit %>
          
      391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    391. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    392. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    393. 
            
            

            

                  # In this case, if you use this:
          
      394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    394. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    395. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= render f %>
          
      396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    396. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    397. 
            
            

            

                  # The rendered template is <tt>people/_labelling_form</tt> and the local
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

                  # variable referencing the form builder is called
          
      399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    399. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>labelling_form</tt>.
          
      400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    400. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    401. 
            
            

            

                  # The custom FormBuilder class is automatically merged with the options
          
      402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    402. 
            
            

            

                  # of a nested fields_for call, unless it's explicitly set.
          
      403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    403. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      404. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    404. 
            
            

            

                  # In many cases you will want to wrap the above in another helper, so you
          
      405. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    405. 
            
            

            

                  # could do something like the following:
          
      406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    406. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    407. 
            
            

            

                  #   def labelled_form_for(record_or_name_or_array, *args, &block)
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            
            

            

                  #     options = args.extract_options!
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            
            

            

                  #     form_for(record_or_name_or_array, *(args << options.merge(builder: LabellingFormBuilder)), &block)
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    411. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    412. 
            
            

            

                  # If you don't need to attach a form to a model instance, then check out
          
      413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    413. 
            
            

            

                  # FormTagHelper#form_tag.
          
      414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    414. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    415. 
            
            

            

                  # === Form to external resources
          
      416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    416. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    417. 
            
            

            

                  # When you build forms to external resources sometimes you need to set an authenticity token or just render a form
          
      418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    418. 
            
            

            

                  # without it, for example when you submit data to a payment gateway number and types of fields could be limited.
          
      419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    419. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    420. 
            
            

            

                  # To set an authenticity token you need to pass an <tt>:authenticity_token</tt> parameter
          
      421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    421. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @invoice, url: external_url, authenticity_token: 'external_token' do |f| %>
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    424. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      425. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    425. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      426. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    426. 
            
            

            

                  # If you don't want to an authenticity token field be rendered at all just pass <tt>false</tt>:
          
      427. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    427. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      428. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    428. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_for @invoice, url: external_url, authenticity_token: false do |f| %>
          
      429. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    429. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      430. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    430. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      431. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    431. 
            1
            

            

                  def form_for(record, options = {}, &block)
          
      432. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    432. 
            
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Missing block" unless block_given?
          
      433. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    433. 
            
            

            

                    html_options = options[:html] ||= {}
          
      434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    434. 
            
            

            

            
          
      435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    435. 
            
            

            

                    case record
          
      436. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    436. 
            
            

            

                    when String, Symbol
          
      437. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    437. 
            
            

            

                      object_name = record
          
      438. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    438. 
            
            

            

                      object      = nil
          
      439. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    439. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      440. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    440. 
            
            

            

                      object      = record.is_a?(Array) ? record.last : record
          
      441. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    441. 
            
            

            

                      raise ArgumentError, "First argument in form cannot contain nil or be empty" unless object
          
      442. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    442. 
            
            

            

                      object_name = options[:as] || model_name_from_record_or_class(object).param_key
          
      443. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    443. 
            
            

            

                      apply_form_for_options!(record, object, options)
          
      444. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    444. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      445. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    445. 
            
            

            

            
          
      446. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    446. 
            
            

            

                    html_options[:data]   = options.delete(:data)   if options.has_key?(:data)
          
      447. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    447. 
            
            

            

                    html_options[:remote] = options.delete(:remote) if options.has_key?(:remote)
          
      448. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    448. 
            
            

            

                    html_options[:method] = options.delete(:method) if options.has_key?(:method)
          
      449. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    449. 
            
            

            

                    html_options[:enforce_utf8] = options.delete(:enforce_utf8) if options.has_key?(:enforce_utf8)
          
      450. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    450. 
            
            

            

                    html_options[:authenticity_token] = options.delete(:authenticity_token)
          
      451. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    451. 
            
            

            

            
          
      452. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    452. 
            
            

            

                    builder = instantiate_builder(object_name, object, options)
          
      453. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    453. 
            
            

            

                    output  = capture(builder, &block)
          
      454. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    454. 
            
            

            

                    html_options[:multipart] ||= builder.multipart?
          
      455. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    455. 
            
            

            

            
          
      456. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    456. 
            
            

            

                    html_options = html_options_for_form(options[:url] || {}, html_options)
          
      457. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    457. 
            
            

            

                    form_tag_with_body(html_options, output)
          
      458. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    458. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      459. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    459. 
            
            

            

            
          
      460. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    460. 
            1
            

            

                  def apply_form_for_options!(record, object, options) #:nodoc:
          
      461. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    461. 
            
            

            

                    object = convert_to_model(object)
          
      462. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    462. 
            
            

            

            
          
      463. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    463. 
            
            

            

                    as = options[:as]
          
      464. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    464. 
            
            

            

                    namespace = options[:namespace]
          
      465. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    465. 
            
            

            

                    action, method = object.respond_to?(:persisted?) && object.persisted? ? [:edit, :patch] : [:new, :post]
          
      466. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    466. 
            
            

            

                    options[:html].reverse_merge!(
          
      467. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    467. 
            
            

            

                      class:  as ? "#{action}_#{as}" : dom_class(object, action),
          
      468. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    468. 
            
            

            

                      id:     (as ? [namespace, action, as] : [namespace, dom_id(object, action)]).compact.join("_").presence,
          
      469. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    469. 
            
            

            

                      method: method
          
      470. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    470. 
            
            

            

                    )
          
      471. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    471. 
            
            

            

            
          
      472. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    472. 
            
            

            

                    options[:url] ||= if options.key?(:format)
          
      473. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    473. 
            
            

            

                      polymorphic_path(record, format: options.delete(:format))
          
      474. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    474. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      475. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    475. 
            
            

            

                      polymorphic_path(record, {})
          
      476. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    476. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      477. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    477. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      478. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    478. 
            1
            

            

                  private :apply_form_for_options!
          
      479. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    479. 
            
            

            

            
          
      480. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    480. 
            1
            

            

                  mattr_accessor :form_with_generates_remote_forms, default: true
          
      481. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    481. 
            
            

            

            
          
      482. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    482. 
            1
            

            

                  mattr_accessor :form_with_generates_ids, default: false
          
      483. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    483. 
            
            

            

            
          
      484. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    484. 
            
            

            

                  # Creates a form tag based on mixing URLs, scopes, or models.
          
      485. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    485. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      486. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    486. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Using just a URL:
          
      487. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    487. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with url: posts_path do |form| %>
          
      488. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    488. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :title %>
          
      489. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    489. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      490. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    490. 
            
            

            

                  #   # =>
          
      491. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    491. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action="/posts" method="post" data-remote="true">
          
      492. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    492. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="text" name="title">
          
      493. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    493. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      494. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    494. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      495. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    495. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Adding a scope prefixes the input field names:
          
      496. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    496. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with scope: :post, url: posts_path do |form| %>
          
      497. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    497. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :title %>
          
      498. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    498. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      499. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    499. 
            
            

            

                  #   # =>
          
      500. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    500. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action="/posts" method="post" data-remote="true">
          
      501. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    501. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="text" name="post[title]">
          
      502. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    502. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      503. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    503. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      504. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    504. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Using a model infers both the URL and scope:
          
      505. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    505. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with model: Post.new do |form| %>
          
      506. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    506. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :title %>
          
      507. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    507. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      508. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    508. 
            
            

            

                  #   # =>
          
      509. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    509. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action="/posts" method="post" data-remote="true">
          
      510. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    510. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="text" name="post[title]">
          
      511. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    511. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    512. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      513. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    513. 
            
            

            

                  #   # An existing model makes an update form and fills out field values:
          
      514. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    514. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with model: Post.first do |form| %>
          
      515. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    515. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :title %>
          
      516. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    516. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      517. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    517. 
            
            

            

                  #   # =>
          
      518. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    518. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action="/posts/1" method="post" data-remote="true">
          
      519. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    519. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="hidden" name="_method" value="patch">
          
      520. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    520. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="text" name="post[title]" value="<the title of the post>">
          
      521. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    521. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      522. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    522. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      523. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    523. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Though the fields don't have to correspond to model attributes:
          
      524. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    524. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with model: Cat.new do |form| %>
          
      525. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    525. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :cats_dont_have_gills %>
          
      526. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    526. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :but_in_forms_they_can %>
          
      527. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    527. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      528. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    528. 
            
            

            

                  #   # =>
          
      529. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    529. 
            
            

            

                  #   <form action="/cats" method="post" data-remote="true">
          
      530. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    530. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="text" name="cat[cats_dont_have_gills]">
          
      531. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    531. 
            
            

            

                  #     <input type="text" name="cat[but_in_forms_they_can]">
          
      532. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    532. 
            
            

            

                  #   </form>
          
      533. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    533. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      534. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    534. 
            
            

            

                  # The parameters in the forms are accessible in controllers according to
          
      535. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    535. 
            
            

            

                  # their name nesting. So inputs named +title+ and <tt>post[title]</tt> are
          
      536. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    536. 
            
            

            

                  # accessible as <tt>params[:title]</tt> and <tt>params[:post][:title]</tt>
          
      537. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    537. 
            
            

            

                  # respectively.
          
      538. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    538. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      539. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    539. 
            
            

            

                  # By default +form_with+ attaches the <tt>data-remote</tt> attribute
          
      540. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    540. 
            
            

            

                  # submitting the form via an XMLHTTPRequest in the background if an
          
      541. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    541. 
            
            

            

                  # Unobtrusive JavaScript driver, like rails-ujs, is used. See the
          
      542. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    542. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>:local</tt> option for more.
          
      543. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    543. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      544. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    544. 
            
            

            

                  # For ease of comparison the examples above left out the submit button,
          
      545. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    545. 
            
            

            

                  # as well as the auto generated hidden fields that enable UTF-8 support
          
      546. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    546. 
            
            

            

                  # and adds an authenticity token needed for cross site request forgery
          
      547. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    547. 
            
            

            

                  # protection.
          
      548. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    548. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      549. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    549. 
            
            

            

                  # === Resource-oriented style
          
      550. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    550. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      551. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    551. 
            
            

            

                  # In many of the examples just shown, the +:model+ passed to +form_with+
          
      552. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    552. 
            
            

            

                  # is a _resource_. It corresponds to a set of RESTful routes, most likely
          
      553. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    553. 
            
            

            

                  # defined via +resources+ in <tt>config/routes.rb</tt>.
          
      554. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    554. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      555. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    555. 
            
            

            

                  # So when passing such a model record, Rails infers the URL and method.
          
      556. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    556. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      557. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    557. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with model: @post do |form| %>
          
      558. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    558. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      559. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    559. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      560. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    560. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      561. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    561. 
            
            

            

                  # is then equivalent to something like:
          
      562. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    562. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      563. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    563. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with scope: :post, url: post_path(@post), method: :patch do |form| %>
          
      564. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    564. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      565. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    565. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      566. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    566. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      567. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    567. 
            
            

            

                  # And for a new record
          
      568. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    568. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      569. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    569. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with model: Post.new do |form| %>
          
      570. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    570. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      571. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    571. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      572. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    572. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      573. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    573. 
            
            

            

                  # is equivalent to something like:
          
      574. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    574. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      575. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    575. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with scope: :post, url: posts_path do |form| %>
          
      576. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    576. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      577. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    577. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      578. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    578. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      579. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    579. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== +form_with+ options
          
      580. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    580. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      581. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    581. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:url</tt> - The URL the form submits to. Akin to values passed to
          
      582. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    582. 
            
            

            

                  #   +url_for+ or +link_to+. For example, you may use a named route
          
      583. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    583. 
            
            

            

                  #   directly. When a <tt>:scope</tt> is passed without a <tt>:url</tt> the
          
      584. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    584. 
            
            

            

                  #   form just submits to the current URL.
          
      585. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    585. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:method</tt> - The method to use when submitting the form, usually
          
      586. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    586. 
            
            

            

                  #   either "get" or "post". If "patch", "put", "delete", or another verb
          
      587. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    587. 
            
            

            

                  #   is used, a hidden input named <tt>_method</tt> is added to
          
      588. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    588. 
            
            

            

                  #   simulate the verb over post.
          
      589. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    589. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:format</tt> - The format of the route the form submits to.
          
      590. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    590. 
            
            

            

                  #   Useful when submitting to another resource type, like <tt>:json</tt>.
          
      591. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    591. 
            
            

            

                  #   Skipped if a <tt>:url</tt> is passed.
          
      592. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    592. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:scope</tt> - The scope to prefix input field names with and
          
      593. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    593. 
            
            

            

                  #   thereby how the submitted parameters are grouped in controllers.
          
      594. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    594. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:namespace</tt> - A namespace for your form to ensure uniqueness of
          
      595. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    595. 
            
            

            

                  #   id attributes on form elements. The namespace attribute will be prefixed
          
      596. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    596. 
            
            

            

                  #   with underscore on the generated HTML id.
          
      597. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    597. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:model</tt> - A model object to infer the <tt>:url</tt> and
          
      598. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    598. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>:scope</tt> by, plus fill out input field values.
          
      599. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    599. 
            
            

            

                  #   So if a +title+ attribute is set to "Ahoy!" then a +title+ input
          
      600. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    600. 
            
            

            

                  #   field's value would be "Ahoy!".
          
      601. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    601. 
            
            

            

                  #   If the model is a new record a create form is generated, if an
          
      602. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    602. 
            
            

            

                  #   existing record, however, an update form is generated.
          
      603. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    603. 
            
            

            

                  #   Pass <tt>:scope</tt> or <tt>:url</tt> to override the defaults.
          
      604. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    604. 
            
            

            

                  #   E.g. turn <tt>params[:post]</tt> into <tt>params[:article]</tt>.
          
      605. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    605. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:authenticity_token</tt> - Authenticity token to use in the form.
          
      606. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    606. 
            
            

            

                  #   Override with a custom authenticity token or pass <tt>false</tt> to
          
      607. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    607. 
            
            

            

                  #   skip the authenticity token field altogether.
          
      608. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    608. 
            
            

            

                  #   Useful when submitting to an external resource like a payment gateway
          
      609. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    609. 
            
            

            

                  #   that might limit the valid fields.
          
      610. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    610. 
            
            

            

                  #   Remote forms may omit the embedded authenticity token by setting
          
      611. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    611. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>config.action_view.embed_authenticity_token_in_remote_forms = false</tt>.
          
      612. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    612. 
            
            

            

                  #   This is helpful when fragment-caching the form. Remote forms
          
      613. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    613. 
            
            

            

                  #   get the authenticity token from the <tt>meta</tt> tag, so embedding is
          
      614. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    614. 
            
            

            

                  #   unnecessary unless you support browsers without JavaScript.
          
      615. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    615. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:local</tt> - By default form submits are remote and unobtrusive XHRs.
          
      616. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    616. 
            
            

            

                  #   Disable remote submits with <tt>local: true</tt>.
          
      617. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    617. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:skip_enforcing_utf8</tt> - If set to true, a hidden input with name
          
      618. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    618. 
            
            

            

                  #   utf8 is not output.
          
      619. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    619. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:builder</tt> - Override the object used to build the form.
          
      620. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    620. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:id</tt> - Optional HTML id attribute.
          
      621. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    621. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:class</tt> - Optional HTML class attribute.
          
      622. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    622. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:data</tt> - Optional HTML data attributes.
          
      623. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    623. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:html</tt> - Other optional HTML attributes for the form tag.
          
      624. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    624. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      625. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    625. 
            
            

            

                  # === Examples
          
      626. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    626. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      627. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    627. 
            
            

            

                  # When not passing a block, +form_with+ just generates an opening form tag.
          
      628. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    628. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      629. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    629. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with(model: @post, url: super_posts_path) %>
          
      630. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    630. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with(model: @post, scope: :article) %>
          
      631. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    631. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with(model: @post, format: :json) %>
          
      632. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    632. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with(model: @post, authenticity_token: false) %> # Disables the token.
          
      633. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    633. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      634. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    634. 
            
            

            

                  # For namespaced routes, like +admin_post_url+:
          
      635. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    635. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      636. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    636. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with(model: [ :admin, @post ]) do |form| %>
          
      637. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    637. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      638. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    638. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      639. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    639. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      640. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    640. 
            
            

            

                  # If your resource has associations defined, for example, you want to add comments
          
      641. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    641. 
            
            

            

                  # to the document given that the routes are set correctly:
          
      642. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    642. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      643. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    643. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with(model: [ @document, Comment.new ]) do |form| %>
          
      644. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    644. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      645. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    645. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      646. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    646. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      647. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    647. 
            
            

            

                  # Where <tt>@document = Document.find(params[:id])</tt>.
          
      648. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    648. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      649. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    649. 
            
            

            

                  # === Mixing with other form helpers
          
      650. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    650. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      651. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    651. 
            
            

            

                  # While +form_with+ uses a FormBuilder object it's possible to mix and
          
      652. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    652. 
            
            

            

                  # match the stand-alone FormHelper methods and methods
          
      653. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    653. 
            
            

            

                  # from FormTagHelper:
          
      654. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    654. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      655. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    655. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_with scope: :person do |form| %>
          
      656. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    656. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :first_name %>
          
      657. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    657. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.text_field :last_name %>
          
      658. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    658. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      659. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    659. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= text_area :person, :biography %>
          
      660. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    660. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= check_box_tag "person[admin]", "1", @person.company.admin? %>
          
      661. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    661. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      662. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    662. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.submit %>
          
      663. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    663. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      664. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    664. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      665. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    665. 
            
            

            

                  # Same goes for the methods in FormOptionsHelper and DateHelper designed
          
      666. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    666. 
            
            

            

                  # to work with an object as a base, like
          
      667. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    667. 
            
            

            

                  # FormOptionsHelper#collection_select and DateHelper#datetime_select.
          
      668. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    668. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      669. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    669. 
            
            

            

                  # === Setting the method
          
      670. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    670. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      671. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    671. 
            
            

            

                  # You can force the form to use the full array of HTTP verbs by setting
          
      672. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    672. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      673. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    673. 
            
            

            

                  #    method: (:get|:post|:patch|:put|:delete)
          
      674. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    674. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      675. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    675. 
            
            

            

                  # in the options hash. If the verb is not GET or POST, which are natively
          
      676. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    676. 
            
            

            

                  # supported by HTML forms, the form will be set to POST and a hidden input
          
      677. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    677. 
            
            

            

                  # called _method will carry the intended verb for the server to interpret.
          
      678. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    678. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      679. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    679. 
            
            

            

                  # === Setting HTML options
          
      680. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    680. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      681. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    681. 
            
            

            

                  # You can set data attributes directly in a data hash, but HTML options
          
      682.
