                    Tags::HiddenField.new(object_name, method, self, options).render

                  # Returns a file upload input tag tailored for accessing a specified attribute (identified by +method+) on an object
          
      1186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1186. 
            
            

            

                  # assigned to the template (identified by +object+). Additional options on the input tag can be passed as a
          
      1187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1187. 
            
            

            

                  # hash with +options+. These options will be tagged onto the HTML as an HTML element attribute as in the example
          
      1188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1188. 
            
            

            

                  # shown.
          
      1189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1189. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1190. 
            
            

            

                  # Using this method inside a +form_for+ block will set the enclosing form's encoding to <tt>multipart/form-data</tt>.
          
      1191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1191. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1192. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      1193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1193. 
            
            

            

                  # * Creates standard HTML attributes for the tag.
          
      1194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1194. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:disabled</tt> - If set to true, the user will not be able to use this input.
          
      1195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1195. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:multiple</tt> - If set to true, *in most updated browsers* the user will be allowed to select multiple files.
          
      1196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1196. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:accept</tt> - If set to one or multiple mime-types, the user will be suggested a filter when choosing a file. You still need to set up model validations.
          
      1197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1197. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1198. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      1199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1199. 
            
            

            

                  #   file_field(:user, :avatar)
          
      1200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1200. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input type="file" id="user_avatar" name="user[avatar]" />
          
      1201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1201. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1202. 
            
            

            

                  #   file_field(:post, :image, multiple: true)
          
      1203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1203. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input type="file" id="post_image" name="post[image][]" multiple="multiple" />
          
      1204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1204. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1205. 
            
            

            

                  #   file_field(:post, :attached, accept: 'text/html')
          
      1206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1206. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input accept="text/html" type="file" id="post_attached" name="post[attached]" />
          
      1207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1207. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1208. 
            
            

            

                  #   file_field(:post, :image, accept: 'image/png,image/gif,image/jpeg')
          
      1209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1209. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input type="file" id="post_image" name="post[image]" accept="image/png,image/gif,image/jpeg" />
          
      1210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1210. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1211. 
            
            

            

                  #   file_field(:attachment, :file, class: 'file_input')
          
      1212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1212. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input type="file" id="attachment_file" name="attachment[file]" class="file_input" />
          
      1213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1213. 
            1
            

            

                  def file_field(object_name, method, options = {})
          
      1214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1214. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::FileField.new(object_name, method, self, convert_direct_upload_option_to_url(options.dup)).render
          
      1215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1215. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1216. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1217. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a textarea opening and closing tag set tailored for accessing a specified attribute (identified by +method+)
          
      1218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1218. 
            
            

            

                  # on an object assigned to the template (identified by +object+). Additional options on the input tag can be passed as a
          
      1219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1219. 
            
            

            

                  # hash with +options+.
          
      1220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1220. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1221. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      1222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1222. 
            
            

            

                  #   text_area(:post, :body, cols: 20, rows: 40)
          
      1223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1223. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <textarea cols="20" rows="40" id="post_body" name="post[body]">
          
      1224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1224. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #{@post.body}
          
      1225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1225. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </textarea>
          
      1226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1226. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1227. 
            
            

            

                  #   text_area(:comment, :text, size: "20x30")
          
      1228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1228. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <textarea cols="20" rows="30" id="comment_text" name="comment[text]">
          
      1229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1229. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #{@comment.text}
          
      1230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1230. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </textarea>
          
      1231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1231. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1232. 
            
            

            

                  #   text_area(:application, :notes, cols: 40, rows: 15, class: 'app_input')
          
      1233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1233. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <textarea cols="40" rows="15" id="application_notes" name="application[notes]" class="app_input">
          
      1234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1234. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #{@application.notes}
          
      1235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1235. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </textarea>
          
      1236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1236. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1237. 
            
            

            

                  #   text_area(:entry, :body, size: "20x20", disabled: 'disabled')
          
      1238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1238. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <textarea cols="20" rows="20" id="entry_body" name="entry[body]" disabled="disabled">
          
      1239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1239. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #{@entry.body}
          
      1240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1240. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </textarea>
          
      1241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1241. 
            1
            

            

                  def text_area(object_name, method, options = {})
          
      1242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1242. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::TextArea.new(object_name, method, self, options).render
          
      1243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1243. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1244. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1245. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a checkbox tag tailored for accessing a specified attribute (identified by +method+) on an object
          
      1246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1246. 
            
            

            

                  # assigned to the template (identified by +object+). This object must be an instance object (@object) and not a local object.
          
      1247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1247. 
            
            

            

                  # It's intended that +method+ returns an integer and if that integer is above zero, then the checkbox is checked.
          
      1248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1248. 
            
            

            

                  # Additional options on the input tag can be passed as a hash with +options+. The +checked_value+ defaults to 1
          
      1249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1249. 
            
            

            

                  # while the default +unchecked_value+ is set to 0 which is convenient for boolean values.
          
      1250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1250. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1251. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Gotcha
          
      1252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1252. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1253. 
            
            

            

                  # The HTML specification says unchecked check boxes are not successful, and
          
      1254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1254. 
            
            

            

                  # thus web browsers do not send them. Unfortunately this introduces a gotcha:
          
      1255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1255. 
            
            

            

                  # if an +Invoice+ model has a +paid+ flag, and in the form that edits a paid
          
      1256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1256. 
            
            

            

                  # invoice the user unchecks its check box, no +paid+ parameter is sent. So,
          
      1257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1257. 
            
            

            

                  # any mass-assignment idiom like
          
      1258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1258. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1259. 
            
            

            

                  #   @invoice.update(params[:invoice])
          
      1260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1260. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1261. 
            
            

            

                  # wouldn't update the flag.
          
      1262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1262. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1263. 
            
            

            

                  # To prevent this the helper generates an auxiliary hidden field before
          
      1264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1264. 
            
            

            

                  # the very check box. The hidden field has the same name and its
          
      1265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1265. 
            
            

            

                  # attributes mimic an unchecked check box.
          
      1266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1266. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1267. 
            
            

            

                  # This way, the client either sends only the hidden field (representing
          
      1268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1268. 
            
            

            

                  # the check box is unchecked), or both fields. Since the HTML specification
          
      1269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1269. 
            
            

            

                  # says key/value pairs have to be sent in the same order they appear in the
          
      1270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1270. 
            
            

            

                  # form, and parameters extraction gets the last occurrence of any repeated
          
      1271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1271. 
            
            

            

                  # key in the query string, that works for ordinary forms.
          
      1272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1272. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1273. 
            
            

            

                  # Unfortunately that workaround does not work when the check box goes
          
      1274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1274. 
            
            

            

                  # within an array-like parameter, as in
          
      1275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1275. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1276. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= fields_for "project[invoice_attributes][]", invoice, index: nil do |form| %>
          
      1277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1277. 
            
            

            

                  #     <%= form.check_box :paid %>
          
      1278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1278. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      1279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1279. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      1280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1280. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1281. 
            
            

            

                  # because parameter name repetition is precisely what Rails seeks to distinguish
          
      1282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1282. 
            
            

            

                  # the elements of the array. For each item with a checked check box you
          
      1283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1283. 
            
            

            

                  # get an extra ghost item with only that attribute, assigned to "0".
          
      1284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1284. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1285. 
            
            

            

                  # In that case it is preferable to either use +check_box_tag+ or to use
          
      1286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1286. 
            
            

            

                  # hashes instead of arrays.
          
      1287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1287. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1288. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Let's say that @post.validated? is 1:
          
      1289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1289. 
            
            

            

                  #   check_box("post", "validated")
          
      1290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1290. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input name="post[validated]" type="hidden" value="0" />
          
      1291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1291. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <input checked="checked" type="checkbox" id="post_validated" name="post[validated]" value="1" />
          
      1292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1292. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1293. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Let's say that @puppy.gooddog is "no":
          
      1294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1294. 
            
            

            

                  #   check_box("puppy", "gooddog", {}, "yes", "no")
          
      1295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1295. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input name="puppy[gooddog]" type="hidden" value="no" />
          
      1296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1296. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <input type="checkbox" id="puppy_gooddog" name="puppy[gooddog]" value="yes" />
          
      1297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1297. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1298. 
            
            

            

                  #   check_box("eula", "accepted", { class: 'eula_check' }, "yes", "no")
          
      1299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1299. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input name="eula[accepted]" type="hidden" value="no" />
          
      1300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1300. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <input type="checkbox" class="eula_check" id="eula_accepted" name="eula[accepted]" value="yes" />
          
      1301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1301. 
            1
            

            

                  def check_box(object_name, method, options = {}, checked_value = "1", unchecked_value = "0")
          
      1302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1302. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::CheckBox.new(object_name, method, self, checked_value, unchecked_value, options).render
          
      1303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1303. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1304. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1305. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a radio button tag for accessing a specified attribute (identified by +method+) on an object
          
      1306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1306. 
            
            

            

                  # assigned to the template (identified by +object+). If the current value of +method+ is +tag_value+ the
          
      1307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1307. 
            
            

            

                  # radio button will be checked.
          
      1308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1308. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1309. 
            
            

            

                  # To force the radio button to be checked pass <tt>checked: true</tt> in the
          
      1310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1310. 
            
            

            

                  # +options+ hash. You may pass HTML options there as well.
          
      1311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1311. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1312. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Let's say that @post.category returns "rails":
          
      1313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1313. 
            
            

            

                  #   radio_button("post", "category", "rails")
          
      1314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1314. 
            
            

            

                  #   radio_button("post", "category", "java")
          
      1315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1315. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input type="radio" id="post_category_rails" name="post[category]" value="rails" checked="checked" />
          
      1316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1316. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <input type="radio" id="post_category_java" name="post[category]" value="java" />
          
      1317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1317. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1318. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Let's say that @user.receive_newsletter returns "no":
          
      1319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1319. 
            
            

            

                  #   radio_button("user", "receive_newsletter", "yes")
          
      1320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1320. 
            
            

            

                  #   radio_button("user", "receive_newsletter", "no")
          
      1321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1321. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input type="radio" id="user_receive_newsletter_yes" name="user[receive_newsletter]" value="yes" />
          
      1322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1322. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <input type="radio" id="user_receive_newsletter_no" name="user[receive_newsletter]" value="no" checked="checked" />
          
      1323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1323. 
            1
            

            

                  def radio_button(object_name, method, tag_value, options = {})
          
      1324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1324. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::RadioButton.new(object_name, method, self, tag_value, options).render
          
      1325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1325. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1326. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1327. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a text_field of type "color".
          
      1328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1328. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1329. 
            
            

            

                  #   color_field("car", "color")
          
      1330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1330. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="car_color" name="car[color]" type="color" value="#000000" />
          
      1331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1331. 
            1
            

            

                  def color_field(object_name, method, options = {})
          
      1332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1332. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::ColorField.new(object_name, method, self, options).render
          
      1333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1333. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1334. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1335. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns an input of type "search" for accessing a specified attribute (identified by +method+) on an object
          
      1336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1336. 
            
            

            

                  # assigned to the template (identified by +object_name+). Inputs of type "search" may be styled differently by
          
      1337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1337. 
            
            

            

                  # some browsers.
          
      1338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1338. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1339. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name)
          
      1340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1340. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_name" name="user[name]" type="search" />
          
      1341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1341. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name, autosave: false)
          
      1342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1342. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input autosave="false" id="user_name" name="user[name]" type="search" />
          
      1343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1343. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name, results: 3)
          
      1344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1344. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_name" name="user[name]" results="3" type="search" />
          
      1345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1345. 
            
            

            

                  #   #  Assume request.host returns "www.example.com"
          
      1346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1346. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name, autosave: true)
          
      1347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1347. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input autosave="com.example.www" id="user_name" name="user[name]" results="10" type="search" />
          
      1348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1348. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name, onsearch: true)
          
      1349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1349. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_name" incremental="true" name="user[name]" onsearch="true" type="search" />
          
      1350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1350. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name, autosave: false, onsearch: true)
          
      1351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1351. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input autosave="false" id="user_name" incremental="true" name="user[name]" onsearch="true" type="search" />
          
      1352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1352. 
            
            

            

                  #   search_field(:user, :name, autosave: true, onsearch: true)
          
      1353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1353. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input autosave="com.example.www" id="user_name" incremental="true" name="user[name]" onsearch="true" results="10" type="search" />
          
      1354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1354. 
            1
            

            

                  def search_field(object_name, method, options = {})
          
      1355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1355. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::SearchField.new(object_name, method, self, options).render
          
      1356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1356. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1357. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1358. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1358. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a text_field of type "tel".
          
      1359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1359. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1360. 
            
            

            

                  #   telephone_field("user", "phone")
          
      1361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1361. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_phone" name="user[phone]" type="tel" />
          
      1362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1362. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1363. 
            1
            

            

                  def telephone_field(object_name, method, options = {})
          
      1364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1364. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::TelField.new(object_name, method, self, options).render
          
      1365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1365. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1366. 
            
            

            

                  # aliases telephone_field
          
      1367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1367. 
            1
            

            

                  alias phone_field telephone_field
          
      1368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1368. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1369. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a text_field of type "date".
          
      1370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1370. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1371. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_field("user", "born_on")
          
      1372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1372. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_born_on" name="user[born_on]" type="date" />
          
      1373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1373. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1374. 
            
            

            

                  # The default value is generated by trying to call +strftime+ with "%Y-%m-%d"
          
      1375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1375. 
            
            

            

                  # on the object's value, which makes it behave as expected for instances
          
      1376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1376. 
            
            

            

                  # of DateTime and ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone. You can still override that
          
      1377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1377. 
            
            

            

                  # by passing the "value" option explicitly, e.g.
          
      1378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1378. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1379. 
            
            

            

                  #   @user.born_on = Date.new(1984, 1, 27)
          
      1380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1380. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_field("user", "born_on", value: "1984-05-12")
          
      1381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1381. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_born_on" name="user[born_on]" type="date" value="1984-05-12" />
          
      1382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1382. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1383. 
            
            

            

                  # You can create values for the "min" and "max" attributes by passing
          
      1384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1384. 
            
            

            

                  # instances of Date or Time to the options hash.
          
      1385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1385. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1386. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_field("user", "born_on", min: Date.today)
          
      1387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1387. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_born_on" name="user[born_on]" type="date" min="2014-05-20" />
          
      1388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1388. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1389. 
            
            

            

                  # Alternatively, you can pass a String formatted as an ISO8601 date as the
          
      1390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1390. 
            
            

            

                  # values for "min" and "max."
          
      1391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1391. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1392. 
            
            

            

                  #   date_field("user", "born_on", min: "2014-05-20")
          
      1393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1393. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="user_born_on" name="user[born_on]" type="date" min="2014-05-20" />
          
      1394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1394. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1395. 
            1
            

            

                  def date_field(object_name, method, options = {})
          
      1396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1396. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::DateField.new(object_name, method, self, options).render
          
      1397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1397. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      1398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1398. 
            
            

            

            
          
      1399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1399. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a text_field of type "time".
          
      1400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1400. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1401. 
            
            

            

                  # The default value is generated by trying to call +strftime+ with "%T.%L"
          
      1402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1402. 
            
            

            

                  # on the object's value. It is still possible to override that
          
      1403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1403. 
            
            

            

                  # by passing the "value" option.
          
      1404. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1404. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1405. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1405. 
            
            

            

                  # === Options
          
      1406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1406. 
            
            

            

                  # * Accepts same options as time_field_tag
          
      1407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1407. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1408. 
            
            

            

                  # === Example
          
      1409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1409. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_field("task", "started_at")
          
      1410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1410. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="task_started_at" name="task[started_at]" type="time" />
          
      1411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1411. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1412. 
            
            

            

                  # You can create values for the "min" and "max" attributes by passing
          
      1413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1413. 
            
            

            

                  # instances of Date or Time to the options hash.
          
      1414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1414. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1415. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_field("task", "started_at", min: Time.now)
          
      1416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1416. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="task_started_at" name="task[started_at]" type="time" min="01:00:00.000" />
          
      1417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1417. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1418. 
            
            

            

                  # Alternatively, you can pass a String formatted as an ISO8601 time as the
          
      1419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1419. 
            
            

            

                  # values for "min" and "max."
          
      1420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1420. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1421. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_field("task", "started_at", min: "01:00:00")
          
      1422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1422. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <input id="task_started_at" name="task[started_at]" type="time" min="01:00:00.000" />
          
      1423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1423. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1424.

                  #
          
      1433.

                  # The default value is generated by trying to call +strftime+ with "%Y-%m-%dT%T"
          
      1434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1434. 
            
            

            

                  # on the object's value, which makes it behave as expected for instances
          
      1435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1435. 
            
            

            

                  # of DateTime and ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone.
          
      1436.

                  #
          
      1437.

      1440. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1440. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1441. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1441. 
            
            

            

                  # You can create values for the "min" and "max" attributes by passing
          
      1442. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1442. 
            
            

            

                  # instances of Date or Time to the options hash.
          
      1443. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1443. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1444.

      1445.

                  #   # => <input id="user_born_on" name="user[born_on]" type="datetime-local" min="2014-05-20T00:00:00.000" />
          
      1446. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1446. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1447. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1447. 
            
            

            

                  # Alternatively, you can pass a String formatted as an ISO8601 datetime as
          
      1448. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1448. 
            
            

            

                  # the values for "min" and "max."
          
      1449.

                  #

                  #
          
      1464.

                  # The default value is generated by trying to call +strftime+ with "%Y-%m"
          
      1465. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1465. 
            
            

            

                  # on the object's value, which makes it behave as expected for instances
          
      1466.

                  # Returns a text_field of type "week".

                  #
          
      1481.

                  # The default value is generated by trying to call +strftime+ with "%Y-W%W"
          
      1482. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1482. 
            
            

            

                  # on the object's value, which makes it behave as expected for instances
          
      1483. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1483. 
            
            

            

                  # of DateTime and ActiveSupport::TimeWithZone.
          
      1484. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1484. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1485.

                  #   @user.born_on = Date.new(1984, 5, 12)
          
      1486.

      1487.

                  #

                  # Returns an input tag of type "number".
          
      1512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1512. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      1513. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1513. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      1514. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1514. 
            
            

            

                  # * Accepts same options as number_field_tag
          
      1515.

            1
            

            

                  def number_field(object_name, method, options = {})

                    Tags::NumberField.new(object_name, method, self, options).render
