                #     </select>
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                #   When used with the <tt>collection_select</tt> helper, <tt>:disabled</tt> can also be a Proc that identifies those options that should be disabled.
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                #     collection_select(:post, :category_id, Category.all, :id, :name, { disabled: -> (category) { category.archived? } })
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                #   If the categories "2008 stuff" and "Christmas" return true when the method <tt>archived?</tt> is called, this would return:
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                #     <select name="post[category_id]" id="post_category_id">
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                #       <option value="1" disabled="disabled">2008 stuff</option>
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                #       <option value="2" disabled="disabled">Christmas</option>
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                #       <option value="3">Jokes</option>
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                #       <option value="4">Poems</option>
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                #     </select>
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            1
            

            

                module FormOptionsHelper
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  # ERB::Util can mask some helpers like textilize. Make sure to include them.
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            1
            

            

                  include TextHelper
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

            
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  # Create a select tag and a series of contained option tags for the provided object and method.
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  # The option currently held by the object will be selected, provided that the object is available.
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  # There are two possible formats for the +choices+ parameter, corresponding to other helpers' output:
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  # * A flat collection (see +options_for_select+).
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                  # * A nested collection (see +grouped_options_for_select+).
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  # For example:
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  #   select("post", "person_id", Person.all.collect { |p| [ p.name, p.id ] }, { include_blank: true })
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  # would become:
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  #   <select name="post[person_id]" id="post_person_id">
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="" label=" "></option>
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="1" selected="selected">David</option>
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="2">Eileen</option>
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="3">Rafael</option>
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  #   </select>
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  # assuming the associated person has ID 1.
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  # This can be used to provide a default set of options in the standard way: before rendering the create form, a
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  # new model instance is assigned the default options and bound to @model_name. Usually this model is not saved
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  # to the database. Instead, a second model object is created when the create request is received.
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  # This allows the user to submit a form page more than once with the expected results of creating multiple records.
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  # In addition, this allows a single partial to be used to generate form inputs for both edit and create forms.
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  # By default, <tt>post.person_id</tt> is the selected option. Specify <tt>selected: value</tt> to use a different selection
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                  # or <tt>selected: nil</tt> to leave all options unselected. Similarly, you can specify values to be disabled in the option
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  # tags by specifying the <tt>:disabled</tt> option. This can either be a single value or an array of values to be disabled.
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  # A block can be passed to +select+ to customize how the options tags will be rendered. This
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  # is useful when the options tag has complex attributes.
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                  #   select(report, "campaign_ids") do
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                  #     available_campaigns.each do |c|
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  #       content_tag(:option, c.name, value: c.id, data: { tags: c.tags.to_json })
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Gotcha
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  # The HTML specification says when +multiple+ parameter passed to select and all options got deselected
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  # web browsers do not send any value to server. Unfortunately this introduces a gotcha:
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  # if a +User+ model has many +roles+ and have +role_ids+ accessor, and in the form that edits roles of the user
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  # the user deselects all roles from +role_ids+ multiple select box, no +role_ids+ parameter is sent. So,
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  # any mass-assignment idiom like
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  #   @user.update(params[:user])
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  # wouldn't update roles.
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  # To prevent this the helper generates an auxiliary hidden field before
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  # every multiple select. The hidden field has the same name as multiple select and blank value.
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  # <b>Note:</b> The client either sends only the hidden field (representing
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  # the deselected multiple select box), or both fields. This means that the resulting array
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  # always contains a blank string.
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  # In case if you don't want the helper to generate this hidden field you can specify
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>include_hidden: false</tt> option.
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            1
            

            

                  def select(object, method, choices = nil, options = {}, html_options = {}, &block)
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::Select.new(object, method, self, choices, options, html_options, &block).render
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

            
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns <tt><select></tt> and <tt><option></tt> tags for the collection of existing return values of
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  # +method+ for +object+'s class. The value returned from calling +method+ on the instance +object+ will
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  # be selected. If calling +method+ returns +nil+, no selection is made without including <tt>:prompt</tt>
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  # or <tt>:include_blank</tt> in the +options+ hash.
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  # The <tt>:value_method</tt> and <tt>:text_method</tt> parameters are methods to be called on each member
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  # of +collection+. The return values are used as the +value+ attribute and contents of each
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt><option></tt> tag, respectively. They can also be any object that responds to +call+, such
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  # as a +proc+, that will be called for each member of the +collection+ to
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  # retrieve the value/text.
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  # Example object structure for use with this method:
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Post < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  #     belongs_to :author
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  #     has_many :posts
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  #     def name_with_initial
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  #       "#{first_name.first}. #{last_name}"
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  # Sample usage (selecting the associated Author for an instance of Post, <tt>@post</tt>):
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_select(:post, :author_id, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial, prompt: true)
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                  # If <tt>@post.author_id</tt> is already <tt>1</tt>, this would return:
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                  #   <select name="post[author_id]" id="post_author_id">
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="">Please select</option>
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="1" selected="selected">D. Heinemeier Hansson</option>
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="2">D. Thomas</option>
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="3">M. Clark</option>
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                  #   </select>
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            1
            

            

                  def collection_select(object, method, collection, value_method, text_method, options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::CollectionSelect.new(object, method, self, collection, value_method, text_method, options, html_options).render
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

            
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns <tt><select></tt>, <tt><optgroup></tt> and <tt><option></tt> tags for the collection of existing return values of
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                  # +method+ for +object+'s class. The value returned from calling +method+ on the instance +object+ will
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                  # be selected. If calling +method+ returns +nil+, no selection is made without including <tt>:prompt</tt>
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                  # or <tt>:include_blank</tt> in the +options+ hash.
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                  # Parameters:
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                  # * +object+ - The instance of the class to be used for the select tag
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                  # * +method+ - The attribute of +object+ corresponding to the select tag
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                  # * +collection+ - An array of objects representing the <tt><optgroup></tt> tags.
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                  # * +group_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a member of +collection+, returns an
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                  #   array of child objects representing the <tt><option></tt> tags. It can also be any object that responds
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                  #   to +call+, such as a +proc+, that will be called for each member of the +collection+ to retrieve the
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                  #   value.
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                  # * +group_label_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a member of +collection+, returns a
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                  #   string to be used as the +label+ attribute for its <tt><optgroup></tt> tag. It can also be any object
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                  #   that responds to +call+, such as a +proc+, that will be called for each member of the +collection+ to
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  #   retrieve the label.
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                  # * +option_key_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a child object of a member of
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  #   +collection+, returns a value to be used as the +value+ attribute for its <tt><option></tt> tag.
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                  # * +option_value_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a child object of a member of
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                  #   +collection+, returns a value to be used as the contents of its <tt><option></tt> tag.
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                  # Example object structure for use with this method:
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Continent < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                  #     has_many :countries
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribs: id, name
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Country < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                  #     belongs_to :continent
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribs: id, name, continent_id
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  #   class City < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                  #     belongs_to :country
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribs: id, name, country_id
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  # Sample usage:
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  #   grouped_collection_select(:city, :country_id, @continents, :countries, :name, :id, :name)
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  # Possible output:
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                  #   <select name="city[country_id]" id="city_country_id">
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  #     <optgroup label="Africa">
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="1">South Africa</option>
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="3">Somalia</option>
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  #     </optgroup>
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  #     <optgroup label="Europe">
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="7" selected="selected">Denmark</option>
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="2">Ireland</option>
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                  #     </optgroup>
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                  #   </select>
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            1
            

            

                  def grouped_collection_select(object, method, collection, group_method, group_label_method, option_key_method, option_value_method, options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::GroupedCollectionSelect.new(object, method, self, collection, group_method, group_label_method, option_key_method, option_value_method, options, html_options).render
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

            
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns select and option tags for the given object and method, using
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                  # #time_zone_options_for_select to generate the list of option tags.
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                  # In addition to the <tt>:include_blank</tt> option documented above,
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                  # this method also supports a <tt>:model</tt> option, which defaults
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                  # to ActiveSupport::TimeZone. This may be used by users to specify a
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

                  # different time zone model object. (See +time_zone_options_for_select+
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

                  # for more information.)
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

                  # You can also supply an array of ActiveSupport::TimeZone objects
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

                  # as +priority_zones+ so that they will be listed above the rest of the
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

                  # (long) list. You can use ActiveSupport::TimeZone.us_zones for a list
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                  # of US time zones, ActiveSupport::TimeZone.country_zones(country_code)
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

                  # for another country's time zones, or a Regexp to select the zones of
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

                  # your choice.
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

                  # Finally, this method supports a <tt>:default</tt> option, which selects
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

                  # a default ActiveSupport::TimeZone if the object's time zone is +nil+.
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_zone_select("user", "time_zone", nil, include_blank: true)
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_zone_select("user", "time_zone", nil, default: "Pacific Time (US & Canada)")
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_zone_select("user", 'time_zone', ActiveSupport::TimeZone.us_zones, default: "Pacific Time (US & Canada)")
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_zone_select("user", 'time_zone', [ ActiveSupport::TimeZone['Alaska'], ActiveSupport::TimeZone['Hawaii'] ])
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                  #

                  #   time_zone_select("user", 'time_zone', /Australia/)

    295. 
            
            

            

                  #   time_zone_select("user", "time_zone", ActiveSupport::TimeZone.all.sort, model: ActiveSupport::TimeZone)
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            1
            

            

                  def time_zone_select(object, method, priority_zones = nil, options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::TimeZoneSelect.new(object, method, self, priority_zones, options, html_options).render
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

            
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

                  # Accepts a container (hash, array, enumerable, your type) and returns a string of option tags. Given a container
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                  # where the elements respond to first and last (such as a two-element array), the "lasts" serve as option values and
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

                  # the "firsts" as option text. Hashes are turned into this form automatically, so the keys become "firsts" and values
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

                  # become lasts. If +selected+ is specified, the matching "last" or element will get the selected option-tag. +selected+
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

                  # may also be an array of values to be selected when using a multiple select.
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select([["Dollar", "$"], ["Kroner", "DKK"]])
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="$">Dollar</option>
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="DKK">Kroner</option>
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select([ "VISA", "MasterCard" ], "MasterCard")
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="VISA">VISA</option>
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option selected="selected" value="MasterCard">MasterCard</option>
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select({ "Basic" => "$20", "Plus" => "$40" }, "$40")
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="$20">Basic</option>
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="$40" selected="selected">Plus</option>
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select([ "VISA", "MasterCard", "Discover" ], ["VISA", "Discover"])
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option selected="selected" value="VISA">VISA</option>
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="MasterCard">MasterCard</option>
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option selected="selected" value="Discover">Discover</option>
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

                  # You can optionally provide HTML attributes as the last element of the array.
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select([ "Denmark", ["USA", { class: 'bold' }], "Sweden" ], ["USA", "Sweden"])
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Denmark">Denmark</option>
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="USA" class="bold" selected="selected">USA</option>
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Sweden" selected="selected">Sweden</option>
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select([["Dollar", "$", { class: "bold" }], ["Kroner", "DKK", { onclick: "alert('HI');" }]])
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="$" class="bold">Dollar</option>
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="DKK" onclick="alert('HI');">Kroner</option>
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

                  # If you wish to specify disabled option tags, set +selected+ to be a hash, with <tt>:disabled</tt> being either a value
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            
            

            

                  # or array of values to be disabled. In this case, you can use <tt>:selected</tt> to specify selected option tags.
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select(["Free", "Basic", "Advanced", "Super Platinum"], disabled: "Super Platinum")
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Free">Free</option>
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Basic">Basic</option>
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Advanced">Advanced</option>
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Super Platinum" disabled="disabled">Super Platinum</option>
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select(["Free", "Basic", "Advanced", "Super Platinum"], disabled: ["Advanced", "Super Platinum"])
          
      344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    344. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Free">Free</option>
          
      345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    345. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Basic">Basic</option>
          
      346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    346. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Advanced" disabled="disabled">Advanced</option>
          
      347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    347. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Super Platinum" disabled="disabled">Super Platinum</option>
          
      348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    348. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    349. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_for_select(["Free", "Basic", "Advanced", "Super Platinum"], selected: "Free", disabled: "Super Platinum")
          
      350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    350. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Free" selected="selected">Free</option>
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Basic">Basic</option>
          
      352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    352. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Advanced">Advanced</option>
          
      353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    353. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="Super Platinum" disabled="disabled">Super Platinum</option>
          
      354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    354. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    355. 
            
            

            

                  # NOTE: Only the option tags are returned, you have to wrap this call in a regular HTML select tag.
          
      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356. 
            1
            

            

                  def options_for_select(container, selected = nil)
          
      357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    357. 
            
            

            

                    return container if String === container
          
      358. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    358. 
            
            

            

            
          
      359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    359. 
            
            

            

                    selected, disabled = extract_selected_and_disabled(selected).map do |r|
          
      360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    360. 
            
            

            

                      Array(r).map(&:to_s)
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    362. 
            
            

            

            
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

                    container.map do |element|
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

                      html_attributes = option_html_attributes(element)
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                      text, value = option_text_and_value(element).map(&:to_s)
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

            
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                      html_attributes[:selected] ||= option_value_selected?(value, selected)
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                      html_attributes[:disabled] ||= disabled && option_value_selected?(value, disabled)
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                      html_attributes[:value] = value
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

            
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

                      tag_builder.content_tag_string(:option, text, html_attributes)
          
      372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    372. 
            
            

            

                    end.join("\n").html_safe
          
      373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    373. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

            
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a string of option tags that have been compiled by iterating over the +collection+ and assigning
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                  # the result of a call to the +value_method+ as the option value and the +text_method+ as the option text.
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_from_collection_for_select(@people, 'id', 'name')
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <option value="#{person.id}">#{person.name}</option>
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                  # This is more often than not used inside a #select_tag like this example:
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag 'person', options_from_collection_for_select(@people, 'id', 'name')
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                  # If +selected+ is specified as a value or array of values, the element(s) returning a match on +value_method+
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                  # will be selected option tag(s).
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                  # If +selected+ is specified as a Proc, those members of the collection that return true for the anonymous
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                  # function are the selected values.
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    391. 
            
            

            

                  # +selected+ can also be a hash, specifying both <tt>:selected</tt> and/or <tt>:disabled</tt> values as required.
          
      392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    392. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    393. 
            
            

            

                  # Be sure to specify the same class as the +value_method+ when specifying selected or disabled options.
          
      394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    394. 
            
            

            

                  # Failure to do this will produce undesired results. Example:
          
      395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    395. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_from_collection_for_select(@people, 'id', 'name', '1')
          
      396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    396. 
            
            

            

                  # Will not select a person with the id of 1 because 1 (an Integer) is not the same as '1' (a string)
          
      397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    397. 
            
            

            

                  #   options_from_collection_for_select(@people, 'id', 'name', 1)
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

                  # should produce the desired results.
          
      399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    399. 
            1
            

            

                  def options_from_collection_for_select(collection, value_method, text_method, selected = nil)
          
      400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    400. 
            
            

            

                    options = collection.map do |element|
          
      401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    401. 
            
            

            

                      [value_for_collection(element, text_method), value_for_collection(element, value_method), option_html_attributes(element)]
          
      402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    402. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    403. 
            
            

            

                    selected, disabled = extract_selected_and_disabled(selected)
          
      404. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    404. 
            
            

            

                    select_deselect = {
          
      405. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    405. 
            
            

            

                      selected: extract_values_from_collection(collection, value_method, selected),
          
      406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    406. 
            
            

            

                      disabled: extract_values_from_collection(collection, value_method, disabled)
          
      407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    407. 
            
            

            

                    }
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            
            

            

            
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            
            

            

                    options_for_select(options, select_deselect)
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    411. 
            
            

            

            
          
      412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    412. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a string of <tt><option></tt> tags, like <tt>options_from_collection_for_select</tt>, but
          
      413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    413. 
            
            

            

                  # groups them by <tt><optgroup></tt> tags based on the object relationships of the arguments.
          
      414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    414. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    415. 
            
            

            

                  # Parameters:
          
      416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    416. 
            
            

            

                  # * +collection+ - An array of objects representing the <tt><optgroup></tt> tags.
          
      417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    417. 
            
            

            

                  # * +group_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a member of +collection+, returns an
          
      418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    418. 
            
            

            

                  #   array of child objects representing the <tt><option></tt> tags.
          
      419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    419. 
            
            

            

                  # * +group_label_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a member of +collection+, returns a
          
      420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    420. 
            
            

            

                  #   string to be used as the +label+ attribute for its <tt><optgroup></tt> tag.
          
      421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    421. 
            
            

            

                  # * +option_key_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a child object of a member of
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

                  #   +collection+, returns a value to be used as the +value+ attribute for its <tt><option></tt> tag.
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

                  # * +option_value_method+ - The name of a method which, when called on a child object of a member of
          
      424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    424. 
            
            

            

                  #   +collection+, returns a value to be used as the contents of its <tt><option></tt> tag.
          
      425. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    425. 
            
            

            

                  # * +selected_key+ - A value equal to the +value+ attribute for one of the <tt><option></tt> tags,
          
      426. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    426. 
            
            

            

                  #   which will have the +selected+ attribute set. Corresponds to the return value of one of the calls
          
      427. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    427. 
            
            

            

                  #   to +option_key_method+. If +nil+, no selection is made. Can also be a hash if disabled values are
          
      428. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    428. 
            
            

            

                  #   to be specified.
          
      429. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    429. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      430. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    430. 
            
            

            

                  # Example object structure for use with this method:
          
      431. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    431. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      432. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    432. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Continent < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      433. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    433. 
            
            

            

                  #     has_many :countries
          
      434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    434. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribs: id, name
          
      435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    435. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      436. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    436. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      437. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    437. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Country < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      438. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    438. 
            
            

            

                  #     belongs_to :continent
          
      439. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    439. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribs: id, name, continent_id
          
      440. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    440. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      441. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    441. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      442. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    442. 
            
            

            

                  # Sample usage:
          
      443. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    443. 
            
            

            

                  #   option_groups_from_collection_for_select(@continents, :countries, :name, :id, :name, 3)
          
      444. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    444. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      445. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    445. 
            
            

            

                  # Possible output:
          
      446. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    446. 
            
            

            

                  #   <optgroup label="Africa">
          
      447. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    447. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="1">Egypt</option>
          
      448. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    448. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="4">Rwanda</option>
          
      449. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    449. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      450. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    450. 
            
            

            

                  #   </optgroup>
          
      451. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    451. 
            
            

            

                  #   <optgroup label="Asia">
          
      452. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    452. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="3" selected="selected">China</option>
          
      453. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    453. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="12">India</option>
          
      454. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    454. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="5">Japan</option>
          
      455. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    455. 
            
            

            

                  #     ...
          
      456. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    456. 
            
            

            

                  #   </optgroup>
          
      457. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    457. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      458. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    458. 
            
            

            

                  # <b>Note:</b> Only the <tt><optgroup></tt> and <tt><option></tt> tags are returned, so you still have to
          
      459. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    459. 
            
            

            

                  # wrap the output in an appropriate <tt><select></tt> tag.
          
      460. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    460. 
            1
            

            

                  def option_groups_from_collection_for_select(collection, group_method, group_label_method, option_key_method, option_value_method, selected_key = nil)
          
      461. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    461. 
            
            

            

                    collection.map do |group|
          
      462. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    462. 
            
            

            

                      option_tags = options_from_collection_for_select(
          
      463. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    463. 
            
            

            

                        value_for_collection(group, group_method), option_key_method, option_value_method, selected_key)
          
      464. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    464. 
            
            

            

            
          
      465. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    465. 
            
            

            

                      content_tag("optgroup", option_tags, label: value_for_collection(group, group_label_method))
          
      466. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    466. 
            
            

            

                    end.join.html_safe
          
      467. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    467. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      468. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    468. 
            
            

            

            
          
      469. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    469. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a string of <tt><option></tt> tags, like <tt>options_for_select</tt>, but
          
      470. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    470. 
            
            

            

                  # wraps them with <tt><optgroup></tt> tags:
          
      471. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    471. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      472. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    472. 
            
            

            

                  #   grouped_options = [
          
      473. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    473. 
            
            

            

                  #    ['North America',
          
      474. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    474. 
            
            

            

                  #      [['United States','US'],'Canada']],
          
      475. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    475. 
            
            

            

                  #    ['Europe',
          
      476. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    476. 
            
            

            

                  #      ['Denmark','Germany','France']]
          
      477. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    477. 
            
            

            

                  #   ]
          
      478. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    478. 
            
            

            

                  #   grouped_options_for_select(grouped_options)
          
      479. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    479. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      480. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    480. 
            
            

            

                  #   grouped_options = {
          
      481. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    481. 
            
            

            

                  #     'North America' => [['United States','US'], 'Canada'],
          
      482. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    482. 
            
            

            

                  #     'Europe' => ['Denmark','Germany','France']
          
      483. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    483. 
            
            

            

                  #   }
          
      484. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    484. 
            
            

            

                  #   grouped_options_for_select(grouped_options)
          
      485. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    485. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      486. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    486. 
            
            

            

                  # Possible output:
          
      487. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    487. 
            
            

            

                  #   <optgroup label="North America">
          
      488. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    488. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="US">United States</option>
          
      489. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    489. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="Canada">Canada</option>
          
      490. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    490. 
            
            

            

                  #   </optgroup>
          
      491. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    491. 
            
            

            

                  #   <optgroup label="Europe">
          
      492. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    492. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="Denmark">Denmark</option>
          
      493. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    493. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="Germany">Germany</option>
          
      494. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    494. 
            
            

            

                  #     <option value="France">France</option>
          
      495. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    495. 
            
            

            

                  #   </optgroup>
          
      496. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    496. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      497. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    497. 
            
            

            

                  # Parameters:
          
      498. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    498. 
            
            

            

                  # * +grouped_options+ - Accepts a nested array or hash of strings. The first value serves as the
          
      499. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    499. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt><optgroup></tt> label while the second value must be an array of options. The second value can be a
          
      500. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    500. 
            
            

            

                  #   nested array of text-value pairs. See <tt>options_for_select</tt> for more info.
          
      501. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    501. 
            
            

            

                  #    Ex. ["North America",[["United States","US"],["Canada","CA"]]]
          
      502. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    502.
