                  # * +selected_key+ - A value equal to the +value+ attribute for one of the <tt><option></tt> tags,
          
      503. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    503. 
            
            

            

                  #   which will have the +selected+ attribute set. Note: It is possible for this value to match multiple options
          
      504. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    504. 
            
            

            

                  #   as you might have the same option in multiple groups. Each will then get <tt>selected="selected"</tt>.
          
      505. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    505. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      506. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    506. 
            
            

            

                  # Options:
          
      507. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    507. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:prompt</tt> - set to true or a prompt string. When the select element doesn't have a value yet, this
          
      508. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    508. 
            
            

            

                  #   prepends an option with a generic prompt - "Please select" - or the given prompt string.
          
      509. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    509. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:divider</tt> - the divider for the options groups.
          
      510. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    510. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      511. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    511. 
            
            

            

                  #     grouped_options = [
          
      512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    512. 
            
            

            

                  #       [['United States','US'], 'Canada'],
          
      513. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    513. 
            
            

            

                  #       ['Denmark','Germany','France']
          
      514. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    514. 
            
            

            

                  #     ]
          
      515. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    515. 
            
            

            

                  #     grouped_options_for_select(grouped_options, nil, divider: '---------')
          
      516. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    516. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      517. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    517. 
            
            

            

                  #   Possible output:
          
      518. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    518. 
            
            

            

                  #     <optgroup label="---------">
          
      519. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    519. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="US">United States</option>
          
      520. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    520. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="Canada">Canada</option>
          
      521. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    521. 
            
            

            

                  #     </optgroup>
          
      522. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    522. 
            
            

            

                  #     <optgroup label="---------">
          
      523. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    523. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="Denmark">Denmark</option>
          
      524. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    524. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="Germany">Germany</option>
          
      525. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    525. 
            
            

            

                  #       <option value="France">France</option>
          
      526. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    526. 
            
            

            

                  #     </optgroup>
          
      527. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    527. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      528. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    528. 
            
            

            

                  # <b>Note:</b> Only the <tt><optgroup></tt> and <tt><option></tt> tags are returned, so you still have to
          
      529. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    529. 
            
            

            

                  # wrap the output in an appropriate <tt><select></tt> tag.
          
      530. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    530. 
            1
            

            

                  def grouped_options_for_select(grouped_options, selected_key = nil, options = {})
          
      531. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    531. 
            
            

            

                    prompt  = options[:prompt]
          
      532. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    532. 
            
            

            

                    divider = options[:divider]
          
      533. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    533. 
            
            

            

            
          
      534. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    534. 
            
            

            

                    body = "".html_safe
          
      535. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    535. 
            
            

            

            
          
      536. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    536. 
            
            

            

                    if prompt
          
      537. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    537. 
            
            

            

                      body.safe_concat content_tag("option", prompt_text(prompt), value: "")
          
      538. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    538. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      539. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    539. 
            
            

            

            
          
      540. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    540. 
            
            

            

                    grouped_options.each do |container|
          
      541. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    541. 
            
            

            

                      html_attributes = option_html_attributes(container)
          
      542. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    542. 
            
            

            

            
          
      543. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    543. 
            
            

            

                      if divider
          
      544. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    544. 
            
            

            

                        label = divider
          
      545. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    545. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      546. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    546. 
            
            

            

                        label, container = container
          
      547. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    547. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      548. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    548. 
            
            

            

            
          
      549. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    549. 
            
            

            

                      html_attributes = { label: label }.merge!(html_attributes)
          
      550. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    550. 
            
            

            

                      body.safe_concat content_tag("optgroup", options_for_select(container, selected_key), html_attributes)
          
      551. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    551. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      552. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    552. 
            
            

            

            
          
      553. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    553. 
            
            

            

                    body
          
      554. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    554. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      555. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    555. 
            
            

            

            
          
      556. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    556. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a string of option tags for pretty much any time zone in the
          
      557. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    557. 
            
            

            

                  # world. Supply an ActiveSupport::TimeZone name as +selected+ to have it
          
      558. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    558. 
            
            

            

                  # marked as the selected option tag. You can also supply an array of
          
      559. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    559. 
            
            

            

                  # ActiveSupport::TimeZone objects as +priority_zones+, so that they will
          
      560. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    560. 
            
            

            

                  # be listed above the rest of the (long) list. (You can use
          
      561. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    561. 
            
            

            

                  # ActiveSupport::TimeZone.us_zones as a convenience for obtaining a list
          
      562. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    562. 
            
            

            

                  # of the US time zones, or a Regexp to select the zones of your choice)
          
      563. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    563. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      564. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    564. 
            
            

            

                  # The +selected+ parameter must be either +nil+, or a string that names
          
      565. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    565. 
            
            

            

                  # an ActiveSupport::TimeZone.
          
      566. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    566. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      567. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    567. 
            
            

            

                  # By default, +model+ is the ActiveSupport::TimeZone constant (which can
          
      568. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    568. 
            
            

            

                  # be obtained in Active Record as a value object). The +model+ parameter
          
      569. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    569. 
            
            

            

                  # must respond to +all+ and return an array of objects that represent time
          
      570. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    570. 
            
            

            

                  # zones; each object must respond to +name+. If a Regexp is given it will
          
      571. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    571. 
            
            

            

                  # attempt to match the zones using <code>match?</code> method.
          
      572. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    572. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      573. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    573. 
            
            

            

                  # NOTE: Only the option tags are returned, you have to wrap this call in
          
      574. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    574. 
            
            

            

                  # a regular HTML select tag.
          
      575. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    575. 
            1
            

            

                  def time_zone_options_for_select(selected = nil, priority_zones = nil, model = ::ActiveSupport::TimeZone)
          
      576. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    576. 
            
            

            

                    zone_options = "".html_safe
          
      577. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    577. 
            
            

            

            
          
      578. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    578. 
            
            

            

                    zones = model.all
          
      579. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    579. 
            
            

            

                    convert_zones = lambda { |list| list.map { |z| [ z.to_s, z.name ] } }
          
      580. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    580. 
            
            

            

            
          
      581. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    581. 
            
            

            

                    if priority_zones
          
      582. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    582. 
            
            

            

                      if priority_zones.is_a?(Regexp)
          
      583. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    583. 
            
            

            

                        priority_zones = zones.select { |z| z.match?(priority_zones) }
          
      584. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    584. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      585. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    585. 
            
            

            

            
          
      586. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    586. 
            
            

            

                      zone_options.safe_concat options_for_select(convert_zones[priority_zones], selected)
          
      587. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    587. 
            
            

            

                      zone_options.safe_concat content_tag("option", "-------------", value: "", disabled: true)
          
      588. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    588. 
            
            

            

                      zone_options.safe_concat "\n"
          
      589. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    589. 
            
            

            

            
          
      590. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    590. 
            
            

            

                      zones = zones - priority_zones
          
      591. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    591. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      592. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    592. 
            
            

            

            
          
      593. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    593. 
            
            

            

                    zone_options.safe_concat options_for_select(convert_zones[zones], selected)
          
      594. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    594. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      595. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    595. 
            
            

            

            
          
      596. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    596. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns radio button tags for the collection of existing return values
          
      597. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    597. 
            
            

            

                  # of +method+ for +object+'s class. The value returned from calling
          
      598. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    598. 
            
            

            

                  # +method+ on the instance +object+ will be selected. If calling +method+
          
      599. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    599. 
            
            

            

                  # returns +nil+, no selection is made.
          
      600. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    600. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      601. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    601. 
            
            

            

                  # The <tt>:value_method</tt> and <tt>:text_method</tt> parameters are
          
      602. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    602. 
            
            

            

                  # methods to be called on each member of +collection+. The return values
          
      603. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    603. 
            
            

            

                  # are used as the +value+ attribute and contents of each radio button tag,
          
      604. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    604. 
            
            

            

                  # respectively. They can also be any object that responds to +call+, such
          
      605. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    605. 
            
            

            

                  # as a +proc+, that will be called for each member of the +collection+ to
          
      606. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    606. 
            
            

            

                  # retrieve the value/text.
          
      607. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    607. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      608. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    608. 
            
            

            

                  # Example object structure for use with this method:
          
      609. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    609. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Post < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      610. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    610. 
            
            

            

                  #     belongs_to :author
          
      611. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    611. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      612. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    612. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      613. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    613. 
            
            

            

                  #     has_many :posts
          
      614. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    614. 
            
            

            

                  #     def name_with_initial
          
      615. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    615. 
            
            

            

                  #       "#{first_name.first}. #{last_name}"
          
      616. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    616. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      617. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    617. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      618. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    618. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      619. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    619. 
            
            

            

                  # Sample usage (selecting the associated Author for an instance of Post, <tt>@post</tt>):
          
      620. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    620. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_radio_buttons(:post, :author_id, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial)
          
      621. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    621. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      622. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    622. 
            
            

            

                  # If <tt>@post.author_id</tt> is already <tt>1</tt>, this would return:
          
      623. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    623. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input id="post_author_id_1" name="post[author_id]" type="radio" value="1" checked="checked" />
          
      624. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    624. 
            
            

            

                  #   <label for="post_author_id_1">D. Heinemeier Hansson</label>
          
      625. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    625. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input id="post_author_id_2" name="post[author_id]" type="radio" value="2" />
          
      626. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    626. 
            
            

            

                  #   <label for="post_author_id_2">D. Thomas</label>
          
      627. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    627. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input id="post_author_id_3" name="post[author_id]" type="radio" value="3" />
          
      628. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    628. 
            
            

            

                  #   <label for="post_author_id_3">M. Clark</label>
          
      629. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    629. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      630. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    630. 
            
            

            

                  # It is also possible to customize the way the elements will be shown by
          
      631. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    631. 
            
            

            

                  # giving a block to the method:
          
      632. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    632. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_radio_buttons(:post, :author_id, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial) do |b|
          
      633. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    633. 
            
            

            

                  #     b.label { b.radio_button }
          
      634. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    634. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      635. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    635. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      636. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    636. 
            
            

            

                  # The argument passed to the block is a special kind of builder for this
          
      637. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    637. 
            
            

            

                  # collection, which has the ability to generate the label and radio button
          
      638. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    638. 
            
            

            

                  # for the current item in the collection, with proper text and value.
          
      639. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    639. 
            
            

            

                  # Using it, you can change the label and radio button display order or
          
      640. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    640. 
            
            

            

                  # even use the label as wrapper, as in the example above.
          
      641. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    641. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      642. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    642. 
            
            

            

                  # The builder methods <tt>label</tt> and <tt>radio_button</tt> also accept
          
      643. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    643. 
            
            

            

                  # extra HTML options:
          
      644. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    644. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_radio_buttons(:post, :author_id, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial) do |b|
          
      645. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    645. 
            
            

            

                  #     b.label(class: "radio_button") { b.radio_button(class: "radio_button") }
          
      646. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    646. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      647. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    647. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      648. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    648. 
            
            

            

                  # There are also three special methods available: <tt>object</tt>, <tt>text</tt> and
          
      649. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    649. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>value</tt>, which are the current item being rendered, its text and value methods,
          
      650. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    650. 
            
            

            

                  # respectively. You can use them like this:
          
      651. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    651. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_radio_buttons(:post, :author_id, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial) do |b|
          
      652. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    652. 
            
            

            

                  #      b.label(:"data-value" => b.value) { b.radio_button + b.text }
          
      653. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    653. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      654. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    654. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      655. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    655. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Gotcha
          
      656. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    656. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      657. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    657. 
            
            

            

                  # The HTML specification says when nothing is selected on a collection of radio buttons
          
      658. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    658. 
            
            

            

                  # web browsers do not send any value to server.
          
      659. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    659. 
            
            

            

                  # Unfortunately this introduces a gotcha:
          
      660. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    660. 
            
            

            

                  # if a +User+ model has a +category_id+ field and in the form no category is selected, no +category_id+ parameter is sent. So,
          
      661. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    661. 
            
            

            

                  # any strong parameters idiom like:
          
      662. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    662. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      663. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    663. 
            
            

            

                  #   params.require(:user).permit(...)
          
      664. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    664. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      665. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    665. 
            
            

            

                  # will raise an error since no <tt>{user: ...}</tt> will be present.
          
      666. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    666. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      667. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    667. 
            
            

            

                  # To prevent this the helper generates an auxiliary hidden field before
          
      668. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    668. 
            
            

            

                  # every collection of radio buttons. The hidden field has the same name as collection radio button and blank value.
          
      669. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    669. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      670. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    670. 
            
            

            

                  # In case if you don't want the helper to generate this hidden field you can specify
          
      671. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    671. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>include_hidden: false</tt> option.
          
      672. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    672. 
            1
            

            

                  def collection_radio_buttons(object, method, collection, value_method, text_method, options = {}, html_options = {}, &block)
          
      673. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    673. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::CollectionRadioButtons.new(object, method, self, collection, value_method, text_method, options, html_options).render(&block)
          
      674. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    674. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      675. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    675. 
            
            

            

            
          
      676. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    676. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns check box tags for the collection of existing return values of
          
      677. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    677. 
            
            

            

                  # +method+ for +object+'s class. The value returned from calling +method+
          
      678. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    678. 
            
            

            

                  # on the instance +object+ will be selected. If calling +method+ returns
          
      679. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    679. 
            
            

            

                  # +nil+, no selection is made.
          
      680. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    680. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      681. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    681. 
            
            

            

                  # The <tt>:value_method</tt> and <tt>:text_method</tt> parameters are
          
      682. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    682. 
            
            

            

                  # methods to be called on each member of +collection+. The return values
          
      683. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    683. 
            
            

            

                  # are used as the +value+ attribute and contents of each check box tag,
          
      684. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    684. 
            
            

            

                  # respectively. They can also be any object that responds to +call+, such
          
      685. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    685. 
            
            

            

                  # as a +proc+, that will be called for each member of the +collection+ to
          
      686. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    686. 
            
            

            

                  # retrieve the value/text.
          
      687. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    687. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      688. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    688. 
            
            

            

                  # Example object structure for use with this method:
          
      689. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    689. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Post < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      690. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    690. 
            
            

            

                  #     has_and_belongs_to_many :authors
          
      691. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    691. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      692. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    692. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Author < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      693. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    693. 
            
            

            

                  #     has_and_belongs_to_many :posts
          
      694. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    694. 
            
            

            

                  #     def name_with_initial
          
      695. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    695. 
            
            

            

                  #       "#{first_name.first}. #{last_name}"
          
      696. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    696. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      697. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    697. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      698. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    698. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      699. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    699. 
            
            

            

                  # Sample usage (selecting the associated Author for an instance of Post, <tt>@post</tt>):
          
      700. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    700. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_check_boxes(:post, :author_ids, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial)
          
      701. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    701. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      702. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    702. 
            
            

            

                  # If <tt>@post.author_ids</tt> is already <tt>[1]</tt>, this would return:
          
      703. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    703. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input id="post_author_ids_1" name="post[author_ids][]" type="checkbox" value="1" checked="checked" />
          
      704. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    704. 
            
            

            

                  #   <label for="post_author_ids_1">D. Heinemeier Hansson</label>
          
      705. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    705. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input id="post_author_ids_2" name="post[author_ids][]" type="checkbox" value="2" />
          
      706. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    706. 
            
            

            

                  #   <label for="post_author_ids_2">D. Thomas</label>
          
      707. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    707. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input id="post_author_ids_3" name="post[author_ids][]" type="checkbox" value="3" />
          
      708. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    708. 
            
            

            

                  #   <label for="post_author_ids_3">M. Clark</label>
          
      709. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    709. 
            
            

            

                  #   <input name="post[author_ids][]" type="hidden" value="" />
          
      710. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    710. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      711. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    711. 
            
            

            

                  # It is also possible to customize the way the elements will be shown by
          
      712. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    712. 
            
            

            

                  # giving a block to the method:
          
      713. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    713. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_check_boxes(:post, :author_ids, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial) do |b|
          
      714. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    714. 
            
            

            

                  #     b.label { b.check_box }
          
      715. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    715. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      716. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    716. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      717. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    717. 
            
            

            

                  # The argument passed to the block is a special kind of builder for this
          
      718. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    718. 
            
            

            

                  # collection, which has the ability to generate the label and check box
          
      719. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    719. 
            
            

            

                  # for the current item in the collection, with proper text and value.
          
      720. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    720. 
            
            

            

                  # Using it, you can change the label and check box display order or even
          
      721. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    721. 
            
            

            

                  # use the label as wrapper, as in the example above.
          
      722. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    722. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      723. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    723. 
            
            

            

                  # The builder methods <tt>label</tt> and <tt>check_box</tt> also accept
          
      724. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    724. 
            
            

            

                  # extra HTML options:
          
      725. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    725. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_check_boxes(:post, :author_ids, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial) do |b|
          
      726. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    726. 
            
            

            

                  #     b.label(class: "check_box") { b.check_box(class: "check_box") }
          
      727. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    727. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      728. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    728. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      729. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    729. 
            
            

            

                  # There are also three special methods available: <tt>object</tt>, <tt>text</tt> and
          
      730. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    730. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>value</tt>, which are the current item being rendered, its text and value methods,
          
      731. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    731. 
            
            

            

                  # respectively. You can use them like this:
          
      732. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    732. 
            
            

            

                  #   collection_check_boxes(:post, :author_ids, Author.all, :id, :name_with_initial) do |b|
          
      733. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    733. 
            
            

            

                  #      b.label(:"data-value" => b.value) { b.check_box + b.text }
          
      734. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    734. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      735. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    735. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      736. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    736. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Gotcha
          
      737. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    737. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      738. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    738. 
            
            

            

                  # When no selection is made for a collection of checkboxes most
          
      739. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    739. 
            
            

            

                  # web browsers will not send any value.
          
      740. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    740. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      741. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    741. 
            
            

            

                  # For example, if we have a +User+ model with +category_ids+ field and we
          
      742. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    742. 
            
            

            

                  # have the following code in our update action:
          
      743. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    743. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      744. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    744. 
            
            

            

                  #   @user.update(params[:user])
          
      745. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    745. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      746. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    746. 
            
            

            

                  # If no +category_ids+ are selected then we can safely assume this field
          
      747. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    747. 
            
            

            

                  # will not be updated.
          
      748. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    748. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      749. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    749. 
            
            

            

                  # This is possible thanks to a hidden field generated by the helper method
          
      750. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    750. 
            
            

            

                  # for every collection of checkboxes.
          
      751. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    751. 
            
            

            

                  # This hidden field is given the same field name as the checkboxes with a
          
      752. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    752. 
            
            

            

                  # blank value.
          
      753. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    753. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      754. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    754. 
            
            

            

                  # In the rare case you don't want this hidden field, you can pass the
          
      755. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    755. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>include_hidden: false</tt> option to the helper method.
          
      756. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    756. 
            1
            

            

                  def collection_check_boxes(object, method, collection, value_method, text_method, options = {}, html_options = {}, &block)
          
      757. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    757. 
            
            

            

                    Tags::CollectionCheckBoxes.new(object, method, self, collection, value_method, text_method, options, html_options).render(&block)
          
      758. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    758. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      759. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    759. 
            
            

            

            
          
      760. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    760. 
            1
            

            

                  private
          
      761. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    761. 
            1
            

            

                    def option_html_attributes(element)
          
      762. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    762. 
            
            

            

                      if Array === element
          
      763. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    763. 
            
            

            

                        element.select { |e| Hash === e }.reduce({}, :merge!)
          
      764. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    764. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      765. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    765. 
            
            

            

                        {}
          
      766. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    766. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      767. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    767. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      768. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    768. 
            
            

            

            
          
      769. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    769. 
            1
            

            

                    def option_text_and_value(option)
          
      770. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    770. 
            
            

            

                      # Options are [text, value] pairs or strings used for both.
          
      771. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    771. 
            
            

            

                      if !option.is_a?(String) && option.respond_to?(:first) && option.respond_to?(:last)
          
      772. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    772. 
            
            

            

                        option = option.reject { |e| Hash === e } if Array === option
          
      773. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    773. 
            
            

            

                        [option.first, option.last]
          
      774. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    774. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      775. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    775. 
            
            

            

                        [option, option]
          
      776. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    776. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      777. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    777. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      778. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    778. 
            
            

            

            
          
      779. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    779. 
            1
            

            

                    def option_value_selected?(value, selected)
          
      780. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    780. 
            
            

            

                      Array(selected).include? value
          
      781. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    781. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      782. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    782. 
            
            

            

            
          
      783. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    783. 
            1
            

            

                    def extract_selected_and_disabled(selected)
          
      784. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    784. 
            
            

            

                      if selected.is_a?(Proc)
          
      785. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    785. 
            
            

            

                        [selected, nil]
          
      786. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    786. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      787. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    787. 
            
            

            

                        selected = Array.wrap(selected)
          
      788. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    788. 
            
            

            

                        options = selected.extract_options!.symbolize_keys
          
      789. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    789. 
            
            

            

                        selected_items = options.fetch(:selected, selected)
          
      790. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    790. 
            
            

            

                        [selected_items, options[:disabled]]
          
      791. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    791. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      792. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    792. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      793. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    793. 
            
            

            

            
          
      794. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    794. 
            1
            

            

                    def extract_values_from_collection(collection, value_method, selected)
          
      795. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    795. 
            
            

            

                      if selected.is_a?(Proc)
          
      796. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    796. 
            
            

            

                        collection.map do |element|
          
      797. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    797. 
            
            

            

                          public_or_deprecated_send(element, value_method) if selected.call(element)
          
      798. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    798. 
            
            

            

                        end.compact
          
      799. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    799. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      800. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    800. 
            
            

            

                        selected
          
      801. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    801. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      802. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    802. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      803. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    803. 
            
            

            

            
          
      804. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    804. 
            1
            

            

                    def value_for_collection(item, value)
          
      805. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    805. 
            
            

            

                      value.respond_to?(:call) ? value.call(item) : public_or_deprecated_send(item, value)
          
      806. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    806. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      807. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    807. 
            
            

            

            
          
      808. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    808. 
            1
            

            

                    def public_or_deprecated_send(item, value)
          
      809. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    809. 
            
            

            

                      item.public_send(value)
          
      810. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    810. 
            
            

            

                    rescue NoMethodError
          
      811. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    811. 
            
            

            

                      raise unless item.respond_to?(value, true) && !item.respond_to?(value)
          
      812. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    812. 
            
            

            

                      ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn "Using private methods from view helpers is deprecated (calling private #{item.class}##{value})"
          
      813. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    813. 
            
            

            

                      item.send(value)
          
      814. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    814. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      815. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    815. 
            
            

            

            
          
      816. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    816. 
            1
            

            

                    def prompt_text(prompt)
          
      817. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    817. 
            
            

            

                      prompt.kind_of?(String) ? prompt : I18n.translate("helpers.select.prompt", default: "Please select")
          
      818. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    818. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      819. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    819. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      820. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    820. 
            
            

            

            
          
      821. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    821.

            module ActionView
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              # = Action View Form Tag Helpers
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            1
            

            

              module Helpers #:nodoc:
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                # Provides a number of methods for creating form tags that don't rely on an Active Record object assigned to the template like
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                # FormHelper does. Instead, you provide the names and values manually.
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                # NOTE: The HTML options <tt>disabled</tt>, <tt>readonly</tt>, and <tt>multiple</tt> can all be treated as booleans. So specifying
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>disabled: true</tt> will give <tt>disabled="disabled"</tt>.
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            1
            

            

                module FormTagHelper
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            1
            

            

                  extend ActiveSupport::Concern
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

            
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            1
            

            

                  include UrlHelper
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            1
            

            

                  include TextHelper
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            1
            

            

                  mattr_accessor :embed_authenticity_token_in_remote_forms
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            1
            

            

                  self.embed_authenticity_token_in_remote_forms = nil
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            1
            

            

                  mattr_accessor :default_enforce_utf8, default: true
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

            
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  # Starts a form tag that points the action to a URL configured with <tt>url_for_options</tt> just like
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  # ActionController::Base#url_for. The method for the form defaults to POST.
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:multipart</tt> - If set to true, the enctype is set to "multipart/form-data".
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:method</tt> - The method to use when submitting the form, usually either "get" or "post".
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                  #   If "patch", "put", "delete", or another verb is used, a hidden input with name <tt>_method</tt>
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                  #   is added to simulate the verb over post.
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:authenticity_token</tt> - Authenticity token to use in the form. Use only if you need to
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                  #   pass custom authenticity token string, or to not add authenticity_token field at all
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                  #   (by passing <tt>false</tt>).  Remote forms may omit the embedded authenticity token
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  #   by setting <tt>config.action_view.embed_authenticity_token_in_remote_forms = false</tt>.
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                  #   This is helpful when you're fragment-caching the form. Remote forms get the
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                  #   authenticity token from the <tt>meta</tt> tag, so embedding is unnecessary unless you
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                  #   support browsers without JavaScript.
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:remote</tt> - If set to true, will allow the Unobtrusive JavaScript drivers to control the
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  #   submit behavior. By default this behavior is an ajax submit.
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:enforce_utf8</tt> - If set to false, a hidden input with name utf8 is not output.
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  # * Any other key creates standard HTML attributes for the tag.
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  #   form_tag('/posts')
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <form action="/posts" method="post">
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  #   form_tag('/posts/1', method: :put)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <form action="/posts/1" method="post"> ... <input name="_method" type="hidden" value="put" /> ...
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  #   form_tag('/upload', multipart: true)
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <form action="/upload" method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_tag('/posts') do -%>
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  #     <div><%= submit_tag 'Save' %></div>
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end -%>
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <form action="/posts" method="post"><div><input type="submit" name="commit" value="Save" /></div></form>
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= form_tag('/posts', remote: true) %>
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <form action="/posts" method="post" data-remote="true">
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  #   form_tag('http://far.away.com/form', authenticity_token: false)
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  #   # form without authenticity token
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  #   form_tag('http://far.away.com/form', authenticity_token: "cf50faa3fe97702ca1ae")
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  #   # form with custom authenticity token
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            1
            

            

                  def form_tag(url_for_options = {}, options = {}, &block)
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                    html_options = html_options_for_form(url_for_options, options)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                    if block_given?
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                      form_tag_with_body(html_options, capture(&block))
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                      form_tag_html(html_options)
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

            
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  # Creates a dropdown selection box, or if the <tt>:multiple</tt> option is set to true, a multiple
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  # choice selection box.
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  # Helpers::FormOptions can be used to create common select boxes such as countries, time zones, or
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  # associated records. <tt>option_tags</tt> is a string containing the option tags for the select box.
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:multiple</tt> - If set to true, the selection will allow multiple choices.
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:disabled</tt> - If set to true, the user will not be able to use this input.
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:include_blank</tt> - If set to true, an empty option will be created. If set to a string, the string will be used as the option's content and the value will be empty.
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:prompt</tt> - Create a prompt option with blank value and the text asking user to select something.
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  # * Any other key creates standard HTML attributes for the tag.
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "people", options_from_collection_for_select(@people, "id", "name")
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  #   # <select id="people" name="people"><option value="1">David</option></select>
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "people", options_from_collection_for_select(@people, "id", "name", "1")
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  #   # <select id="people" name="people"><option value="1" selected="selected">David</option></select>
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "people", raw("<option>David</option>")
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <select id="people" name="people"><option>David</option></select>
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "count", raw("<option>1</option><option>2</option><option>3</option><option>4</option>")
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <select id="count" name="count"><option>1</option><option>2</option>
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <option>3</option><option>4</option></select>
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "colors", raw("<option>Red</option><option>Green</option><option>Blue</option>"), multiple: true
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <select id="colors" multiple="multiple" name="colors[]"><option>Red</option>
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <option>Green</option><option>Blue</option></select>
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "locations", raw("<option>Home</option><option selected='selected'>Work</option><option>Out</option>")
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <select id="locations" name="locations"><option>Home</option><option selected='selected'>Work</option>
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <option>Out</option></select>
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "access", raw("<option>Read</option><option>Write</option>"), multiple: true, class: 'form_input', id: 'unique_id'
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <select class="form_input" id="unique_id" multiple="multiple" name="access[]"><option>Read</option>
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    <option>Write</option></select>
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  #   select_tag "people", options_from_collection_for_select(@people, "id", "name"), include_blank: true
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121.
