            1
            

            

            module ActionView
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              # = Action View Text Helpers
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            1
            

            

              module Helpers #:nodoc:
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                # The TextHelper module provides a set of methods for filtering, formatting
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                # and transforming strings, which can reduce the amount of inline Ruby code in
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                # your views. These helper methods extend Action View making them callable
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                # within your template files.
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Sanitization
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                # Most text helpers that generate HTML output sanitize the given input by default,
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                # but do not escape it. This means HTML tags will appear in the page but all malicious
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                # code will be removed. Let's look at some examples using the +simple_format+ method:
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                #   simple_format('<a href="http://example.com/">Example</a>')
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                #   # => "<p><a href=\"http://example.com/\">Example</a></p>"
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                #   simple_format('<a href="javascript:alert(\'no!\')">Example</a>')
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                #   # => "<p><a>Example</a></p>"
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                # If you want to escape all content, you should invoke the +h+ method before
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                # calling the text helper.
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                #   simple_format h('<a href="http://example.com/">Example</a>')
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                #   # => "<p>&lt;a href=\"http://example.com/\"&gt;Example&lt;/a&gt;</p>"
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            1
            

            

                module TextHelper
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            1
            

            

                  extend ActiveSupport::Concern
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

            
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            1
            

            

                  include SanitizeHelper
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            1
            

            

                  include TagHelper
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            1
            

            

                  include OutputSafetyHelper
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

            
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                  # The preferred method of outputting text in your views is to use the
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  # <%= "text" %> eRuby syntax. The regular _puts_ and _print_ methods
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                  # do not operate as expected in an eRuby code block. If you absolutely must
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                  # output text within a non-output code block (i.e., <% %>), you can use the concat method.
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  #       concat "hello"
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  #       # is the equivalent of <%= "hello" %>
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  #       if logged_in
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  #         concat "Logged in!"
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  #       else
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  #         concat link_to('login', action: :login)
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  #       end
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  #       # will either display "Logged in!" or a login link
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  #   %>
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            1
            

            

                  def concat(string)
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                    output_buffer << string
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

            
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            1
            

            

                  def safe_concat(string)
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                    output_buffer.respond_to?(:safe_concat) ? output_buffer.safe_concat(string) : concat(string)
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

            
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  # Truncates a given +text+ after a given <tt>:length</tt> if +text+ is longer than <tt>:length</tt>
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  # (defaults to 30). The last characters will be replaced with the <tt>:omission</tt> (defaults to "...")
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  # for a total length not exceeding <tt>:length</tt>.
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  # Pass a <tt>:separator</tt> to truncate +text+ at a natural break.
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  # Pass a block if you want to show extra content when the text is truncated.
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  # The result is marked as HTML-safe, but it is escaped by default, unless <tt>:escape</tt> is
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  # +false+. Care should be taken if +text+ contains HTML tags or entities, because truncation
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                  # may produce invalid HTML (such as unbalanced or incomplete tags).
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("Once upon a time in a world far far away")
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "Once upon a time in a world..."
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("Once upon a time in a world far far away", length: 17)
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "Once upon a ti..."
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("Once upon a time in a world far far away", length: 17, separator: ' ')
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "Once upon a..."
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("And they found that many people were sleeping better.", length: 25, omission: '... (continued)')
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "And they f... (continued)"
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("<p>Once upon a time in a world far far away</p>")
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "&lt;p&gt;Once upon a time in a wo..."
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("<p>Once upon a time in a world far far away</p>", escape: false)
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<p>Once upon a time in a wo..."
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  #   truncate("Once upon a time in a world far far away") { link_to "Continue", "#" }
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "Once upon a time in a wo...<a href="#">Continue</a>"
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            1
            

            

                  def truncate(text, options = {}, &block)
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                    if text
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                      length  = options.fetch(:length, 30)
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

            
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                      content = text.truncate(length, options)
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                      content = options[:escape] == false ? content.html_safe : ERB::Util.html_escape(content)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                      content << capture(&block) if block_given? && text.length > length
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                      content
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

            
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                  # Highlights one or more +phrases+ everywhere in +text+ by inserting it into
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                  # a <tt>:highlighter</tt> string. The highlighter can be specialized by passing <tt>:highlighter</tt>
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  # as a single-quoted string with <tt>\1</tt> where the phrase is to be inserted (defaults to
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  # '<mark>\1</mark>') or passing a block that receives each matched term. By default +text+
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  # is sanitized to prevent possible XSS attacks. If the input is trustworthy, passing false
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  # for <tt>:sanitize</tt> will turn sanitizing off.
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('You searched for: rails', 'rails')
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => You searched for: <mark>rails</mark>
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('You searched for: rails', /for|rails/)
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => You searched <mark>for</mark>: <mark>rails</mark>
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('You searched for: ruby, rails, dhh', 'actionpack')
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => You searched for: ruby, rails, dhh
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('You searched for: rails', ['for', 'rails'], highlighter: '<em>\1</em>')
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => You searched <em>for</em>: <em>rails</em>
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('You searched for: rails', 'rails', highlighter: '<a href="search?q=\1">\1</a>')
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => You searched for: <a href="search?q=rails">rails</a>
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('You searched for: rails', 'rails') { |match| link_to(search_path(q: match, match)) }
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => You searched for: <a href="search?q=rails">rails</a>
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  #   highlight('<a href="javascript:alert(\'no!\')">ruby</a> on rails', 'rails', sanitize: false)
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="javascript:alert('no!')">ruby</a> on <mark>rails</mark>
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            1
            

            

                  def highlight(text, phrases, options = {})
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                    text = sanitize(text) if options.fetch(:sanitize, true)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

            
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                    if text.blank? || phrases.blank?
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                      text || ""
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                      match = Array(phrases).map do |p|
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                        Regexp === p ? p.to_s : Regexp.escape(p)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                      end.join("|")
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

            
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                      if block_given?
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                        text.gsub(/(#{match})(?![^<]*?>)/i) { |found| yield found }
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                        highlighter = options.fetch(:highlighter, '<mark>\1</mark>')
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                        text.gsub(/(#{match})(?![^<]*?>)/i, highlighter)
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                    end.html_safe
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  # Extracts an excerpt from +text+ that matches the first instance of +phrase+.
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  # The <tt>:radius</tt> option expands the excerpt on each side of the first occurrence of +phrase+ by the number of characters
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  # defined in <tt>:radius</tt> (which defaults to 100). If the excerpt radius overflows the beginning or end of the +text+,
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  # then the <tt>:omission</tt> option (which defaults to "...") will be prepended/appended accordingly. Use the
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>:separator</tt> option to choose the delimitation. The resulting string will be stripped in any case. If the +phrase+
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  # isn't found, +nil+ is returned.
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  #   excerpt('This is an example', 'an', radius: 5)
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => ...s is an exam...
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  #   excerpt('This is an example', 'is', radius: 5)
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => This is a...
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  #   excerpt('This is an example', 'is')
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => This is an example
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  #   excerpt('This next thing is an example', 'ex', radius: 2)
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => ...next...
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  #   excerpt('This is also an example', 'an', radius: 8, omission: '<chop> ')
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <chop> is also an example
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  #   excerpt('This is a very beautiful morning', 'very', separator: ' ', radius: 1)
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => ...a very beautiful...
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            1
            

            

                  def excerpt(text, phrase, options = {})
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                    return unless text && phrase
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

            
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                    separator = options.fetch(:separator, nil) || ""
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                    case phrase
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                    when Regexp
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                      regex = phrase
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                      regex = /#{Regexp.escape(phrase)}/i
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

            
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                    return unless matches = text.match(regex)
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                    phrase = matches[0]
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

            
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                    unless separator.empty?
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                      text.split(separator).each do |value|
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                        if value.match?(regex)
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                          phrase = value
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                          break
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

            
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                    first_part, second_part = text.split(phrase, 2)
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

            
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                    prefix, first_part   = cut_excerpt_part(:first, first_part, separator, options)
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                    postfix, second_part = cut_excerpt_part(:second, second_part, separator, options)
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

            
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                    affix = [first_part, separator, phrase, separator, second_part].join.strip
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                    [prefix, affix, postfix].join
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

            
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                  # Attempts to pluralize the +singular+ word unless +count+ is 1. If
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                  # +plural+ is supplied, it will use that when count is > 1, otherwise
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                  # it will use the Inflector to determine the plural form for the given locale,
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                  # which defaults to I18n.locale
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                  # The word will be pluralized using rules defined for the locale
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                  # (you must define your own inflection rules for languages other than English).
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                  # See ActiveSupport::Inflector.pluralize
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                  #   pluralize(1, 'person')
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => 1 person
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                  #   pluralize(2, 'person')
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => 2 people
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  #   pluralize(3, 'person', plural: 'users')
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => 3 users
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                  #   pluralize(0, 'person')
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => 0 people
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                  #   pluralize(2, 'Person', locale: :de)
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => 2 Personen
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            1
            

            

                  def pluralize(count, singular, plural_arg = nil, plural: plural_arg, locale: I18n.locale)
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                    word = if count == 1 || count.to_s.match?(/^1(\.0+)?$/)
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                      singular
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

                      plural || singular.pluralize(locale)
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

            
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                    "#{count || 0} #{word}"
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

            
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  # Wraps the +text+ into lines no longer than +line_width+ width. This method
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                  # breaks on the first whitespace character that does not exceed +line_width+
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                  # (which is 80 by default).
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  #   word_wrap('Once upon a time')
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => Once upon a time
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  #   word_wrap('Once upon a time, in a kingdom called Far Far Away, a king fell ill, and finding a successor to the throne turned out to be more trouble than anyone could have imagined...')
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => Once upon a time, in a kingdom called Far Far Away, a king fell ill, and finding\na successor to the throne turned out to be more trouble than anyone could have\nimagined...
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  #   word_wrap('Once upon a time', line_width: 8)
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => Once\nupon a\ntime
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                  #   word_wrap('Once upon a time', line_width: 1)
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => Once\nupon\na\ntime
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  #   You can also specify a custom +break_sequence+ ("\n" by default)
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  #   word_wrap('Once upon a time', line_width: 1, break_sequence: "\r\n")
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => Once\r\nupon\r\na\r\ntime
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            1
            

            

                  def word_wrap(text, line_width: 80, break_sequence: "\n")
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                    text.split("\n").collect! do |line|
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                      line.length > line_width ? line.gsub(/(.{1,#{line_width}})(\s+|$)/, "\\1#{break_sequence}").rstrip : line
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                    end * break_sequence
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

            
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns +text+ transformed into HTML using simple formatting rules.
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                  # Two or more consecutive newlines(<tt>\n\n</tt> or <tt>\r\n\r\n</tt>) are
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                  # considered a paragraph and wrapped in <tt><p></tt> tags. One newline
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                  # (<tt>\n</tt> or <tt>\r\n</tt>) is considered a linebreak and a
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt><br /></tt> tag is appended. This method does not remove the
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                  # newlines from the +text+.
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

                  # You can pass any HTML attributes into <tt>html_options</tt>. These
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

                  # will be added to all created paragraphs.
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:sanitize</tt> - If +false+, does not sanitize +text+.
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:wrapper_tag</tt> - String representing the wrapper tag, defaults to <tt>"p"</tt>
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

                  #   my_text = "Here is some basic text...\n...with a line break."
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

                  #   simple_format(my_text)
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<p>Here is some basic text...\n<br />...with a line break.</p>"
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

                  #   simple_format(my_text, {}, wrapper_tag: "div")
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<div>Here is some basic text...\n<br />...with a line break.</div>"
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

                  #   more_text = "We want to put a paragraph...\n\n...right there."
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                  #   simple_format(more_text)
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<p>We want to put a paragraph...</p>\n\n<p>...right there.</p>"
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

                  #   simple_format("Look ma! A class!", class: 'description')
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<p class='description'>Look ma! A class!</p>"
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                  #   simple_format("<blink>Unblinkable.</blink>")
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<p>Unblinkable.</p>"
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

                  #   simple_format("<blink>Blinkable!</blink> It's true.", {}, sanitize: false)
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<p><blink>Blinkable!</blink> It's true.</p>"
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            1
            

            

                  def simple_format(text, html_options = {}, options = {})
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

                    wrapper_tag = options.fetch(:wrapper_tag, :p)
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

            
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

                    text = sanitize(text) if options.fetch(:sanitize, true)
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                    paragraphs = split_paragraphs(text)
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

            
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                    if paragraphs.empty?
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                      content_tag(wrapper_tag, nil, html_options)
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                      paragraphs.map! { |paragraph|
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

                        content_tag(wrapper_tag, raw(paragraph), html_options)
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

                      }.join("\n\n").html_safe
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

            
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                  # Creates a Cycle object whose _to_s_ method cycles through elements of an
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                  # array every time it is called. This can be used for example, to alternate
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

                  # classes for table rows. You can use named cycles to allow nesting in loops.
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

                  # Passing a Hash as the last parameter with a <tt>:name</tt> key will create a
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                  # named cycle. The default name for a cycle without a +:name+ key is
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>"default"</tt>. You can manually reset a cycle by calling reset_cycle
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

                  # and passing the name of the cycle. The current cycle string can be obtained
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                  # anytime using the current_cycle method.
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Alternate CSS classes for even and odd numbers...
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

                  #   @items = [1,2,3,4]
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

                  #   <table>
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% @items.each do |item| %>
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

                  #     <tr class="<%= cycle("odd", "even") -%>">
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

                  #       <td><%= item %></td>
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

                  #     </tr>
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

                  #   </table>
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Cycle CSS classes for rows, and text colors for values within each row
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

                  #   @items = x = [{first: 'Robert', middle: 'Daniel', last: 'James'},
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

                  #                {first: 'Emily', middle: 'Shannon', maiden: 'Pike', last: 'Hicks'},
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                  #               {first: 'June', middle: 'Dae', last: 'Jones'}]
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% @items.each do |item| %>
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            
            

            

                  #     <tr class="<%= cycle("odd", "even", name: "row_class") -%>">
          
      343. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    343. 
            
            

            

                  #       <td>
          
      344. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    344. 
            
            

            

                  #         <% item.values.each do |value| %>
          
      345. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    345. 
            
            

            

                  #           <%# Create a named cycle "colors" %>
          
      346. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    346. 
            
            

            

                  #           <span style="color:<%= cycle("red", "green", "blue", name: "colors") -%>">
          
      347. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    347. 
            
            

            

                  #             <%= value %>
          
      348. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    348. 
            
            

            

                  #           </span>
          
      349. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    349. 
            
            

            

                  #         <% end %>
          
      350. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    350. 
            
            

            

                  #         <% reset_cycle("colors") %>
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            
            

            

                  #       </td>
          
      352. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    352. 
            
            

            

                  #    </tr>
          
      353. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    353. 
            
            

            

                  #  <% end %>
          
      354. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    354. 
            1
            

            

                  def cycle(first_value, *values)
          
      355. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    355. 
            
            

            

                    options = values.extract_options!
          
      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356. 
            
            

            

                    name = options.fetch(:name, "default")
          
      357. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    357. 
            
            

            

            
          
      358. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    358. 
            
            

            

                    values.unshift(*first_value)
          
      359. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    359. 
            
            

            

            
          
      360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    360. 
            
            

            

                    cycle = get_cycle(name)
          
      361. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    361. 
            
            

            

                    unless cycle && cycle.values == values
          
      362. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    362. 
            
            

            

                      cycle = set_cycle(name, Cycle.new(*values))
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364. 
            
            

            

                    cycle.to_s
          
      365. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    365. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

            
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns the current cycle string after a cycle has been started. Useful
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                  # for complex table highlighting or any other design need which requires
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                  # the current cycle string in more than one place.
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      371. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    371. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Alternate background colors
          
      372. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    372. 
            
            

            

                  #   @items = [1,2,3,4]
          
      373. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    373. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% @items.each do |item| %>
          
      374. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    374. 
            
            

            

                  #     <div style="background-color:<%= cycle("red","white","blue") %>">
          
      375. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    375. 
            
            

            

                  #       <span style="background-color:<%= current_cycle %>"><%= item %></span>
          
      376. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    376. 
            
            

            

                  #     </div>
          
      377. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    377. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            1
            

            

                  def current_cycle(name = "default")
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                    cycle = get_cycle(name)
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                    cycle.current_value if cycle
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            
            

            

            
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            
            

            

                  # Resets a cycle so that it starts from the first element the next time
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                  # it is called. Pass in +name+ to reset a named cycle.
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                  #   # Alternate CSS classes for even and odd numbers...
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                  #   @items = [[1,2,3,4], [5,6,3], [3,4,5,6,7,4]]
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                  #   <table>
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% @items.each do |item| %>
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                  #     <tr class="<%= cycle("even", "odd") -%>">
          
      391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    391. 
            
            

            

                  #         <% item.each do |value| %>
          
      392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    392. 
            
            

            

                  #           <span style="color:<%= cycle("#333", "#666", "#999", name: "colors") -%>">
          
      393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    393. 
            
            

            

                  #             <%= value %>
          
      394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    394. 
            
            

            

                  #           </span>
          
      395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    395. 
            
            

            

                  #         <% end %>
          
      396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    396. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    397. 
            
            

            

                  #         <% reset_cycle("colors") %>
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

                  #     </tr>
          
      399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    399. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    400. 
            
            

            

                  #   </table>
          
      401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    401. 
            1
            

            

                  def reset_cycle(name = "default")
          
      402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    402. 
            
            

            

                    cycle = get_cycle(name)
          
      403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    403. 
            
            

            

                    cycle.reset if cycle
          
      404. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    404. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      405. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    405. 
            
            

            

            
          
      406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    406. 
            1
            

            

                  class Cycle #:nodoc:
          
      407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    407. 
            1
            

            

                    attr_reader :values
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            
            

            

            
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            1
            

            

                    def initialize(first_value, *values)
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            
            

            

                      @values = values.unshift(first_value)

    417.

                    def current_value

                    # The cycle helpers need to store the cycles in a place that is
          
      444. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    444. 
            
            

            

                    # guaranteed to be reset every time a page is rendered, so it
          
      445. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    445. 
            
            

            

                    # uses an instance variable of ActionView::Base.
          
      446.

            1
            

            

                    def get_cycle(name)
          
      447. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    447. 
            
            

            

                      @_cycles = Hash.new unless defined?(@_cycles)

                    def set_cycle(name, cycle_object)

                      @_cycles = Hash.new unless defined?(@_cycles)

                    def split_paragraphs(text)
          
      457. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    457. 
            
            

            

                      return [] if text.blank?
          
      458. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    458. 
            
            

            

            
          
      459. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    459. 
            
            

            

                      text.to_str.gsub(/\r\n?/, "\n").split(/\n\n+/).map! do |t|
          
      460. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    460. 
            
            

            

                        t.gsub!(/([^\n]\n)(?=[^\n])/, '\1<br />') || t
          
      461.

                    def cut_excerpt_part(part_position, part, separator, options)
          
      465. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    465. 
            
            

            

                      return "", "" unless part
          
      466. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    466. 
            
            

            

            
          
      467. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    467. 
            
            

            

                      radius   = options.fetch(:radius, 100)
          
      468. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    468. 
            
            

            

                      omission = options.fetch(:omission, "...")
          
      469. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    469. 
            
            

            

            
          
      470. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    470. 
            
            

            

                      part = part.split(separator)
          
      471. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    471. 
            
            

            

                      part.delete("")
          
      472. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    472. 
            
            

            

                      affix = part.size > radius ? omission : ""
          
      473. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    473. 
            
            

            

            
          
      474. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    474. 
            
            

            

                      part = if part_position == :first
          
      475. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    475. 
            
            

            

                        drop_index = [part.length - radius, 0].max
          
      476. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    476. 
            
            

            

                        part.drop(drop_index)
          
      477. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    477. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      478. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    478. 
            
            

            

                        part.first(radius)
          
      479. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    479. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      480. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    480. 
            
            

            

            
          
      481. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    481. 
            
            

            

                      return affix, part.join(separator)
          
      482. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    482. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      483. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    483. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      484. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    484. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      485. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    485. 
            
            

            

            end

                module TranslationHelper

                  extend ActiveSupport::Concern

                  included do

                    mattr_accessor :debug_missing_translation, default: true

                  end
