                  # Delegates to <tt>I18n#translate</tt> but also performs three additional
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  # functions.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  # First, it will ensure that any thrown +MissingTranslation+ messages will
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                  # be rendered as inline spans that:
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  # * Have a <tt>translation-missing</tt> class applied
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  # * Contain the missing key as the value of the +title+ attribute
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  # * Have a titleized version of the last key segment as text
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  # For example, the value returned for the missing translation key
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>"blog.post.title"</tt> will be:
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  #    <span
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  #      class="translation_missing"
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                  #      title="translation missing: en.blog.post.title">Title</span>
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  # This allows for views to display rather reasonable strings while still
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                  # giving developers a way to find missing translations.
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  # If you would prefer missing translations to raise an error, you can
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                  # opt out of span-wrapping behavior globally by setting
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>ActionView::Base.raise_on_missing_translations = true</tt> or
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                  # individually by passing <tt>raise: true</tt> as an option to
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>translate</tt>.
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  # Second, if the key starts with a period <tt>translate</tt> will scope
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  # the key by the current partial. Calling <tt>translate(".foo")</tt> from
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  # the <tt>people/index.html.erb</tt> template is equivalent to calling
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>translate("people.index.foo")</tt>. This makes it less
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  # repetitive to translate many keys within the same partial and provides
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  # a convention to scope keys consistently.
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  # Third, the translation will be marked as <tt>html_safe</tt> if the key
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                  # has the suffix "_html" or the last element of the key is "html". Calling
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>translate("footer_html")</tt> or <tt>translate("footer.html")</tt>
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  # will return an HTML safe string that won't be escaped by other HTML
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  # helper methods. This naming convention helps to identify translations
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  # that include HTML tags so that you know what kind of output to expect
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  # when you call translate in a template and translators know which keys
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  # they can provide HTML values for.
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            1
            

            

                  def translate(key, **options)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                    unless options[:default].nil?
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                      remaining_defaults = Array.wrap(options.delete(:default)).compact
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                      options[:default] = remaining_defaults unless remaining_defaults.first.kind_of?(Symbol)
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

            
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                    # If the user has explicitly decided to NOT raise errors, pass that option to I18n.
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                    # Otherwise, tell I18n to raise an exception, which we rescue further in this method.
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                    # Note: `raise_error` refers to us re-raising the error in this method. I18n is forced to raise by default.
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                    if options[:raise] == false
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                      raise_error = false
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                      i18n_raise = false
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                      raise_error = options[:raise] || ActionView::Base.raise_on_missing_translations
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                      i18n_raise = true
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

            
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                    if html_safe_translation_key?(key)
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                      html_safe_options = options.dup
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                      options.except(*I18n::RESERVED_KEYS).each do |name, value|
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                        unless name == :count && value.is_a?(Numeric)
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                          html_safe_options[name] = ERB::Util.html_escape(value.to_s)
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                      translation = I18n.translate(scope_key_by_partial(key), **html_safe_options.merge(raise: i18n_raise))
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                      if translation.respond_to?(:map)
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                        translation.map { |element| element.respond_to?(:html_safe) ? element.html_safe : element }
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                        translation.respond_to?(:html_safe) ? translation.html_safe : translation
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                      I18n.translate(scope_key_by_partial(key), **options.merge(raise: i18n_raise))
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  rescue I18n::MissingTranslationData => e
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                    if remaining_defaults.present?
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                      translate remaining_defaults.shift, **options.merge(default: remaining_defaults)
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                      raise e if raise_error
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

            
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                      keys = I18n.normalize_keys(e.locale, e.key, e.options[:scope])
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                      title = +"translation missing: #{keys.join('.')}"
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                      interpolations = options.except(:default, :scope)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                      if interpolations.any?
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                        title << ", " << interpolations.map { |k, v| "#{k}: #{ERB::Util.html_escape(v)}" }.join(", ")
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

            
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                      return title unless ActionView::Base.debug_missing_translation
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

            
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                      content_tag("span", keys.last.to_s.titleize, class: "translation_missing", title: title)
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            1
            

            

                  alias :t :translate
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

            
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  # Delegates to <tt>I18n.localize</tt> with no additional functionality.
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  # See https://www.rubydoc.info/github/svenfuchs/i18n/master/I18n/Backend/Base:localize
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  # for more information.
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            1
            

            

                  def localize(object, **options)
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                    I18n.localize(object, **options)
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            1
            

            

                  alias :l :localize
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

            
          
      123.

            1
            

            

                  private
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            1
            

            

                    def scope_key_by_partial(key)
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                      stringified_key = key.to_s
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                      if stringified_key.start_with?(".")
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                        if @current_template&.virtual_path
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                          @_scope_key_by_partial_cache ||= {}
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                          @_scope_key_by_partial_cache[@current_template.virtual_path] ||= @current_template.virtual_path.gsub(%r{/_?}, ".")
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                          "#{@_scope_key_by_partial_cache[@current_template.virtual_path]}#{stringified_key}"
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                        else
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                          raise "Cannot use t(#{key.inspect}) shortcut because path is not available"
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                        key
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            1
            

            

                    def html_safe_translation_key?(key)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                      /(?:_|\b)html\z/.match?(key.to_s)
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      145.

              module Helpers #:nodoc:
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                # Provides a set of methods for making links and getting URLs that
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                # depend on the routing subsystem (see ActionDispatch::Routing).
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                # This allows you to use the same format for links in views
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                # and controllers.
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            1
            

            

                module UrlHelper
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                  # This helper may be included in any class that includes the
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  # URL helpers of a routes (routes.url_helpers). Some methods
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                  # provided here will only work in the context of a request
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                  # (link_to_unless_current, for instance), which must be provided
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  # as a method called #request on the context.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            1
            

            

                  BUTTON_TAG_METHOD_VERBS = %w{patch put delete}
          
      22.

                  # Basic implementation of url_for to allow use helpers without routes existence
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            1
            

            

                  def url_for(options = nil) # :nodoc:
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                    case options
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                    when String
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                      options
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                    when :back
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                      _back_url
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                      raise ArgumentError, "arguments passed to url_for can't be handled. Please require " \
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                                           "routes or provide your own implementation"
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

            
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            1
            

            

                  def _back_url # :nodoc:
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                    _filtered_referrer || "javascript:history.back()"
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            1
            

            

                  private :_back_url
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

            
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            1
            

            

                  def _filtered_referrer # :nodoc:
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                    if controller.respond_to?(:request)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                      referrer = controller.request.env["HTTP_REFERER"]
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                      if referrer && URI(referrer).scheme != "javascript"
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                        referrer
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  rescue URI::InvalidURIError
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            1
            

            

                  private :_filtered_referrer
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  # Creates an anchor element of the given +name+ using a URL created by the set of +options+.
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  # See the valid options in the documentation for +url_for+. It's also possible to
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  # pass a \String instead of an options hash, which generates an anchor element that uses the
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  # value of the \String as the href for the link. Using a <tt>:back</tt> \Symbol instead
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  # of an options hash will generate a link to the referrer (a JavaScript back link
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  # will be used in place of a referrer if none exists). If +nil+ is passed as the name
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  # the value of the link itself will become the name.
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Signatures
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to(body, url, html_options = {})
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                  #     # url is a String; you can use URL helpers like
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  #     # posts_path
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to(body, url_options = {}, html_options = {})
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  #     # url_options, except :method, is passed to url_for
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to(options = {}, html_options = {}) do
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  #     # name
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to(url, html_options = {}) do
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  #     # name
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:data</tt> - This option can be used to add custom data attributes.
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>method: symbol of HTTP verb</tt> - This modifier will dynamically
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  #   create an HTML form and immediately submit the form for processing using
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  #   the HTTP verb specified. Useful for having links perform a POST operation
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  #   in dangerous actions like deleting a record (which search bots can follow
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  #   while spidering your site). Supported verbs are <tt>:post</tt>, <tt>:delete</tt>, <tt>:patch</tt>, and <tt>:put</tt>.
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  #   Note that if the user has JavaScript disabled, the request will fall back
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  #   to using GET. If <tt>href: '#'</tt> is used and the user has JavaScript
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  #   disabled clicking the link will have no effect. If you are relying on the
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  #   POST behavior, you should check for it in your controller's action by using
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  #   the request object's methods for <tt>post?</tt>, <tt>delete?</tt>, <tt>patch?</tt>, or <tt>put?</tt>.
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>remote: true</tt> - This will allow the unobtrusive JavaScript
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  #   driver to make an Ajax request to the URL in question instead of following
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  #   the link. The drivers each provide mechanisms for listening for the
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  #   completion of the Ajax request and performing JavaScript operations once
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                  #   they're complete
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Data attributes
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>confirm: 'question?'</tt> - This will allow the unobtrusive JavaScript
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  #   driver to prompt with the question specified (in this case, the
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  #   resulting text would be <tt>question?</tt>. If the user accepts, the
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  #   link is processed normally, otherwise no action is taken.
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:disable_with</tt> - Value of this parameter will be used as the
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  #   name for a disabled version of the link. This feature is provided by
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  #   the unobtrusive JavaScript driver.
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  # Because it relies on +url_for+, +link_to+ supports both older-style controller/action/id arguments
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  # and newer RESTful routes. Current Rails style favors RESTful routes whenever possible, so base
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  # your application on resources and use
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Profile", profile_path(@profile)
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles/1">Profile</a>
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  # or the even pithier
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Profile", @profile
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles/1">Profile</a>
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  # in place of the older more verbose, non-resource-oriented
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Profile", controller: "profiles", action: "show", id: @profile
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles/show/1">Profile</a>
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  # Similarly,
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Profiles", profiles_path
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles">Profiles</a>
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  # is better than
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Profiles", controller: "profiles"
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles">Profiles</a>
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  # When name is +nil+ the href is presented instead
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to nil, "http://example.com"
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="http://www.example.com">http://www.example.com</a>
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  # You can use a block as well if your link target is hard to fit into the name parameter. ERB example:
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= link_to(@profile) do %>
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  #     <strong><%= @profile.name %></strong> -- <span>Check it out!</span>
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles/1">
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  #          <strong>David</strong> -- <span>Check it out!</span>
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  #        </a>
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  # Classes and ids for CSS are easy to produce:
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Articles", articles_path, id: "news", class: "article"
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/articles" class="article" id="news">Articles</a>
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  # Be careful when using the older argument style, as an extra literal hash is needed:
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Articles", { controller: "articles" }, id: "news", class: "article"
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/articles" class="article" id="news">Articles</a>
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  # Leaving the hash off gives the wrong link:
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "WRONG!", controller: "articles", id: "news", class: "article"
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/articles/index/news?class=article">WRONG!</a>
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  # +link_to+ can also produce links with anchors or query strings:
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Comment wall", profile_path(@profile, anchor: "wall")
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/profiles/1#wall">Comment wall</a>
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Ruby on Rails search", controller: "searches", query: "ruby on rails"
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/searches?query=ruby+on+rails">Ruby on Rails search</a>
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Nonsense search", searches_path(foo: "bar", baz: "quux")
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="/searches?foo=bar&amp;baz=quux">Nonsense search</a>
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  # The only option specific to +link_to+ (<tt>:method</tt>) is used as follows:
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to("Destroy", "http://www.example.com", method: :delete)
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href='http://www.example.com' rel="nofollow" data-method="delete">Destroy</a>
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  # You can also use custom data attributes using the <tt>:data</tt> option:
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "Visit Other Site", "http://www.rubyonrails.org/", data: { confirm: "Are you sure?" }
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="http://www.rubyonrails.org/" data-confirm="Are you sure?">Visit Other Site</a>
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                  # Also you can set any link attributes such as <tt>target</tt>, <tt>rel</tt>, <tt>type</tt>:
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                  #   link_to "External link", "http://www.rubyonrails.org/", target: "_blank", rel: "nofollow"
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => <a href="http://www.rubyonrails.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">External link</a>
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            1
            

            

                  def link_to(name = nil, options = nil, html_options = nil, &block)
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                    html_options, options, name = options, name, block if block_given?
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                    options ||= {}
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

            
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                    html_options = convert_options_to_data_attributes(options, html_options)
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

            
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                    url = url_for(options)
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                    html_options["href"] ||= url
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

            
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                    content_tag("a", name || url, html_options, &block)
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

            
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                  # Generates a form containing a single button that submits to the URL created
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                  # by the set of +options+. This is the safest method to ensure links that
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                  # cause changes to your data are not triggered by search bots or accelerators.
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                  # If the HTML button does not work with your layout, you can also consider
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                  # using the +link_to+ method with the <tt>:method</tt> modifier as described in
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                  # the +link_to+ documentation.
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                  # By default, the generated form element has a class name of <tt>button_to</tt>
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                  # to allow styling of the form itself and its children. This can be changed
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                  # using the <tt>:form_class</tt> modifier within +html_options+. You can control
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                  # the form submission and input element behavior using +html_options+.
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                  # This method accepts the <tt>:method</tt> modifier described in the +link_to+ documentation.
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                  # If no <tt>:method</tt> modifier is given, it will default to performing a POST operation.
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                  # You can also disable the button by passing <tt>disabled: true</tt> in +html_options+.
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  # If you are using RESTful routes, you can pass the <tt>:method</tt>
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                  # to change the HTTP verb used to submit the form.
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Options
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                  # The +options+ hash accepts the same options as +url_for+.
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

                  # There are a few special +html_options+:
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:method</tt> - \Symbol of HTTP verb. Supported verbs are <tt>:post</tt>, <tt>:get</tt>,
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>:delete</tt>, <tt>:patch</tt>, and <tt>:put</tt>. By default it will be <tt>:post</tt>.
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:disabled</tt> - If set to true, it will generate a disabled button.
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:data</tt> - This option can be used to add custom data attributes.
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:remote</tt> -  If set to true, will allow the Unobtrusive JavaScript drivers to control the
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

                  #   submit behavior. By default this behavior is an ajax submit.
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:form</tt> - This hash will be form attributes
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:form_class</tt> - This controls the class of the form within which the submit button will
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                  #   be placed
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:params</tt> - \Hash of parameters to be rendered as hidden fields within the form.
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Data attributes
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:confirm</tt> - This will use the unobtrusive JavaScript driver to
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  #   prompt with the question specified. If the user accepts, the link is
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  #   processed normally, otherwise no action is taken.
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:disable_with</tt> - Value of this parameter will be
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

                  #   used as the value for a disabled version of the submit
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  #   button when the form is submitted. This feature is provided
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                  #   by the unobtrusive JavaScript driver.
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                  # ==== Examples
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to "New", action: "new" %>
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form method="post" action="/controller/new" class="button_to">
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input value="New" type="submit" />
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </form>"
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to "New", new_article_path %>
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form method="post" action="/articles/new" class="button_to">
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input value="New" type="submit" />
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </form>"
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to [:make_happy, @user] do %>
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                  #     Make happy <strong><%= @user.name %></strong>
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                  #   <% end %>
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form method="post" action="/users/1/make_happy" class="button_to">
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <button type="submit">
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  #   #        Make happy <strong><%= @user.name %></strong>
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      </button>
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </form>"
          
      269. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    269. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to "New", { action: "new" }, form_class: "new-thing" %>
          
      271. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    271. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form method="post" action="/controller/new" class="new-thing">
          
      272. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    272. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input value="New" type="submit" />
          
      273. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    273. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </form>"
          
      274. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    274. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      275. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    275. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      276. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    276. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to "Create", { action: "create" }, remote: true, form: { "data-type" => "json" } %>
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form method="post" action="/images/create" class="button_to" data-remote="true" data-type="json">
          
      278. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    278. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input value="Create" type="submit" />
          
      279. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    279. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input name="authenticity_token" type="hidden" value="10f2163b45388899ad4d5ae948988266befcb6c3d1b2451cf657a0c293d605a6"/>
          
      280. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    280. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </form>"
          
      281. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    281. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      283. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    283. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to "Delete Image", { action: "delete", id: @image.id },
          
      284. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    284. 
            
            

            

                  #                                   method: :delete, data: { confirm: "Are you sure?" } %>
          
      285. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    285. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form method="post" action="/images/delete/1" class="button_to">
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input type="hidden" name="_method" value="delete" />
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input data-confirm='Are you sure?' value="Delete Image" type="submit" />
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      <input name="authenticity_token" type="hidden" value="10f2163b45388899ad4d5ae948988266befcb6c3d1b2451cf657a0c293d605a6"/>
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    </form>"
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

                  #   <%= button_to('Destroy', 'http://www.example.com',
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            
            

            

                  #             method: :delete, remote: true, data: { confirm: 'Are you sure?', disable_with: 'loading...' }) %>
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => "<form class='button_to' method='post' action='http://www.example.com' data-remote='true'>
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

                  #   #       <input name='_method' value='delete' type='hidden' />
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            
            

            

                  #   #       <input value='Destroy' type='submit' data-disable-with='loading...' data-confirm='Are you sure?' />
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            
            

            

                  #   #       <input name="authenticity_token" type="hidden" value="10f2163b45388899ad4d5ae948988266befcb6c3d1b2451cf657a0c293d605a6"/>
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                  #   #     </form>"
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            
            

            

                  #   #
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            1
            

            

                  def button_to(name = nil, options = nil, html_options = nil, &block)
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                    html_options, options = options, name if block_given?
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

                    options      ||= {}
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            
            

            

                    html_options ||= {}
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

                    html_options = html_options.stringify_keys
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

            
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

                    url    = options.is_a?(String) ? options : url_for(options)
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

                    remote = html_options.delete("remote")
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                    params = html_options.delete("params")
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

            
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                    method     = html_options.delete("method").to_s
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                    method_tag = BUTTON_TAG_METHOD_VERBS.include?(method) ? method_tag(method) : "".html_safe
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

            
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

                    form_method  = method == "get" ? "get" : "post"
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                    form_options = html_options.delete("form") || {}
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

                    form_options[:class] ||= html_options.delete("form_class") || "button_to"
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

                    form_options[:method] = form_method
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                    form_options[:action] = url
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                    form_options[:'data-remote'] = true if remote
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

            
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

                    request_token_tag = if form_method == "post"
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                      request_method = method.empty? ? "post" : method
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                      token_tag(nil, form_options: { action: url, method: request_method })
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                      ""
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

            
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

                    html_options = convert_options_to_data_attributes(options, html_options)
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

                    html_options["type"] = "submit"
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

            
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330.
