                  def cache_collection_render(instrumentation_payload, view, template, collection)
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                    return yield(collection) unless will_cache?(@options, view)
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                    collection_iterator = collection
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

            
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                    # Result is a hash with the key represents the
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                    # key used for cache lookup and the value is the item
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                    # on which the partial is being rendered
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                    keyed_collection, ordered_keys = collection_by_cache_keys(view, template, collection)
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

            
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                    # Pull all partials from cache
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                    # Result is a hash, key matches the entry in
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                    # `keyed_collection` where the cache was retrieved and the
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                    # value is the value that was present in the cache
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                    cached_partials = collection_cache.read_multi(*keyed_collection.keys)
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                    instrumentation_payload[:cache_hits] = cached_partials.size
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

            
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                    # Extract the items for the keys that are not found
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                    collection = keyed_collection.reject { |key, _| cached_partials.key?(key) }.values
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                    rendered_partials = collection.empty? ? [] : yield(collection_iterator.from_collection(collection))
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

            
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                    index = 0
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                    keyed_partials = fetch_or_cache_partial(cached_partials, template, order_by: keyed_collection.each_key) do
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                      # This block is called once
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                      # for every cache miss while preserving order.
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                      rendered_partials[index].tap { index += 1 }
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      48.

                  def callable_cache_key?
          
      55.

                    @options[:cached].respond_to?(:call)

                  def collection_by_cache_keys(view, template, collection)
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                    seed = callable_cache_key? ? @options[:cached] : ->(i) { i }
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                    digest_path = view.digest_path_from_template(template)
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

            
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                    collection.each_with_object([{}, []]) do |item, (hash, ordered_keys)|
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                      key = expanded_cache_key(seed.call(item), view, template, digest_path)
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                      ordered_keys << key
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                      hash[key] = item
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

            
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            1
            

            

                  def expanded_cache_key(key, view, template, digest_path)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                    key = view.combined_fragment_cache_key(view.cache_fragment_name(key, digest_path: digest_path))
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    key.frozen? ? key.dup : key # #read_multi & #write may require mutability, Dalli 2.6.0.
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

            
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  # `order_by` is an enumerable object containing keys of the cache,
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  # all keys are  passed in whether found already or not.
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  # `cached_partials` is a hash. If the value exists
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  # it represents the rendered partial from the cache
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  # otherwise `Hash#fetch` will take the value of its block.
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  # This method expects a block that will return the rendered
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  # partial. An example is to render all results
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  # for each element that was not found in the cache and store it as an array.
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  # Order it so that the first empty cache element in `cached_partials`
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  # corresponds to the first element in `rendered_partials`.
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  # If the partial is not already cached it will also be
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  # written back to the underlying cache store.
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            1
            

            

                  def fetch_or_cache_partial(cached_partials, template, order_by:)
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                    order_by.index_with do |cache_key|
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                      if content = cached_partials[cache_key]
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                        build_rendered_template(content, template)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                        yield.tap do |rendered_partial|
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                          collection_cache.write(cache_key, rendered_partial.body)
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      102.

                  def build_view_context_class(klass, supports_path, routes, helpers)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                    Class.new(klass) do
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                      if routes
          
      54.

                        include routes.url_helpers(supports_path)
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                        include routes.mounted_helpers
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      57.

    58. 
            
            

            

                      if helpers
          
      59.

                        include helpers
          
      60.

                # An instance of a view class. The default view class is ActionView::Base.

                # * <tt>View.new(lookup_context, assigns, controller)</tt>  Create a new

                def render_to_body(options = {})

                private
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                  # Find and render a template based on the options given.
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            1
            

            

                  def _render_template(options)
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                    variant = options.delete(:variant)
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                    assigns = options.delete(:assigns)
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                    context = view_context
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

            
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                    context.assign assigns if assigns
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                    lookup_context.variants = variant if variant
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

            
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                    rendered_template = context.in_rendering_context(options) do |renderer|
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                      renderer.render_to_object(context, options)
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

            
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                    rendered_format = rendered_template.format || lookup_context.formats.first
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                    @rendered_format = Template::Types[rendered_format]
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

            
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                    rendered_template.body
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

            
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  # Assign the rendered format to look up context.
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            1
            

            

                  def _process_format(format)
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                    super
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                    lookup_context.formats = [format.to_sym] if format.to_sym
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

            
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  # Normalize args by converting render "foo" to render :action => "foo" and
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  # render "foo/bar" to render :template => "foo/bar".
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            1
            

            

                  def _normalize_args(action = nil, options = {})
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                    options = super(action, options)
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                    case action
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                    when NilClass
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                    when Hash
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                      options = action
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                    when String, Symbol
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                      action = action.to_s
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                      key = action.include?(?/) ? :template : :action
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                      options[key] = action
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                      if action.respond_to?(:permitted?) && action.permitted?
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                        options = action
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                      elsif action.respond_to?(:render_in)
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                        options[:object] = action
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                        options[:partial] = action
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

            
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                    options
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  # Normalize options.
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            1
            

            

                  def _normalize_options(options)
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                    options = super(options)
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                    if options[:partial] == true
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                      options[:partial] = action_name
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                    if (options.keys & [:partial, :file, :template]).empty?
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                      options[:prefixes] ||= _prefixes
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

            
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                    options[:template] ||= (options[:action] || action_name).to_s
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                    options
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      173.

    lib/action_view/routing_url_for.rb

    25.64% lines covered

    39 relevant lines. 10 lines covered and 29 lines missed.

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            1
            

            

            require "action_dispatch/routing/polymorphic_routes"
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            1
            

            

            module ActionView
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            1
            

            

              module RoutingUrlFor
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                # Returns the URL for the set of +options+ provided. This takes the
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                # same options as +url_for+ in Action Controller (see the
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                # documentation for <tt>ActionController::Base#url_for</tt>). Note that by default
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>:only_path</tt> is <tt>true</tt> so you'll get the relative "/controller/action"
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                # instead of the fully qualified URL like "http://example.com/controller/action".
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Options
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:anchor</tt> - Specifies the anchor name to be appended to the path.
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:only_path</tt> - If true, returns the relative URL (omitting the protocol, host name, and port) (<tt>true</tt> by default unless <tt>:host</tt> is specified).
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:trailing_slash</tt> - If true, adds a trailing slash, as in "/archive/2005/". Note that this
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                #   is currently not recommended since it breaks caching.
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:host</tt> - Overrides the default (current) host if provided.
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:protocol</tt> - Overrides the default (current) protocol if provided.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:user</tt> - Inline HTTP authentication (only plucked out if <tt>:password</tt> is also present).
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                # * <tt>:password</tt> - Inline HTTP authentication (only plucked out if <tt>:user</tt> is also present).
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Relying on named routes
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                # Passing a record (like an Active Record) instead of a hash as the options parameter will
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                # trigger the named route for that record. The lookup will happen on the name of the class. So passing a
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                # Workshop object will attempt to use the +workshop_path+ route. If you have a nested route, such as
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                # +admin_workshop_path+ you'll have to call that explicitly (it's impossible for +url_for+ to guess that route).
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Implicit Controller Namespacing
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                # Controllers passed in using the +:controller+ option will retain their namespace unless it is an absolute one.
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                # ==== Examples
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'index') %>
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /blogs/
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'find', controller: 'books') %>
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /books/find
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'login', controller: 'members', only_path: false, protocol: 'https') %>
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                #   # => https://www.example.com/members/login/
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'play', anchor: 'player') %>
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /messages/play/#player
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'jump', anchor: 'tax&ship') %>
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /testing/jump/#tax&ship
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(Workshop.new) %>
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                #   # relies on Workshop answering a persisted? call (and in this case returning false)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /workshops
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(@workshop) %>
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                #   # calls @workshop.to_param which by default returns the id
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /workshops/5
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                #   # to_param can be re-defined in a model to provide different URL names:
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /workshops/1-workshop-name
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for("http://www.example.com") %>
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                #   # => http://www.example.com
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(:back) %>
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                #   # if request.env["HTTP_REFERER"] is set to "http://www.example.com"
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                #   # => http://www.example.com
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(:back) %>
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                #   # if request.env["HTTP_REFERER"] is not set or is blank
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                #   # => javascript:history.back()
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'index', controller: 'users') %>
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                #   # Assuming an "admin" namespace
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                #   # => /admin/users
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= url_for(action: 'index', controller: '/users') %>
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                #   # Specify absolute path with beginning slash

                def url_for(options = nil)

                # === Encodings in ActionView::Template
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                # ActionView::Template is one of a few sources of potential
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                # encoding issues in Rails. This is because the source for
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                # templates are usually read from disk, and Ruby (like most
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                # encoding-aware programming languages) assumes that the
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                # String retrieved through File IO is encoded in the
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>default_external</tt> encoding. In Rails, the default
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>default_external</tt> encoding is UTF-8.
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                # As a result, if a user saves their template as ISO-8859-1
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                # (for instance, using a non-Unicode-aware text editor),
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                # and uses characters outside of the ASCII range, their
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                # users will see diamonds with question marks in them in
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                # the browser.
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                # For the rest of this documentation, when we say "UTF-8",
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                # we mean "UTF-8 or whatever the default_internal encoding
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                # is set to". By default, it will be UTF-8.
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                # To mitigate this problem, we use a few strategies:
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                # 1. If the source is not valid UTF-8, we raise an exception
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                #    when the template is compiled to alert the user
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                #    to the problem.
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                # 2. The user can specify the encoding using Ruby-style
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                #    encoding comments in any template engine. If such
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                #    a comment is supplied, Rails will apply that encoding
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                #    to the resulting compiled source returned by the
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                #    template handler.
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                # 3. In all cases, we transcode the resulting String to
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                #    the UTF-8.
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                # This means that other parts of Rails can always assume
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                # that templates are encoded in UTF-8, even if the original
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                # source of the template was not UTF-8.
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                # From a user's perspective, the easiest thing to do is
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                # to save your templates as UTF-8. If you do this, you
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                # do not need to do anything else for things to "just work".
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                # === Instructions for template handlers
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                # The easiest thing for you to do is to simply ignore
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                # encodings. Rails will hand you the template source
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                # as the default_internal (generally UTF-8), raising
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                # an exception for the user before sending the template
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                # to you if it could not determine the original encoding.
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                # For the greatest simplicity, you can support only
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                # UTF-8 as the <tt>default_internal</tt>. This means
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                # that from the perspective of your handler, the
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                # entire pipeline is just UTF-8.
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                # === Advanced: Handlers with alternate metadata sources
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                # If you want to provide an alternate mechanism for
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                # specifying encodings (like ERB does via <%# encoding: ... %>),
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                # you may indicate that you will handle encodings yourself
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                # by implementing <tt>handles_encoding?</tt> on your handler.
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                # If you do, Rails will not try to encode the String
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                # into the default_internal, passing you the unaltered
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                # bytes tagged with the assumed encoding (from
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                # default_external).
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                # In this case, make sure you return a String from
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                # your handler encoded in the default_internal. Since
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                # you are handling out-of-band metadata, you are
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                # also responsible for alerting the user to any
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                # problems with converting the user's data to
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                # the <tt>default_internal</tt>.
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                # To do so, simply raise +WrongEncodingError+ as follows:
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                #     raise WrongEncodingError.new(
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                #       problematic_string,
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                #       expected_encoding
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                #     )
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

            
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                ##
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                # :method: local_assigns
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a hash with the defined local variables.
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                # Given this sub template rendering:
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                #   <%= render "shared/header", { headline: "Welcome", person: person } %>
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                # You can use +local_assigns+ in the sub templates to access the local variables:
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                #   local_assigns[:headline] # => "Welcome"
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            1
            

            

                eager_autoload do

                  autoload :Error

                extend Template::Handlers
          
      123.

                attr_reader :identifier, :handler, :original_encoding, :updated_at

                attr_reader :variable, :format, :variant, :locals, :virtual_path
